description: Rachel Kurtz Rosenberg and Khalil William Savary were married Saturday at Studio 450, an event space in Manhattan. Barbara L. Behrmann, a Humanist Society celebrant, officiated.

title: Western Peace Activists Protest in Pakistan Against Drone Strikes
description: 8:55 a.m. | Updated

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Oct. 7
description: With the first presidential debate under the candidates belts, both campaigns are working to spin the outcome to their advantage as they look ahead to the vice presidential debate on Thursday. Representatives from both the Obama and Romney camps will join the Sunday shows to talk about what happened last Wednesday  and what will happen next.

title: After Sons Death, As Reliever Finds Sense of Normalcy on Mound
description: DETROIT  On the most emotional night that Oakland Athletics reliever Pat Neshek has spent in the majors, when almost every question about the loss of his infant son left him on the verge of tears, one practical matter made him laugh.

title: Stewart and OReilly Share Stage in Political Joust
description: It was a battle for hearts and minds, a chance to appeal to those who see the world differently and try to move those realities just a little closer together.

title: Reds Lose Starter but Win Opener Against Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO  What was expected to be an extended pitching duel between two Cy Young Award candidates at a pitching-friendly ballpark was unpredictably unraveled by an eight-pitch performance on one side and an unusually rocky one on the other.

title: Sept. 30-Oct. 6: The Week of the First Debate
description: The Mitt Romney on display this week was looser and more relaxed. President Obama followed a passive debate performance with a more aggressive stance.

title: U.S. Agrees to Let South Korea Extend Range of Ballistic Missiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea has reached an agreement with the United States that lets it more than double the range of its ballistic missiles to counter what it considers to be a growing threat from North Korea.

title: Stephanopoulizing
description: My head talks on This Week this morning. Yes, Im jet-lagged out of my mind.

title: Philippine Rebel Group Agrees to Peace Accord to End Violence in South
description: MANILA  President Benigno S. Aquino III announced Sunday that the Philippine government had reached a deal with a major rebel group that officials hope will reduce the persistent violence in the southern part of the country.

title: Sleepovers With My 9-Year-Old Daughter
description: When I was in high school in the late 80s, I took a job baby-sitting for a single mother with a 9-year-old boy. I didnt know the family well. The father was absent from the situation, and the mother appeared overwhelmed. The kid ran the show, and he got what he wanted by throwing fits, stomping his feet and pouting. The mother doted on her son, and spoke to him in a syrupy baby talk that made my skin crawl.

title: Romney Ad Says Obama Distorts Tax Cut Plan
description: In a television ad released Sunday, the Romney campaign returned to one of the most contentious issues of the presidential debate, accusing President Obama of falsely claiming that Mitt Romney would cut $5 trillion in taxes.

title: Disruptions: With a 3-D Printer, Building a Gun With the Push of a Button
description: It has long been possible to make a gun at home. But what happens when it no longer takes knowledge and skill to build one?

title: The Payroll Data
description: Another quick note, this time on what the payroll data say. Again, you want to focus on somewhat longer-term trends, not monthly numbers. Over the past year the employer survey says that weve added 1.8 million jobs, or 150,000 a month:

title: Newswallah: Long Reads Edition
description: A lengthy article in The New Yorker takes a close look at Indias newspaper industry, which, unlike the newspaper industry in the United States  which has lost 50 percent of its advertising revenue in the past five years  is thriving. There are an estimated 80,000 newspapers in India, the article finds, 85 percent of which are printed in one of Indias 22 official regional languages, and the circulation of English-language newspapers is growing 1.5 percent each year.

title: Ethiopians Sweep Chicago Marathon
description: CHICAGO  Tsegaye Kebede crossed the finish line at Grant Park on Sunday with his country on his mind. He raised his arms, gave thumbs-up to the crowd and took in the applause as he became the first Ethiopian man to win the Chicago Marathon, setting a course record in the process.

title: The Rumble That Wasnt Entirely Live Online
description: 6:46 p.m. | Updated

title: Group Sends First Rocket Under Deal With NASA
description: The first commercial cargo flight to the International Space Station lifted off on Sunday evening, inaugurating a new era for NASA in which private companies will take over the transportation of people and supplies to low-Earth orbit.

title: Liam Neeson Leads Box Office With Taken 2
description: Liam Neesons already hot box-office streak got hotter over the weekend, while Tim Burtons already cold one became, well, colder. Taken 2 (20th Century Fox), starring Mr. Neeson as a retired C.I.A. operative, was No. 1 at North American theaters, taking in about $50 million, about twice the amount of its 2009 franchise predecessor. Mr. Neeson, 60, has recently become one of Hollywoods most bankable stars, turning small action films like Unknown and The Grey into hits. For the weekend, Hotel Transylvania (Sony) was second, taking in about $26.3 million, for a two-week total of $76 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box-office data.

title: Axelrod Says Obama Will Review Tape of Debate
description: As senior adviser for the Obama campaign, David Axelrod knows that his public criticisms of the boss should be exceedingly rare, and oh-so-gently worded when they do come. But he made it clear on Sunday, however indirectly, that President Obama was less than thrilled by his debate performance on Wednesday and that he would be making some changes.

title: As Military Suicides Rise, Focus Is on Private Weapons
description: With nearly half of all suicides in the military having been committed with privately owned firearms, the Pentagon and Congress are moving to establish policies intended to separate at-risk service members from their personal weapons.

title: Friedels Streak of Starts Is Over
description: There was an American in Tottenham Hotspurs starting 11 against visiting Aston Villa on Sunday in north London.

title: For Software, Cracks in the Patent System
description: When the nations patent system was born, many inventions were mechanical. Some say the patent system is ill suited for todays digital world, where innovations like software are often based on abstract concepts.

title: Chvez Wins New Term in Venezuela, Holding Off Surge by Opposition
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Hugo Chvez, long a fiery foe of Washington, won re-election on Sunday, facing down cancer and the strongest electoral challenge of his nearly 14 years in office and gaining a new mandate to deepen his socialist revolution.

title: To Regulate Rapid Traders, S.E.C. Turns to One of Them
description: RED BANK, N.J.  As billions of shares course through the stock market each day, investors rely on the government to keep up with Wall Streets rapid-fire traders.

title: Europe Still at Odds Over the Workings of Its Bailout Fund
description: BRUSSELS  It has been referred to as the bazooka  the 500 billion euro European bailout fund that after much dispute will have its first board meeting on Monday.

title: Romney and G.O.P. Make Inroads in Silicon Valley
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When President Obama makes his latest foray into Silicon Valley on Monday, he will face a technology industry more engaged than ever in the wheeling and dealing of Washington, and much more forthcoming with its political contributions  including, generously, to his rival, Mitt Romney.

title: Highlights and Analysis From Game 1 of Orioles-Yankees
description: The Orioles and Yankees have been as close as two teams can be down the stretch since early September, when Baltimore pulled even for the American League East lead after trailing by 10 games. The two teams got a little closer Sunday when they opened their A.L. Division Series, which stayed tied for most of the game until the Yankees broke it up with a ninth-inning rally.

title: Week in Pictures for Oct. 5
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include the opening event at the Barclays Center, police layoffs in Camden, New Jersey, and a shooting involving the police in Queens.

title: Desperately Chasing Jobs in a Polarized Wisconsin Town
description: In 2008, Brad Lichtenstein began filming a modest documentary about the effects of the recession, specifically the closing of a General Motors plant, on Janesville, Wis., a small Midwestern city. Thats how he found himself, a few years later, with an up-close view of one of the meanest and most dramatic chapters in recent American politics: the battle over collective-bargaining rights for Wisconsin state employees and the subsequent effort to recall the Republican governor, Scott Walker, from office.

title: Keeping Up the Spirit of Bach and Carrying On
description: It was a happy reunion of survivors last week as Bach at One, the young and sturdy oak of Trinity Wall Streets music program, opened its season at St. Pauls Chapel on Monday, and Pipes at One, an offshoot, took root on Wednesday. First among the survivors was the building itself, The Little Chapel That Stood, as A. B. Curtiss titled her childrens book about it.

title: A Writer With Wit and Bite Proves Hes Not Dead Yet
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  A few months ago the writer and broadcaster Clive James read with some alarm that he was about to die.

title: The Joys of Letting Life Glide Along
description: There are long moments in Rob Lists Play by Ear where you could imagine an alternate title for this 70-minute work, maybe something along the lines of Still Life: Man With Radiators.

title: A Feisty Debate Between Candidates in Connecticut Senate Race
description: Facing off in a feisty and highly personal debate on Sunday, the candidates in Connecticuts closely contested race for United States Senate seemed determined to prove that they had gleaned a lesson from President Obamas lethargic performance from last week: attack early and often.

title: Bach Is Still Revving Up Engine of Musical Innovation
description: Paul Elie begins his intriguingly titled Reinventing Bach with a charming anecdote that seems, at first, a neat frame for his argument. He recalls visiting a museum of historic musical instruments in Berlin, where he was very moved to see the harpsichord that belonged to Bach.

title: Myriad Ways for the Facets in the Crown of Ballet to Sparkle and Shine
description: With so many great ballets in its repertory, New York City Ballet constantly faces the challenge of how to group and arrange its jewels. The choices arent always coherent. At the David H. Koch Theater on Thursday, however, the programming was illuminating. Each dance brought out colors in the rest.

title: Two Paths Through Dartmouth Meet in a U.S. Senate Race
description: Perhaps no school in the Ivy League resisted coeducation as fiercely as Dartmouth College.

title: Little Lives Caught in a Troubled No Mans Land
description: As rough and tumble as the lives it documents, In My Mothers Arms profiles a stopgap orphanage in one of Baghdads toughest neighborhoods. Headed by Husham Al Thabe, a pensive young father whose emotions run silent and deep, this two-bedroom shelter serves 32 boys in various stages of loss and displacement.

title: A Star and a Utility Man Bring Tigers Within Win of Advancing
description: DETROIT  The postgame celebration featured Don Kelly lifting Prince Fielder off the ground. Think about that for a moment. Kelly had just driven in the winning run in the bottom of the ninth for the Detroit Tigers, so clearly, the wrong person was doing the lifting. And the stocky Fielder is not exactly an easy hoist.

title: Rebels Clash With Syrian Security Forces Near Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Rebel fighters and security forces in Syria clashed near the border with Lebanon and fought over a military barracks in Aleppo on Sunday, while Turkish artillery fired into Syria for a fifth consecutive day in retaliation for cross-border shelling.

title: What Now? Following What Ifs?
description: You would be married to some feed salesman, Megans opinionated lesbian roommate suggests.

title: A Sluggish Start, but a Rousing Response
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  On the N.F.L. players degree of desirability scale, a Sunday 1 p.m. home game against a seemingly inferior opponent ought to be something close to the pinnacle. An early breakfast, brisk warm-up and breezy victory ideally leaves plenty of time to celebrate and make it to the couch well before the prime-time game kicks off.

title: Reasons Matter (When Intuitions Dont Object)
description: This post by the psychologist Jonathan Haidt is a response to two previous articles in The Stone  one by Gary Gutting, the other by Michael P. Lynch  which argued against certain views on reason found in Haidts recent book, The Righteous Mind.

title: A Choreographer Emerges, Assisted by the Chinese Zodiac
description: When someone in a corps de ballet gets a shot in the spotlight and shines, it can be the stuff of legend: a star is born. Thats unusual enough, but what happened at the David H. Koch Theater on Friday night is even less common. The someone who emerged from the corps of New York City Ballet was a choreographer, the rare real thing. And he didnt leave his fellow corps members behind in his glory. He shared it with them.

title: Mad Men Era Women: Their Tale
description: Though you couldnt tell it from the delighted expressions of the women theyre dancing with, the men at the Christmas office party are real stiffs. Sure, theyre tall, dark and kind of handsome, if your tastes run to buttoned-down, Scotch-scented swagger.

title: Asia Pacific Bridge Federation Championships
description: The seventh Asia Pacific Bridge Federation championships took place in Fukuoka, Japan, from Aug. 25 to Sept. 2.

title: Wives Take the Campaign to Newsstands
description: As the candidates for president debate in the press over weighty topics like taxes and health care, their wives are waging their own campaigns in womens and celebrity magazines to show voters their spouses softer sides.

title: Footnote
description: Houghton Mifflin Harcourt announced on Sunday that it had acquired the United States rights to publish a previously unknown work by J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fall of Arthur. The book, set for publication in May, chronicles the last days of King Arthur and will be edited by Tolkiens son Christopher, who will also provide commentary and notes. Tolkien, the author of The Lord of the Rings, died in 1973. This is the first new work by him to be unearthed since The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrun was released in 2009.

title: Restoring Film Gems, Pre-Code or Political
description: As the New York Film Festival slides into its final weekend on Friday, the falls other major cinematic event opens on Thursday, just a few blocks away. Celebrating its 10th anniversary, To Save and Project, the Museum of Modern Arts international celebration of film preservation, offers a dense and varied collection of films that feels like a festival in itself  one that, unlike most, isnt subject to the tyranny of the present.

title: Libyas Prime Minister Is Dismissed
description: CAIRO  The Libyan Parliament voted on Sunday to dismiss the prime minister it chose less than four weeks ago, deepening a leadership crisis at a moment when the countrys transitional authorities are under intense pressure to catch the killers of the American ambassador, J. Christopher Stevens, and to stop the prevailing lawlessness that led to his death.

title: Duo + One
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Dave Sarpola made his New York Times debut earlier this year, and today he offers us a rather strange puzzle: its infested with FLIES. Theyre all over the grid.

title: Giving New Life, Even to the Hoary
description: Throughout his long career the conductor Riccardo Muti has proved himself expert at revealing subtleties in pieces that on the surface may seem musically obvious. He did this thrillingly on Wednesday night, when the Chicago Symphony Orchestra opened the Carnegie Hall season with a stunning performance of Orffs Carmina Burana. Mr. Muti treated that pummeling, elemental score with respect and brought out great tenderness in the music that most accounts miss.

title: Lured In by a Family Just Being Itself on TV
description: WEST MONROE, La.  The moments before a religious service begins are generally ones of quiet reflection for the congregants, but on a recent Sunday at Whites Ferry Road Church of Christ here something incongruous was going on two-thirds of the way back in the spacious hall.

description: Accounts

description: A capsule look at the Giants 41-27 victory over the Browns on Sunday.

title: Duck Dynasty
description: A look at the family behind A&Es popular reality show.

title: New York City Ballet
description: Photos of Year of the Rabbit and other works.

title: Report to Reveal Evidence in Armstrong Drug Case
description: The United States Anti-Doping Agency is preparing to unveil some details of its doping case against Lance Armstrong this week, a move bound to send more shocks through the bruised sport of cycling.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released will include wholesale trade for August and the Federal Reserve beige book (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, trade deficit for August and import prices for September (Thursday); and the Producer Price Index for Septemberthe Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for October (Friday).

title: Lowe, With Impressive Final Stretch, Earns Spot on Postseason Roster
description: BALTIMORE  As recently as two weeks ago Derek Lowe was certain he would not be on the Yankees roster for the American League division series. Acquired as a free agent on Aug. 13, Lowe had only been used sparingly, and when he expressed his pessimism about making the roster in the middle of September, he may have been right.

title: The Presidential Campaign on Social Media
description: Its not enough for the presidential candidates Barack Obama and Mitt Romney to kiss babies, shake hands and lunch at small-town diners to win over voters. In 2012, they also need to cozy up to citizens online.

title: Campaigns Use Social Media to Lure Younger Voters
description: In 2012, it is not enough for candidates to shake some hands, kiss a baby or two and run some TV ads. They also need to be posting funny little animations on the blogging site Tumblr.

title: Pith Follows British Leader on Twitter
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron must have felt kind of cool, if a little late, when he joined Twitter on Saturday. I promise there wont be too many tweets ...  he wrote in his first message, as if quoting someone.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: In observance of Columbus Day, bond markets will be closed on Monday. Stock markets will be open for trading. The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes the weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills on Tuesday and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: A Parting Glance at Ad Week 2012
description: HERE is a look at some highlights, lowlights and sidelights of Advertising Week 2012, which took place from Monday through Friday in New York.

title: Nationals Edge Out Cardinals With Late Rally
description: ST. LOUIS  Somehow, even as Gio Gonzalez spiraled uncharacteristically out of control, his team never followed suit.

title: Brain Scan
description: The series is featuring occasional works of fiction. This is one.

title: Canada Puts Spotlight on War of 1812, With U.S. as Villain
description: DUNVEGAN, Ontario  Although it produced The Star-Spangled Banner, the War of 1812 does not get much attention in the United States. In Canada, however, the federal government is devoting surprising attention to the bicentennial of the conflict, which it describes bluntly in a new television commercial as an act of American aggression against Canada.

title: Giants Replay: Week 5
description: All the action in the Giants 41-27 victory over the Browns, including a big day from running back Ahmad Bradshaw and three touchdown passes by Eli Manning.

title: In Pakistan, Drone Protest Takes Detour for Safety
description: TANK, Pakistan  Imran Khan, a cricket star turned opposition politician, abandoned plans to hold a much-heralded rally against American drone strikes at a village deep inside Pakistans tribal belt on Sunday after the Pakistani military warned him of imminent danger if he went ahead with the event.

title: Oct. 7: National Polls Show Signs of Settling
description: Mitt Romney remains in a considerably stronger polling position than he was before last Wednesdays debate in Denver. But the polls released on Sunday did not tell quite as optimistic a story for him as those in the debates immediate aftermath.

title: Venezuelans Line Up Before Dawn to Vote in Midtown
description: Alejandro Fandio awoke at 3 a.m. on Sunday and drove from his home in Dover, N.J., to the Venezuelan Consulate in New York, hoping to be first in line to vote in Venezuelas presidential election.

title: Romneys Missing Foreign Policy
description: IF it hadnt been for the deadly Sept. 11 attack on the United States Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, Mitt Romney probably wouldnt be giving a speech on foreign policy in the waning weeks of this election season. But Mr. Romney sensed an opening in President Obamas missteps in Libya, and on Monday he plans to lay out his case that he will be a better steward of Americas national security.

title: No Strangers to Yankees, Orioles Face New Pressure
description: BALTIMORE  Orioles Manager Buck Showalter said before Sundays game that the biggest challenge he faced would be keeping the emotions of his players in check, this being Baltimores first playoff game since Oct. 15, 1997.

title: Lebanon Says Israeli Planes Circled Its Airspace for an Hour
description: JERUSALEM  The morning after the Israeli Air Force shot down an unidentified drone in the Negev Desert, the Lebanese government said that four Israeli warplanes spent an hour on Sunday illegally circling in its airspace.

title: For Judge in Firefighter Discrimination Case, an Evolving Opinion
description: One after another, nearly 150 white firefighters approached a lectern facing a federal judge and, voices sometimes trembling with anger, decried what they called a perversion of justice. Years of hard work to make it into the ranks of the department were being tossed aside to make way for unqualified minority candidates, they said, all in a questionable effort to end discrimination.

title: October Fortunes Seem Beyond Oaklands Reach
description: DETROIT  There were two outs and two on and the triple crown winner at the plate in the seventh inning Sunday for the Detroit Tigers. Out in faraway center field, under the Chevrolet Fountain, Coco Crisp played deep. He would not let a ball sail over his head, and he would race in for anything shallow.

title: Happy Birthday, Mr. President: Putin Turns 60, and Russians Pay Notice
description: MOSCOW  So what does President Vladimir V. Putin think about inevitably becoming a retiree?

title: Inquiry Finds That Four Rebecca Investors Did Not Exist
description: The lawyer for the lead producer of the Broadway musical Rebecca, which collapsed after the reported death from malaria of a mysterious investor, said on Sunday that he had confirmed that the investor and three others brought in by a middleman with a history of civil fraud complaints never existed.

title: Vettel Wins Second Straight, and Kobayashi Shines at Home
description: SUZUKA, Japan  The 2012 Formula One championship just keeps on renewing itself, freshening itself up and creating unpredictable, entertaining stories.

title: Stop and Frisk, Part 3
description: The New York City Police Department has come under criticism in recent years for arresting people for trespassing in public housing, often for little or no reason. The trespassing arrests are a variation on the citys broader, and highly controversial, stop-and-frisk program. On Thursday, Judge Shira Scheindlin of Federal District Court in Manhattan added her voice to the chorus, ruling that a lawsuit challenging police arrests for trespassing in public housing could move closer to trial. The city had tried to have most of the plaintiffs claims dismissed.

title: Randles Study Session Pays Off
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When Giants quarterback Eli Manning texted Rueben Randle on Thursday and asked him to join him in watching film of the Cleveland Browns defense, Randle, a rookie wide receiver, eagerly grasped that helping hand.

title: Safer Streets for New York
description: The streets of New York City have become a lot more dangerous in the last year. Mayor Michael Bloombergs latest management report that tracks city data shows that traffic fatalities, including those caused in car crashes, were up to 291 between July 2011 and June 2012, compared with 236 deaths in the previous 12-month period. New York does better at protecting its population from traffic deaths than some cities, including Los Angeles. But the death rate is still unacceptably high compared with places that police traffic better, like Paris and Tokyo.

title: Ye Olde Partisanship Is Nothing New
description: WASHINGTON  An American political system marked by partisanship and polarization engenders despair from both Republicans and Democrats.

title: California Moves to Reduce Gas Prices
description: LOS ANGELES  With gasoline prices reaching record highs across California over the last week, Gov. Jerry Brown moved on Sunday to alleviate some of the pain at the pump.

title: A Gloomy Season for Dairy Farmers
description: Last week began without a farm bill, a legislative lapse of shameful proportions. Since 1949, the bill has always been renewed, but not this year. Even so, most of the 2012 crop is still covered by loans, insurance programs and commodity supports until the end of the year  with one important exception.

title: Still a Conservative Provocateur, Carlson Angles for Clicks, Not Fights
description: A week ago, Tucker Carlson cued up a video of President Obama that had been sent to him by a source. The video, recorded in 2007 when Mr. Obama was a presidential candidate, showed him speaking to a black audience about quiet riots in the black community and the differences in the federal governments responses to the Sept. 11 attacks and Hurricane Katrina.

title: For Pastor Trying to Keep Daughter Alive, Party Is Grim
description: It was the pastors birthday at Antioch Missionary Church in Flushing, Queens, and members of the church, mostly Korean, were preparing a special Sunday lunch for him.

title: A Paris Review Mobile App
description: Literary magazines have taken their time emerging from a solely paper-and-ink world, but now it is routine for them to supplement their printed material with Web sites, blogs and Twitter feeds. On Monday, the Paris Review, the venerable journal founded in 1953 by Harold L. Humes, Peter Matthiessen and George Plimpton, will go a step further, introducing an app for the iPad and iPhone that is almost a year in the making.

title: Truth About Jobs
description: If anyone had doubts about the madness that has spread through a large part of the American political spectrum, the reaction to Fridays better-than expected report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics should have settled the issue. For the immediate response of many on the right  and were not just talking fringe figures  was to cry conspiracy.

title: MetroCards Go on Sale With Ads on Both Sides
description: It sputtered out of the subway vending machine, an oddity that deserved careful examination. Some riders asked a station agent how to swipe it. One woman was confused about whether it was even a MetroCard at all.

title: Only One Way for Orioles to End This Season Happily
description: Baltimore

title: That Indescribable Pink of The Financial Times
description: Salmon? Pink?

title: With Affirmative Action, Indias Rich Gain School Slots Meant for Poor
description: CHENNAI, India  The two women both claim that affirmative action cost them coveted spots at elite public universities. Both cases have now reached the Supreme Court.

title: For Both Campaigns, Time to Fine-Tune Their Messages
description: Presidential candidates win when they adapt. And that is exactly whatMitt Romney andPresident Obama are each trying to do.

title: The Cacophony of Money
description: Two-thirds of the $50 million spent on Mitt Romneys behalf in Ohio has come from outside super PACs and other so-called independent groups, and yet Mr. Romney has lagged behind in all of the major Ohio polls. Hundreds of millions in third-party spending from unlimited checks, much of it from undisclosed donors, has also failed to give Mr. Romney a clear lead in any of the other swing states.

title: How to Die
description: ONE morning last month, Anthony Gilbey awakened from anesthesia in a hospital in the east of England. At his bedside were his daughter and an attending physician.

title: With Biden Up Next to Debate, Obamas Aides Plot Comeback
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas campaign is working feverishly to restore its momentum after a lackluster debate performance last week, an effort that began with a conference call 10 minutes before the debate even ended and led to new advertisements, a rewritten stump speech, a carefully timed leak and a reversal of months-old strategy.

title: Patriots Play Keep-Away for Victory Over Manning
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  In the dozen times they had met before, Peyton Manning and Tom Brady had forged an epic rivalry, the greatest quarterbacks of their generation creating monuments to electric passing and scintillating competition.

title: N.H.L. Replacement Players Would Be Illegal in Two Provinces
description: Would the N.H.L. dare to employ replacement players?

title: The Patent, Used as a Sword
description: When Apple announced last year that all iPhones would come with a voice-activated assistant named Siri, capable of answering spoken questions, Michael Phillipss heart sank.

title: Spinning Gaffes Into Gags: Live From New York, Its Debate Night
description: All last week, Lorne Michaels, the creator and longtime executive producer of Saturday Night Live was working the phone trying to nail down a visit to the show from either of this years presidential candidates. By late Friday, it looked like it wouldnt happen, at least for this last week.

title: As SEC Sees Power Shift, Spurrier Has to Smile
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  It was a slight jab, delivered as always with a wry smile, as if South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier could not help himself. His Gamecocks had beaten Georgia so thoroughly Saturday that Bulldogs fans had left the stadium, hailed taxis and gone to sulk before the first quarter was over. This had not been an innocent misstep by Georgia but an honest declaration by South Carolina that it was the better team.

title: Do We Need Professional Critics?
Patents Teaser
description: Some say the patent system is ill suited for the digital world.

title: Turning Politics Into Humor
description: The high political season is high anxiety season for Saturday Night Live, which retains its reputation as the home for the defining parodies of political candidates.

title: At First Practice, Nets Praise Intimate Feel of Arena
description: Jay-Z had departed, taking his verses, his stage and his Brooklyn slide show with him. The Harlem Globetrotters had not yet arrived. For two hours, at least, Barclays Center belonged to its primary tenant  along with a few dozen workers wielding power tools.

title: A Charitable Wash
description: In Phoenix, carwashes allow groups, whether cheerleaders or church congregants, to raise money for their causes.

title: Channel Surfing: Dexter in Uncharted Waters
description: This season, the critics Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger are checking out favorite shows and seeing how they hold up. Previous entries in this series include posts on New Girl, NCIS, Scandal, The Good Wife and 30 Rock.

title: Corrections: October 8, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Fighting for a Cause With Soap and Suds
description: PHOENIX  There are about 600 cars for every 1,000 residents here, federal officials estimate, and roughly 300 carwashing businesses listed in the Yellow Pages. But there are also benefit carwashes just about every weekend for all sorts of purposes and needs.

title: Slain Mans Video a Factor in Convention Arrest Suits
description: The video shows lines of police officers herding protesters, a commander suggesting a way to disperse and a milling crowd, including a marching band with an impromptu parade behind it, with curious onlookers watching from sidewalks on East 16th Street.

title: Lincecum Will Not Start Game 3; He Will Probably Work Out of Bullpen
description: SAN FRANCISCO  No debate has taken up more oxygen in the Bay Area the past week than the one over Tim Lincecum and his role for the Giants this postseason.

title: Amid Successes, W.N.B.A. Is Still Facing Challenges
description: With all the good news that it has to shout about, the W.N.B.A. may be the quietest professional sports league in the United States.

title: Relatives Rally at Protest of Fatal Police Shooting
description: When Hawa Bah decided to call 911 two weeks ago, she hoped an ambulance would arrive first, not the police.

title: Nguyen Chi Thien, Whose Poems Spoke Truth to Power, From a Cell, Dies at 73
description: It was not the isolation that was hardest to endure, though it lasted nearly three decades. Nor was it the cold of his cell, where he was often chained naked, nor summers blistering heat, nor the rusty shackles that infected his legs, nor the relentless hunger.

title: Swedish Club Looks to Sign Lundqvist
description: The big obstacle for a European club looking to sign a locked-out N.H.L. star is the cost of insuring that player against injury. The Swedish Elitserien club Frolunda Gothenburg seems to have overcome that barrier in its attempt to sign Rangers goalie Henrik Lundqvist, the citys hometown hero, for the duration of the lockout.

title: Lottery Numbers
Marijuana Only for the Sick? A Farce, Some Angelenos Say
description: LOS ANGELES  One year after federal law enforcement officials began cracking down on Californias medical marijuana industry with a series of high-profile arrests around the state, they finally moved into Los Angeles last month, giving 71 dispensaries until Tuesday to shut down. At the same time, because of a well-organized push by a new coalition of medical marijuana supporters, the City Council last week repealed a ban on the dispensaries that it had passed only a couple of months earlier.

title: 2004 R.N.C. Protest Video
description: Video excerpts from Bradley Wills 2004 video of Republican National Convention protesters in New York City.

title: Its Big. Its Confusing. And Its Anybodys Race.
description: WOODINVILLE, Wash.  The big news is what did not happen here. In the politics of redrawing the map of Congressional districts after the 2010 census, boring and predictable lost the battle and fled the field. The result, politicians and academics say, is one of the most unusual corners in the nation heading toward Election Day.

title: Strategy in Draft May Leave Jets Short of Depth
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Behind the desk in Mike Tannenbaums office, a three-sided whiteboard hangs on the wall. It is loaded with magnets, one for each player on the Jets roster  a visual representation of the underperforming and the overachieving, the injured and the fit, and everybody in between.

title: Vonn Seeks Chance to Race Against Men
description: Having won all of the top crowns in womens downhill ski racing, Lindsey Vonn has set her sights on a new goal: competing against the best male ski racers in the world.

title: Romney Works to Build Momentum in Florida, a State Critical to Victory
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Seeking to capitalize on his commanding debate performance last week, Mitt Romney tried to turn the enthusiasm of large crowds during a three-day visit to Florida into momentum to carry a state that, by all accounts, is crucial to his path to the White House.

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of Columbus Day and Shemini Atzeret, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Monday. Other regulations remain in effect.

title: On Fund-Raising Tour, Obama Admits Poor Debate Showing
description: LOS ANGELES  President Obama joined the chorus of critics who have been slamming his debate performance, acknowledging on Sunday night before a star-studded fund-raiser that he may have flubbed the face-to-face standoff with Mitt Romney last week.

title: N.F.L. Replay: Week 5
description: A view from around the National Football League, including quarterback duels and a one-handed catch.

title: YouTube to Serve Niche Tastes by Adding Channels
description: A visit to YouTube these days shows so many professionally produced channels that it could be confused with a TV guide. There are channels for ABC News, Taylor Swift, Nike Football, Americas Test Kitchen and the Obama for America campaign.

title: After Scare, Baker Looks Between the Milestones
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To everyone else, the image of a 3-year-old son of the San Francisco Giants manager being rescued from a near collision at home plate is a lasting World Series memory.

title: Former City Officials Blog Chronicled His Fall From Grace and Plans for Suicide
description: After years of using his blog to settle scores with journalists, former fellow city officials and even his own father, Russell A. Harding began his final post with an unsettling mix of humility and humor.

title: Reviewing Week 5 in the N.F.L.
description: DAYS BEST

title: Soccer Coach, 25, Is Fatally Stabbed
description: A 25-year-old youth soccer coach was stabbed to death and mutilated on a street in Greenwich Village early Sunday, the police said.

title: A Day on the Trail
description: Friday found President Obama starting his day at the White House, then making campaign stops in Virginia and Ohio, both battleground states.

title: Corruption Is Seen as a Drain on Italys South
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy  Italys A3 highway, begun in the 1960s and still not finished, starts outside Naples in the ancient hill town of Salerno and ends, rather unceremoniously, 300 miles farther south as a local street in downtown Reggio Calabria.

title: Toe to Toe
description: For the past year, conservative and Republican groups have spent more than$138 million in a concerted attempt to turn voters against Barack Obama.

title: From Palestine to Chile and Back
description: Most soccer fans would associate given names such as Edgardo and Roberto as Latino.

title: Photo Replay: Yanks-Orioles
description: The Yankees turn a tense game into blowout in the ninth against the Orioles.

title: Study Finds Broad Wariness Over Online Tracking
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  As marketers, browser makers and government regulators spar over efforts to let consumers limit custom advertising online, a new study suggests that Americans are largely unaware of what that means and have a strong aversion to being tracked online.

title: Julian Assange Has Book Deal
description: The publisher OR Books announced on Sunday that it had acquired Cypherpunks, a new book about freedom and the Internet by  Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks. Mr. Assange, who was granted asylum at the Ecuadorean Embassy in London in August, wrote the book with three other authors:  Jacob Appelbaum, Jrmie Zimmermann and  Andy Mller-Maguhn. The book will go on sale Nov. 26 in paperback and as an e-book. Mr. Assange said in a statement that he wrote the book in response to his longstanding worries about government control of the Internet and surveillance. In March 2012 I gathered together three of todays leading cypherpunks to discuss the resistance, he said. Two of them, besides myself, have been targeted by law enforcement agencies as a result of their work to safeguard privacy and to keep government accountable. Their words, and their stories, need to be heard.

title: Study Shows Children With Autism Tend to Stray
description: When Patrick Murphy was 6, he became obsessed with vacuum cleaners. The boy, who has autism, used to slip out of his house near Buffalo without telling his parents, running to a nearby appliance store or into strangers homes to marvel at vacuum cleaners.

title: Romney Strives to Stand Apart in Global Policy
description: WASHINGTON  Mitt Romney intensified his efforts Monday to draw a sharp contrast with President Obama on national security in the presidential campaigns closing stages, portraying Mr. Obama as having mishandled the tumult in the Arab world and having left the nation exposed to a terrorist attack in Libya.

title: Russell Martin Stars on Defense, Too
description: BALTIMORE  Yankees catcher Russell Martin spent much of Sunday flinging himself to the ground to block pitches around home plate. He slid to the dirt in the same area as part of a desperate attempt to try to score a run  even if he was tagged out. And in the grass in front of home plate, he flopped face-first as he threw the ball to get what proved to be a crucial out.

title: A New Term for Chvez
description: President Hugo Chvez of Venezuela won re-election on Sunday, facing down the strongest electoral challenge of his nearly 14 years in office.

title: Martin and Yanks Are Better Late
description: BALTIMORE  The Yankees were the last team to enter the postseason fray, waiting four days after the end of the regular season to play their first playoff game. And then they had to wait about two and a half hours more for rain to subside before finally opening their 2012 postseason campaign.

title: Arroyo Shuts Down Giants as Reds Take 2-0 Series Lead
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Cincinnatis Bronson Arroyo, a 35-year-old with a flap of blond hair dropping out the back of his cap, has built a reputation over 13 seasons as a control pitcher who devours innings rather than overwhelming hitters.

title: Korean-American Star Confesses in Skating Scandal
description: HONG KONG  Simon Cho, a Korean-American speedskater who won a bronze medal at the 2010 Olympics, originally came to the United States in 1996 under cover of darkness, smuggled across the border from Canada, holding his mothers hand. He was an illegal immigrant, and he was 4 years old.

title: Texans at Jets: Matchup to Watch
description: Texans (4-0) at Jets (2-2), 8:30 p.m. Eastern Monday, ESPN

title: Textbook Victory: Throw, Run and Catch
description: After the Giants fell behind, 14-0, on Sunday, Eli Manning, Ahmad Bradshaw and Victor Cruz led them to a victory against the winless Cleveland Browns.

title: A Conversation With:  P. Chidambaram
description: Palaniappan Chidambaram, the powerful minister of finance and senior leader in the Indian National Congress, has been a central figure in the recent flurry of economic measures pushed through by the government. His return to the Finance Ministry on the last day of July  he had previously served as finance minister from 2004 to 2008  coincided with a new, more assertive attitude by a government that had been criticized for drift and ineffectiveness.

title: IHT Quick Read: Monday, Oct. 8
description: NEWS As euro zone finance ministers gather Monday for their monthly meeting in Luxembourg, there is still considerable disagreement over how the 500 billion European bailout fund will work  its known officially as the European Stability Mechanism but referred to as the bazooka  and whether it can help countries like Spain that are already in crisis. James Kanter reports from Brussels.

title: Families of South Korean Sailors Held by Pirates Ask Seoul for Help
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The families of four South Korean sailors held hostage by Somali pirates for more than 17 months appealed to the government on Monday to intervene for their release.

title: Philippines and U.S. Start Joint Exercises
description: SUBIC BAY, the Philippines  Marines from the Philippines and the United States began 10 days of joint exercises focused on disaster relief, humanitarian assistance and maritime security.

title: Asian Universities Play Catch-up in Global Rankings
description: The California Institute of Technology is still the No. 1 university in the world, according to the Times Higher Education rankings, compiled in London and published last week, and American institutions still dominate the top 10. But in the middle of the pack, Asian universities were the biggest gainers, D.D. Guttenplan writes.

title: Poorer but Wiser After a Year of Unemployment
description: There is a great spiraling downward going on in this country, and it has meant that people like Cindy Roberts of Tulsa, Okla., Bob Hockman of Superior, Wis., and Michael Rose of New Hyde Park on Long Island have had to fight with all their strength or be pulled under.

title: The Madam and the Imam
description: KARACHI  Last month, the police in Peshawar, the capital of Pakistans northwestern Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province, arrested four women and one man for engaging in prostitution, a crime punishable by up to 25 years in prison. The High Court in Peshawar released them after acknowledging that a lack of employment opportunities often forces women into selling sex. But it also ordered Neelam, who was charged with running a brothel, to attend an hour-long class with a cleric at a local mosque every day for a month. After that the police will assess her moral progress and report back to the court.

title: Weighed Down by History, a Town Slides in Mexico
description: The thrust of civilization is commonly imagined as an arc curving ever upward. From the Industrial Revolution on, innovation, comfort, health and wealth have seemed to expand and improve limitlessly for much of the world. But take a long look at the remote, sinking town of Santiago Mitlatongo, in Mexico, and that arc appears to slump  and not just graphically. The geologic term is slumping; its foundation diminished by erosion, Santiago Mitlatongo is sliding down its mountain at a rate of about a meter per day.

title: The Early Word: Details
description: Todays Times

title: Bhutans Middle Path
description: Aaron Putnam, a postdoctoral research scientist at the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory of Columbia University, is leading a field expedition to the mountain kingdom of Bhutan to examine links among past climate, glaciers and water resources in the Himalaya.

title: Big Spaces for Big Art at the Edges of Paris
description: PARIS  On the le Seguin, construction of the 30,000-square-meter R4 arts complex designed by Jean Nouvel has yet to begin  but the space is already up and running.

title: Week 5 Quick Hits: Packers Offense Is Puzzling
description: Andy Benoit takes a tour of the Week 5 Sunday games. Share your thoughts.

title: Campaigning for Care
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.

title: Israel Launches Airstrikes After Attacks From Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Gaza militants fired a barrage of rockets and mortar shells into Israeli territory on Monday, causing no casualties but some property damage, after an Israeli airstrike in southern Gaza on Sunday killed one Palestinian and wounded at least nine others.

title: This Week in Small Business: Theyre Talking About Us!
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners this week.The Debate: Small Businesses Front and Center

title: The Competing Views on Competition
description: JUST before bedtime on a recent night, two toddlers marched reluctantly to the bathroom to brush their teeth. And on the way, my four-year-old son told his little sister: Im going to win. Im going to win!

title: Test Drive: Zappos Introduces PinPointing, a Pinterest Shopping Companion Tool
description: Ask any dedicated online shopper about the tools in his or her digital arsenal and youll hear about Pinterest. You may also hear complaints about how difficult it is to shop from. Unless an image has been pinned directly from the retailers site, useful hyperlinks and information, such as product name, in the description are rare. Instead, youre likely to find a description supplied by the pinner along the lines of colorful ballet slippers or Flares. flares. #fall. Telepathy or Nancy Drew-level skills are required to find pinned items. (Lets not even get into whether the product will even be in stock by the time you track down the retailer.)

title: In Phoenix, the Search for a Successor to Nash
description: Spirit, engine, face of the franchise  in his nine seasons with the Phoenix Suns, Steve Nash was all of these things and more. So when word came on July 11 that the two-time most valuable player and perennial All-Star had been traded to the Los Angeles Lakers for little more than a bounty of future draft picks, the writing on the wall in Phoenix was: rebuild.

title: Kris Jenkins vs. Chris Myers: The Knockdown Revisited

title: Will Britains Rivalries Harm Governance?
description: LONDON  Like other Europeans, Britons are burdened by austerity programs that are supposed to haul the country out of its crippling debt. And, for those in the country who had not realized it before, the cuts in public spending are likely to be deeper and more protracted than expected.

title: Debating the Death Sentence for Honor Killings
description: Five people from Delhi were sentenced to death on Friday for the honor killing of a couple, the latest in a series of death penalty judgments in India for the murder of young people who wish to marry outside their caste or religious group.

description: 8:52 a.m. | Updated

title: A Mysterious Light Gleamed as Columbus Drew Near
description: A doctoral student at Baruch College is studying the luminescent proteins of Bermuda fireworms, glowing green creatures that may have caught Christopher Columbuss eye 520 years ago.

description: MOSCOW  Of all the days in the year, Anna Politkovskaya had to be killed on Oct. 7.
