description: Ben Affleck and other stars including George Clooney and Barbara Walters turned out to see the political thriller.

title: Battle Eases Between Pakistani Government and High Court
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A longstanding legal battle between the Pakistani government and the countrys assertive Supreme Court appears to have run its course after both sides came closer to a face-saving settlement on Wednesday.

title: A Movie All the Stars Want to See
description: NEARLY a decade ago, it was hard to find people in Hollywood predicting great things for Ben Affleck. Involved with Jennifer Lopez and appearing with alarming frequency on the cover of Us Weekly, Mr. Affleck was world famous but without a career to match.

title: U.S. Will Place Tariffs on Chinese Solar Panels
description: The Commerce Department issued its final ruling Wednesday in a long-simmering trade dispute with China, imposing tariffs ranging fromabout 24 to nearly 36 percent on most solar panels imported from the country.

title: Pictures of the Day: Pakistan and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Pakistan, Syria, Somalia and Afghanistan.

title: Trying Year Gives Way to Heroics by Carpenter
description: WASHINGTON  Chris Carpenter battled shoulder pain for much of the year, an injury that was addressed this summer with the removal of a rib. He returned to the St. Louis Cardinals on Sept. 21, pitched only 17 innings and did not record a win. Yet anyone who questioned whether the Cardinals should have handed him the reins for the pivotal Game 3 of their National League division series should have known better.

title: Often, the Best Plays Are About What Isnt There
description: Alex Rodriguez is 37 years old. But in Game 2 of the Yankees American League division series against the Baltimore Orioles on Monday night, he seemed more like a creative Little Leaguer than a veteran All-Star.

title: Manhattans Most-Mourned Bars
description: Bills Gay Nineties. The Holiday Cocktail Lounge. Kennys Castaways. The Lakeside Lounge. This year, all of these beloved Manhattan bars announced last call for the last time, sending their regulars forth in search of other bars to call their second homes. Theyve got my sympathy. Over the years, Ive loved and lost enough great bars. At some, I spent hundreds of hours. Others, I visited just once or twice a year, but was happy to know they were around. In honor of the fallen, here are the 10 that I miss most.

title: Unabashed in the Face of Tragedy
description: According to a 60 Minutes/Vanity Fair poll released last week, 7 percent of Americans think Lee Harvey Oswald is the guy who shot Abraham Lincoln.

title: National Peace Award, and Now a Bullet, for Girl Who Pressed for Female Education
description: You may be following the reports of the Taliban shooting attack on Malala Yousafzai, the 14-year-old Pakistani girl who last year won Pakistans National Peace Award but now, as Times journalist Adam Ellick put it in his potent post yesterday, is fighting for her life after beinggunned down by the Talibanfor doing what girls do all over the world: going to school. (On Twitter, theres a nonstop flow of posts around the tag #Malala.)

title: A Farewell to Celluloid With a Tribute
description: PARIS

title: Returning to a Special Role, Maybe for the Last Time
description: This seasons uninspired revival of Verdis Otello at the Metropolitan Opera, which opened on Tuesday evening, provides an opportunity for New York to hear again, perhaps for the last time, the Desdemona of Rene Fleming. The role was one of her earliest successes with the company, as well as the vehicle for her first Met opening night 17 years ago, and it remains a lovely fit.

title: Fire in the Blood and Speed in the Footwork
description: If fiery Gypsy temperament is a stereotype, its not one that the Farruco family, from Spain, has any interest in dispelling. Blood ran hot during the appearance of La Farruca (Rosario Montoya Manzano) and her son El Carpeta (Manuel Fernndez Montoya) at the Skirball Center on Sunday, part of the World Music Institutes Flamenco Festival Gitano.

title: Discussing Desperate Characters With Paula Fox
description: 9:30 p.m. | Updated  Our live conversation about Desperate Characters by Paula Fox has ended, but you can still add your thoughts in comments section below, which Ill check in on over the next few days. Immediately below is my back-and-forth with Ms. Fox herself about the novel and Brooklyn in the very early days of gentrification. Ginia Bellafante

title: At the Long Island Fall Regional
description: Justine Cushing, Melih Ozdil and Joel Wooldridge of New York, and Lew Finkel of Jupiter, Fla., were by far the most successful players at the Long Island Fall Regional in Smithtown, N.Y., last week.

title: The Education of Tony Marx
description: EVERYWHERE Tony Marx goes, he does a lot of smiling and nodding. As the president of the New York Public Library (a job he took over in July 2011, after eight years as the president of Amherst), it is his job to smile and nod at big-name writers around whom the library plans events.

title: Three Drugs to Be Tested to Stave Off Alzheimers
description: Scientists have selected three different types of Alzheimers drugs to be tested in the first large-scale international attempt to prevent the disease in people who are otherwise doomed to get it.

title: The Stir About Hulk
description: BY the immutable laws of the Internet, it had to happen: There is now a sex tape featuring Hulk Hogan, the professional wrestler, in flagrante delicto with a woman who at the time was the wife of Bubba the Love Sponge, a radio D.J. Though horrible to contemplate (or watch), its delightful to discuss.

title: Romney Town Hall in Hopkinton, N.H.
description: Mitt Romney said that he was firmly pro-life and was in favor of overturning Roe v. Wade and putting the decision on abortion back to the states.

title: Deep Sleep
description: The fault with our beds lies in a misleading preposition. Grammar tells us that we go to sleep in a bed; reality tells us that we go to sleep on a bed. In is not on. Beds are irredeemably flat. Personally, as I slip into oblivion, I want to be protected inside a bed. Once I am in oblivion, I do not want to be served up to the dark like a roast on a tray.

title: Pay Attention to the Man Behind the Keyboard
description: As an entertainer with a capital E, Mark Nadler does more than chew the scenery. This strutting, crowing metavaudevillian tears it from its moorings and devours it in greedy gulps, smacking his lips and noisily belching with satisfaction: not literally of course, but thats the ferocity he exhibits. No piano is safe after he has begun pounding on it.

title: Clue Arises Regarding Lost Photo of Mahler
description: Twenty-five years ago, when the daughter of Arnold Schoenberg was working through his archive for a book project, she came across an empty picture frame. It was missing what the Schoenberg family calls one of the composers most precious possessions: a signed picture of Gustav Mahler with a musical quotation from Mahlers Symphony No. 2.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Antarctican Visions and Hipstamatics Struggle
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently.See more here.

title: Credit Behind the Lens
description: WHAT Vogue is to young designers, W magazine wants to be to young photographers.

title: Long Reliant on China, Myanmar Now Turns to Japan
description: YANGON, Myanmar  On a street in central Yangon, the final moments of Kenji Nagais life were captured in a Pulitzer Prize-winning photograph, an image that exemplified the brutality of military rule in Myanmar. Mr. Nagai, a Japanese journalist, was shot five years ago during a crackdown on protesters by security forces, and his death was a low point in relations between Myanmar and Japan.

title: Turning the Plastic Box on Its Head
description: For more than 50 years, AMAC has done one thing very well: make simple plastic boxes that have earned a place in the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art and on many a designers desk.

title: A Surprise Inside a Chinese Wrapper
description: In 2006, the Shanghai architects Lyndon Neri and Rossana Hu started Design Republic to sell modern furnishings inspired by antique Chinese housewares and objects, along with designs by companies like Alessi, Tom Dixon and Moooi. Last month, they formally opened their third Design Republic (far right), in Qingpu, 25 miles west of Shanghai, in part of a 30,000-square-foot concrete building. The rest of it is rented to 10 Chinese designers, and the entire concern is called Design Collective. The architects renovated inside and out, covering the exterior with floral-print carbon-fiber. There were windows before, but you werent looking at anything, Mr. Neri said. We made a wrapper, and made it more introverted. 5369 Middle Jiasong Road, Qingpu District, Shanghai; 011-86-21-5975-4381.

title: No Need to Rock This Doll to Sleep
description: The plump new Doll lamp by the French designer Ionna Vautrin for Foscarini gets its shape from objects that are poles apart. My first intention was to reinterpret old petrol lamps, with a simple base and blown glass on top, Ms. Vautrin said.

title: Here Are My Keys. Dont Spill Anything on the Floor.
description: Care of Wooden Floors, a novel by Will Wiles, published in the United States this week by Amazon Publishing/New Harvest ($24), turns the placid act of house-sitting into one mans existential nightmare.

title: Sales at Design Within Reach, Lumens.com and Others
description: During Design Within Reachs Semiannual Sale, through Tuesday, many furniture items are 15 percent off (the Le Corbusier LC4 chaise longue, regularly $3,855, is about $3,277); (800) 944-2233, dwr.com.

title: A Twitter Outburst and Another Chance for Andrew Goldman
description: Is it ever acceptable for a journalist to ask a successful woman if she has slept her way to the top?

title: For Birds of a Finicky Feather
description: Shapely bird feeders from the Danish company Eva Solo let you cater to the pickiest avian guest. Made of handblown glass in an appetizing doughnut shape, or of white powder-coated stainless steel with an elliptical midcentury silhouette, the feeders can be hung from a tree or a terrace roof with a rubber-coated cable. The metal version can also be set into the ground on a slender steel rod.

title: Once Again, Seeing Double
description: THE Restoration Hardware showroom in the Flatiron district of Manhattan was a hive of activity last week, as lunchtime shoppers checked out furniture from the companys new fall collection.

title: A Spate of Designer Look-Alikes
description: Classic furniture pieces and their Restoration Hardware counterparts.

title: Making Room in Your Piece of the Cloud
description: It sometimes seems that what iOS 6, the new software upgrade for the iPhone and iPad, does best is sell more storage space in the cloud.

title: Bringing Out the Best in Old Pieces
description: Upholstery sauvage is not a bad way to describe how a British couple have been making themselves at home in Fort Greene, Brooklyn.

title: Staple-Gun Decorating in Fort Greene
description: HILARY ROBERTSON and Alastair McCowan were recently entertaining some French friends in their apartment in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, when one of the guests, glancing at the muslin stapled to a pair of ersatz French chairs, raised an eyebrow and said, What is that, upholstery sauvage?

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Our apartment has high ceilings. Would adding a sleeping loft increase its market value?

title: Useful New Tools, and Some Diversions, for Apples New Phone
description: Apple has just updated the iPhone into its fifth incarnation. Skinnier, lighter and more powerful than its predecessors, and with a bigger screen, the iPhone 5 has tempted millions of buyers  including me. As a gadget fan, I had yearned for one and, with a perfect sense of timing, my 2-year-old son helpfully dunked my iPhone 4S into a cup of tea last week.

title: Does the Law Support Inventors or Investors?
Report Predicts Fastest Job Growth in Hotels and Restaurants, Not Financial Services
description: By the middle of the coming decade, there will be more jobs in New York City in hotels and restaurants than on Wall Street and in banks, according to a report on global competition released on Wednesday.

title: Photo Replay: Oct.10
description: A view of the day in sports, including the furry lip of Eagles Coach Andy Reid.

title: Past Vice-Presidential Debate Moments
description: Sam Tanenhaus, editor of the Book Review, talks about some of the most memorable vice-presidential debate moments of the televised era.

title: The No. 1 Rule When No. 2s Meet in Battle? Be Memorable. In a Good Way.
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  Near the end of the first debate ever of vice-presidential candidates, Senator Bob Dole remembered his White House-prepared briefing materials on war casualties under various administrations  and used them.

title: Commander Nominated to Lead War in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday nominated Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., the assistant commandant of the Marine Corps and a combat veteran who led a regiment in the 2003 invasion of Iraq, as the top American and NATO commander in Afghanistan.

title: E-Mails Cited to Back Lawsuits Claim That Equity Firms Colluded on Big Deals
description: The private equity giants Blackstone Group and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts are longtime rivals that compete for multibillion-dollar deals. But during the last decades buyout boom, according to newly released e-mails in a civil lawsuit accusing them of collusion, the two firms appeared to be on much cozier terms.

title: For Some Drivers, an Electric Motorcycle Could Be the Best of Both Worlds
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Zipping around on a motorcycle can be fun, but being in a downpour or an accident on one is not. Driving a car is safer and more comfortable, but traffic and parking can be annoying.

title: A Look at the Motorcycle of the Future
description: The C-1, built by Lit Motors, is meant to have the efficiency of a motorcycle with the protection of a car.

title: In SoHo, Salon Is a Salon, in Homage to Gertrude Stein
description: Apartment that looks like Gertrude Steins. Apartment dim two rooms but it is night. Apartment crammed on walls cannot call them paintings they are not originals they are not paintings. Apartment no-name doorman in non-doorman building. Apartment like Paris 1907 on Spring Street SoHo now. Apartment is an apartment is an apartment.

title: U.S. Team Loses More Players for Qualifiers
description: With the United States national team preparing for two crucial World Cup qualifiers over the next week, injuries to key players could make the task even more difficult.

title: Smashed Skull Serves as Grim Symbol of Seething Patriotism
description: XIAN, China  In the heart of one of Chinas famed dynastic capitals, now a modern metropolis of eight million, Li Jianli lay partially paralyzed on a hospital bed with his skull smashed in and his speaking ability reduced to a few simple phrases  yes, thank you and so on. Only recently has Mr. Li begun to regain his ability to move and talk. The recovery has been slow and painful and tenuous, his relatives said.

title: Opening the Church to the World
description: Washington

title: The Wrong Way to Help the Poor
description: Chicago

title: Fast Start and Lincecum Propel Giants
description: CINCINNATI  The script was by no means conventional Wednesday night, but with one more San Francisco win, the end result will be worthy of Hollywood.

title: Six Things to Watch For in Biden-Ryan Debate
description: Over three days last week, Representative Paul D. Ryan reserved an indoor tennis court at a Virginia resort  not to practice his backhand, but to hold mock debates. Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been at his own debate camp in Delaware this week, overseen by President Obamas top political strategist, David Axelrod.

title: The 9.23.12 Issue
description: A PRISON, A PARADISE

title: An Un-Dangerous Mind
description: Washington

title: Will I Ever Get Off This Treadmill?
description: Youre 65 years old, and its hard to imagine you ever hoped that by now youd be playing canasta year-round in Fort Lauderdale or hitting the links twice a week in Tucson. Youre a boomer, man. Still, you may have daydreamed about spending your days following Hot Tuna on tour, or doing monthlong meditation retreats, or even joining the Peace Corps.

title: As the Toll in the Meningitis Outbreak Rises
description: To the Editor:

title: Women as Breadwinners
description: To the Editor:

title: Pollution in China
description: To the Editor:

title: Helping Siberian Jews
description: To the Editor:

title: How Gays Are Seen in the South
Nuclear Plant Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: Fed Governor Suggests Congress Weigh Laws to Limit Bank Size
description: A Federal Reserve Board governor on Wednesday suggested that Congress could take steps to limit the size of banks in order to ensure financial stability.

title: Giants Line Driven to Protect Manning Against 49ers
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  One of the most difficult parts of being an offensive lineman in the N.F.L. is the realization that you are consigned to a life of association. There is no obvious measure of success for footballs behemoths, in contrast with virtually every other position on the field, so their emotions rise and fall almost entirely with the skill position players around them.

title: This Election, a Stark Choice in Health Care
description: Joyce Beck, who runs a small hospital and network of medical clinics in rural Nebraska, is reluctant to plan for the future until voters decide between President Obama and Mitt Romney. The candidates sharply divergent proposals for Medicare, Medicaid and coverage of the uninsured have created too much uncertainty, she explained.

title: Ms. Merkel Goes to Athens
description: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, visiting Athens this week at the invitation of Prime Minister Antonis Samaras, got a chance to see the suffering and anger of Greeks firsthand, brought about by budget policies imposed in exchange for a European Union bailout in the debt crisis. She acknowledged the sacrifices Greeks have already made, yet she insisted that only more austerity can lead to better days. She could not be more wrong.

title: West Is Foolish to Celebrate Irans Rial Crisis, Ayatollah Says
description: Irans supreme leader spoke out publicly for the first time on Wednesday about the countrys foreign-exchange problems, describing the mass protest in Tehran last week over the plummeting Iranian currency as an anomaly that the West had gleefully but foolishly misinterpreted as a harbinger of crisis.

title: New York State Parks Use Infusion of Money Toward Backlog of Repairs
description: HARRIMAN STATE PARK, N.Y.  Along the roads past lakes and campgrounds here, workers have been busy laying down fresh asphalt. Near Lake Cohasset, aging sewer lines are being replaced. Soon, dozens of frayed cabins that house disadvantaged children in the summer will receive makeovers, including new roofs.

title: I.R.S. Commissioner Will Step Down in November
description: The I.R.S. commissioner Douglas Shulman announced Wednesday that he will leave his post next month, ending a four-and-a-half year term during which he modernized some of the agencys infrastructure while cracking down on tax dodging by corporations and offshore tax evasion by individuals.

title: Things I Saw  No. 36
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: Nationals History Is Repeating
description: WASHINGTON

title: Changed Brooklyn Awaits Streisands Homecoming
description: One marker for the changes that have taken place in Brooklyn since Barbra Streisand was a teenager is that Adelmans kosher delicatessen is now run by an Egyptian Muslim named Mohamed Salem.

title: Would-Be Witness on Curses Is Ruled No Expert
description: The man prosecutors have called a witch doctor sat calmly on the witness stand at State Supreme Court in Manhattan on Wednesday, recounting his first brush with curses.

title: Race-Conscious Admissions in Texas
description: Affirmative action provokes conflicting views about what equal protection means under the law. Does the Constitution permit race-conscious programs that provide minorities with opportunities, even though it prohibits programs that exclude minorities because of their race?

title: Lottery Numbers
Two Approaches on Health Care
description: President Obama and Mitt Romney have profound differences over how to address problems with health insurance coverage and rising health care costs. Most of the major provisions of the Obama health care law will not go into effect until 2014.

title: Democrats at the Deep End
description: Its a tough time to be a Democrat.

title: Dark Turn in the Tale of a First Title
description: Just before the 1999 Tour de France, a teammate pointed out that Lance Armstrong had a bruise on his upper arm caused by a syringe.

title: A Poet Looks Back on a Bloody Week in 1967
description: NEWARK  The man in the tan shirt led the way to a squarish room in his house and sat down at a round table. Quietly, matter-of-factly, he talked about what happened in the summer of 1967.

title: At Hague, Libya Insists It Should Try Qaddafi Son
description: PARIS  Libya is preparing to bring a wide range of charges against a son of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, and to begin his trial by next February, lawyers for Libya told the International Criminal Court at The Hague on Wednesday. They appeared at a hearing dealing with the question of whether Libya or the international court has the right to try the younger Mr. Qaddafi as well as a powerful intelligence chief in his fathers regime.

title: Her Crime Was Loving Schools
description: Twice the Taliban threw warning letters into the home of Malala Yousafzai, a 14-year-old Pakistani girl who is one of the worlds most persuasive advocates for girls education. They told her to stop her advocacy  or else.

title: Malala Yousafzais Courage
description: If Pakistan has a future, it is embodied in Malala Yousafzai. Yet the Taliban so feared this 14-year-old girl that they tried to assassinate her. Her supposed offense? Her want of an education and her public advocation for it.

title: Peru: Fujimori Family Requests Pardon
description: The four children of former President Alberto Fujimori, who is serving a prison sentence for human rights violations and corruption, submitted a request on Wednesday in Lima for a pardon for their father.

title: Sanchez Is the Starter for the Jets, Until He Isnt
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Mark Sanchez, who seems to be everyones favorite target, took a spot in front of his locker, as he usually does on Wednesdays. He did not look, or sound, like a guy who was having a bad day, or month.

title: Afghan Officials Denounce Western Groups Report on Countrys Future
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government and some politicians and local news outlets denounced Western research organizations and news media, blasting them as spies and political agents in the wake of a report that suggested it was possible the Afghan government would collapse after 2014.

title: Report Sees More Restraint in Shootings by City Police Officers
description: In 2011, New York City police officers shot and killed 9 suspects and injured 19 more, the second-lowest annual toll in recent city history, according to a Police Department report.

title: Sharp Words at Hearing Over Tactics of the Police
description: Outbursts are prohibited, City Councilman Peter F. Vallone Jr. warned as a hearing on bills centered largely on the New York Police Departments controversial stop-and-frisk practices began on Wednesday morning.

title: Premature Desperation
description: Hey you! Come down off that ledge. Lets talk this through. Its not as bad as it seems.

title: With Tapes, Authorities Build Criminal Cases Over JPMorgan Loss
description: Federal authorities are using taped phone conversations to build criminal cases related to the multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan Chase, focusing on calls in which employees openly discussed how to value the troubled bets in a favorable way.

title: Sometimes You Just Need to Get Away
description: Watch this space. Keep your distance.

title: His Knickers May Be in a Twist
description: That dark cloud hanging over the Richard Rodgers Theater on West 46th Street for the next week or so is not some freak of the weather. Its the permanent psychic accessory trailed by the comedian Lewis Black, who has brought his evening of angry-man stand-up to Broadway for eight performances through Oct. 20. Running on Empty, as the show is called, finds Mr. Black in fine, sputtering form, exuding an air of exhausted disgust at the state of the country and the state of the world that will surely resonate with audiences feeling similarly grim as the grinding last stages of the presidential election loom.

title: Woman With Great Will Power
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  There is always one constructor whose byline makes you reconsider solving the puzzle and doing something less challenging instead, like performing neurosurgery. For me, that constructor is Byron Walden.

title: Corrections: October 11, 2012
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Girl Scouts Update Recipe for Cookie Box
description: The Girl Scout cookie box is getting a major makeover  for the first time in more than a dozen years  to better tell the story of what girls learn from selling cookies. Thin Mints, Samoas, Trefoils all and the other cookie varieties will move from being a product to a messenger, seeking to explain what scouts do and to reconnect with some of the 59 million Girl Scout alumnae.

title: Firefighters vs. Town Leader Over Pink Shirts for a Cause
description: While much of the country remains mired in the red-versus-blue battles of this years political campaigns, the largest battle in Bristol, Conn., these days seems to be over the color pink.

title: Russia Wont Renew Pact on Weapons With U.S.
description: MOSCOW  The Russian government said Wednesday that it would not renew a hugely successful 20-year partnership with the United States to safeguard and dismantle nuclear and chemical weapons in the former Soviet Union when the program expires next spring, a potentially grave setback in the already fraying relationship between the former cold war enemies.

title: A Flock Too Stubborn for Even Putin to Control
description: MOSCOW  It seemed like a daring plan when President Vladimir V. Putin, outfitted in a billowy white jumpsuit and piloting a motorized hang glider, led a flock of critically endangered Siberian cranes last month on the first leg of a migration flight intended to reintroduce them to life in the wild.

title: From Former Teammates, Words Tinged With Regret
description: The heart of the case against Lance Armstrong is the sworn testimony of nearly a dozen of his former teammates. Officials with the United States Anti-Doping Agency on Wednesday made clear the hard choices Armstrongs fellow riders faced: Coming forward to testify in this case has been at considerable cost and substantial risk for virtually everyone who has provided testimony to Usada. As a consequence, many of Usadas witnesses have had years of their competitive results disqualified, they have risked their employment, a number have accepted suspensions, and five lost the opportunity to compete on the 2012 United States Olympic team.

title: Barbara Blum, Who Rescued Abused Willowbrook Residents, Dies at 82
description: Barbara Blum, a former high-ranking social services official who found homes for hundreds of mentally disabled people after their mistreatment at the Willowbrook State School on Staten Island became a national scandal in the 1970s, died on Saturday in Albany. She was 82.

title: After a Meningitis Death, Family Members Ask Why
description: BRENTWOOD, Tenn.  Diana Reed tried massage and acupuncture, but neither eased her neck pain. She may have injured herself while helping her husband, Wayne, who has Lou Gehrigs disease, in and out of his wheelchair.

title: Rare Consensus Inside Beltway
description: WASHINGTON  Lets face it, the exit polls were not great at Nationals Park on Wednesday. The home team performed much like the incumbent did in last weeks presidential debate  lackluster, not a lot of pop at the plate and a defense that could not handle an aggressive assault.

title: John Tchicai, Saxophone Player in Free Jazz Movement, Dies at 76
description: John Tchicai, a soft-toned Danish saxophonist who was at the center of the free-jazz movement in the mid-1960s, notably with the New York Art Quartet and on John Coltranes watershed album, Ascension, died on Oct. 8 in Perpignan, France. He was 76.

title: Sam Gibbons, Democrat of Florida, Dies at 92
description: Sam M. Gibbons, a 17-term Democratic congressman from Florida who championed free trade and government support of health care, castigated Republican colleagues for whimpering and for six months was chairman of the powerful House Ways and Means Committee, died Wednesday at his home in Tampa. He was 92.

title: Canada: Naval Officer Pleads Guilty to Selling Military Secrets
description: A Canadian naval officer pleaded guilty on Wednesday to selling military secrets to Russia over a four-year period.

title: Bidens Debate Mission: Whip Up Democrats to Blunt Romneys Gains
description: When Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. takes the debate stage in Danville, Ky., on Thursday night, he will probably not be able to erase all of Mitt Romneys gains in the polls after his debate performance in Denver last week, gains that appear to have flattened President Obamas postconvention bounce.

title: For N.H.L. Owners, Lockout Is a Calculated Risk
description: Last season, the N.H.L. generated $3.3 billion, the seventh straight season of record revenue. But on Wednesday, the day before what would have been the opening night for a new season with continued bright prospects for growth, teams stood idle. Players remained locked out by the owners and Commissioner Gary Bettman, and instead of the flash and clangor of hockey in boisterous rinks across North America, the only thing to anticipate was the dull spectacle of a negotiating session in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Remains Found in 05 Are of Harlem Girl, Authorities Say
description: The skeletal remains were discovered in 2005 in a wooded area in central New Jersey. They belonged to a girl of grade-school age, a girl who had probably died three years or so before she was found. But there was little else for investigators to go on; her case, unlike some that were called Baby Hope or Baby Faith, was simply referred to as Baby Bones.

title: Home Renovation Puts Knicks on the Road
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Knicks fans who are looking to get a peek at the team up close during the preseason will have to leave the city to do so. In an unusual year, the Knicks will play their six preseason games on the road. They are the only N.B.A. team not to have a single exhibition game in their home arena.

title: How Mitt Romney Has Positioned Himself on Abortion and Immigration
description: In interviews throughout his political career, Mr. Romneys statements on these issues have established some distance from conservative orthodoxy.

title: Romney Campaign Looks to Capitalize on Image Voters Saw in Debate
description: BOSTON  Inside Mitt Romneys campaign headquarters over the past few days, the data pouring in was unmistakable. Aides scouring the results of focus groups and national polls found that undecided voters watching the presidential debate in Denver seemed startled when the Republican candidate portrayed all year by Democrats  the ultraconservative, unfeeling capitalist  did not materialize.

title: JPMorgan Finance Chief Is Expected to Step Down
description: The chief financial officer at JPMorgan Chase is expected to step down by the end of the year in the latest round of executive reshuffling after the banks multibillion-dollar trading loss in May.

title: Armstrong Finds a Mixed Reception in Triathlon
description: For the past year, Lance Armstrong has achieved a competitive second act in the triathlon, a sport he had not pursued since his teenage years.

title: Daring Move, Spectacular Results
description: As the bottom of the ninth inning approached, with the Yankees down to their final few desperate outs, Raul Ibanez was told that he would be batting second in the inning as a pinch-hitter. But he didnt fully comprehend what that meant, because he didnt know whom he would be replacing.

title: Greek Port Succeeds Under Chinese Leadership
description: Cosco leased half of the port of Piraeus in 2010 and converted a business that had languished as a Greek state-run enterprise into a hotbed of productivity.

title: Schools Brace for Decision on Affirmative Action
description: As the Supreme Court heard arguments on Wednesday in a case challenging race-conscious admission to public colleges, university officials across the country watched for clues to where the court might go while contemplating what steps schools might take if the court changed the state of the law.

title: Chinese Telecom Firm Finds Warmer Welcome in Europe
description: PARIS  A month ago, as a U.S. congressional committee prepared to warn American telecommunications networks against buying from two Chinese suppliers, the founder of one of those companies was finding a warmer reception in London. There, he posed for photos with Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain in front of the fireplace at 10 Downing Street in London.

title: Federal Court Blocks Voter ID Law in South Carolina, but Only for Now
description: WASHINGTON  A federal court on Wednesday blocked South Carolina from enforcing its new voter photo ID law in next months election, saying that there was not enough time to educate voters and officials about it. The ruling was the latest in a string of judicial interventions blunting a wave of Republican-led efforts to impose new restrictions on voting for the Nov. 6 election.

title: Life, Interrupted: A Battle With Myself
description: I used to resent the battle metaphors associated with cancer. Keep fighting, people would say. Youre going to win this war, a friend would write in an e-mail.

title: Glaxo Opens Door to Data on Research
description: GlaxoSmithKline plans to open up much of its drug research in an apparent effort to deflect criticism that important information gathered in clinical trials often does not see the light of day.

title: Europe Aims to Unify Its Air Traffic System
description: BRUSSELS  It has been more than two years since the ash plume from an Icelandic volcano paralyzed European skies and galvanized support for a unified system of air traffic management.

title: Word of the Day | potpourri
description: potpourri \po-pu-re\ noun

title: Evidence From the Investigation Into Alleged Doping by Lance Armstrong
description: Details from the investigation of Lance Armstrong by the United States Anti-Doping Agency based on testimony, largely from teammates.

title: A.I.A. to Pay $1.7 Billion for INGs Malaysia Business
description: HONG KONGA.I.A. Group, the Asian insurance giant partly owned by American International Group, said on Thursday it would pay 1.34 billion euros to acquire the Malaysian insurance business of the Dutch insurer ING.

title: A Monthly Night of Art Outgrows Its Name
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  One wonders if Gertrude Stein would write there is no there there about Oakland if she could see the thousands of people who convene every month for this citys rambunctious art crawl and street bacchanal.

title: Most Regions Experienced Modest Growth
description: A roundup of regional economic conditions in the Federal Reserves 12 districts, according to survey results released by the Fed on Wednesday. The survey is based on information collected on or before Sept. 28.

title: Orioles Once-Flawless Bullpen Opens the Door for the Yanks
description: Brian Matusz did not wait to watch Raul Ibanezs game-ending home run fly out of Yankee Stadium before he turned around and briskly walked off the mound.

title: Limping Jeter Is Pulled, but He Plans to Play Game 4
description: Alex Rodriguez being pulled for the pinch-hitter Raul Ibanez in the ninth inning of Game 3 on Wednesday may be what people are still talking about, but Derek Jeter also finished the game on the bench.

title: Man Tied to Anti-Islam Film Denies Probation Charges
description: LOS ANGELES  The man behind the anti-Islam YouTube video that ignited bloody protests in the Muslim world appeared in federal court on Wednesday and denied violating any of the terms of a probation sentence imposed on him in 2010 after a bank fraud conviction.

title: Slumping in Middle of Lineup, Rodriguez Is Center of Attention
description: As best as Alex Rodriguez could recall, the last time he had been pinch-hit for in a meaningful situation during a baseball game, he was a teenager in high school.

title: Louisiana: Oil Sheen Linked to 2010 BP Spill
description: The United States Coast Guard reported late Wednesday that samples from an oil sheen spotted in the Gulf of Mexico last month have been matched to the oil that gushed from the Macondo 252 well, the source of the massive BP oil spill of 2010. The sheen was first reported on Sept. 16, and its size has varied in the weeks since, the Coast Guard reported. Samples were sent to the Marine Safety Lab in Connecticut and found to match the oil from the well, which was plugged with cement in September 2010. The Coast Guard said that the sheen is not feasible to recover and does not pose a risk to the shoreline, but that BP and Transocean may be held accountable for any cost associated with assessment and cleanup. The Coast Guard also suggested that the oil could have come from wreckage or debris on the sea floor.

title: India Hosts Both U.S. and Iran in Delhi (Again)
description: The timing, once again, was fairly awkward.

title: Australian Leader Unleashes Blistering Speech
description: HONG KONG  A harsh speech by Julia Gillard, the prime minister of Australia, against the leader of the opposition in Parliament has created an uproar in Australia and across the Internet this week.

title: Mississippi: State Joins Suit Against Migrant Reprieves
description: Gov. Phil Bryant has joined a lawsuit by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents against Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano, seeking to stop an Obama administration program granting temporary reprieves from deportation to some young illegal immigrants. The suit says Mississippi will have to bear fiscal costs of the illegal aliens living there who were spared from deportation. The lawsuit, in federal court in Dallas, was filed in August.

title: Illinois: Chicago Mayor Gives Warning on Pensions
description: Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago said Tuesday that the city could be forced to cut services or raise property taxes by 150 percent without comprehensive pension reform in the state. In his annual budget speech to the City Council, the mayor presented a spending plan that would close Chicagos nearly $300 million deficit without adding new taxes or fees. Saying that pension obligations for city workers were unsustainable, he warned that future budgets might not be as palatable. Illinois holds more than $83 billion in unfunded pension liabilities.

title: New Mexico: Another Try for Record-Seeking Jumper
description: If the winds cooperate, Felix Baumgartner will try again to make the highest jump in history and become the first sky diver to break the sound barrier. To reach an altitude of 120,000 feet in the stratosphere, he is using a helium balloon with a 550-foot-high gossamer plastic envelope that is most vulnerable when it is being inflated; the procedure can be done safely only when the winds at ground level are below 3 miles an hour. On Tuesday, a gust forced the launching to be tentatively rescheduled to Thursday and ruined the balloon, which cost several hundred thousand dollars. It was, unfortunately, an extremely expensive dress rehearsal, Art Thompson, the technical director of the Red Bull Stratos project, said Wednesday. The team is aiming for another try with a backup balloon on the next calm morning.

title: Yankees-Orioles Replay: Game 3
description: The Yankees took a 2-1 series lead against the Orioles after winning on a Raul Ibanez home run in the 12th inning.

title: Late Rally by As Forces a Fifth Game
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The Coliseum jumped all night, but it really shook in the ninth inning, mainly because hardly anyone from the capacity crowd of 36,385 gave up and went home. And the As rewarded their towel-waving faithful with one more remarkable comeback Wednesday, extending this American League division series to a deciding fifth game.

title: News Quiz | October 11, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Steps of Progress for Women in Africa
description: On a day where people all over the world are absorbing the horror of a Taliban attack on a teenage Pakistani girl who courageously speaks out for the need for girls education, we report on a much more hopeful piece of news: the growing involvement of women as entrepreneurs in the renaissance taking place in several countries across sub-Saharan Africa.

title: A Feisty Debate Crystallizes Differences in Tight Massachusetts Race
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass.  Elizabeth Warren and Senator Scott P. Brown kept the pressure on each other throughout a feisty, hourlong debate here Wednesday night, suggesting that both had learned the perils of a passive performance last week from President Obamas poorly reviewed debate with Mitt Romney.

title: Before a Big Crowd in Ohio, Romney Glides on Debates Lift
description: SIDNEY, Ohio  Im overwhelmed by the number of people here. There are even people out there, thats another county over there, Mitt Romney said as he surveyed a sea of supporters at the county fairgrounds here in western Ohio on Wednesday.

title: How the Polls Were Conducted
description: The latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News polls included telephone interviews conducted Oct. 4 through Oct. 9 with a total of 4,449 adults in Colorado, Virginia and Wisconsin. Of these, 4,089 said they were registered to vote.

title: Voters Give Romney Better Grades for Leadership, Polls in 3 States Find
description: WASHINGTON  Mitt Romney is seen by more voters in three battleground states as a strong leader after his dominant debate performance last week, but perceptions that the economy is improving remain a buttress for President Obama as the 2012 campaign comes down to its final weeks.

title: Wisconsin, a Republican Haven, Finds Itself Split
description: PEWAUKEE, Wis.  In the battle for control of the Senate, this state would seem to have everything Republicans could dream of: a shift to red up and down the ballot in 2010, a Republican governor who decisively survived a recall effort a few months ago, and a local son turned vice-presidential nominee.

title: IHT Quick Read: Thursday, Oct. 11
description: NEWS An effort to create a European behemoth in aerospace and military manufacturing to rival Boeing of the United States has collapsed amid political divisions involving Britain, France and Germany. Mark Scott and Nicola Clark report.

title: U.S. Prosecutors Deny Effort to Make Up Case Against Liu
description: Federal prosecutors have sharply rejected claims that the authorities had sought to pressure a former fund-raiser for John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, into helping manufacture a criminal case against Mr. Liu in the investigation of his fund-raising practices.

title: Results of the Latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News Poll
description: Polling the opinions of Colorado, Wisconsin and Virginia on the upcoming presidential election.

title: After Fury Over 2010 Peace Prize, China Embraces Nobel Selection
description: BEIJING  Two years ago, when the jailed Chinese dissident Liu Xiaobo won the Nobel Peace Prize, the government reacted with contempt and fury, scrubbing the announcement from the Internet, condemning the award as a desecration and calling it a Western propaganda tool intended to insult and destabilize the ruling Communist Party.

title: Test Yourself | English, Oct. 11, 2012
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article A Fat, Mustachioed Orphan Finds a Home.

title: The IMF and the GOP
description: Econowonks are still buzzing about the new IMF World Economic Outlook, which offered grim warnings about the world economy, and also argued forcefully if discreetly that a big reason for the worsening outlook is that policy makers have gotten the basic economics wrong.

title: Major Accusations Against Lance Armstrong
description: WHAT is Lance Armstrong, the professional cyclist, accused of doing?WHAT is the evidence?

title: Collectively Photographing Fracking
description: The most basic thing that photography does is visually describe what can be seen. The problem facing photographers of the Marcellus Shale Documentary Project is that what they wish to describe cannot be seen  an invisible gas buried deep underground. They have struggled to document the effect of the natural gas drilling commonly known as fracking.

title: Read This Book, Win the Election
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Remembering Alex Karras as a Football Player
description: Alex Karras loved to perform. Hes famous for his success as an actor but he should also be remembered as one of the N.F.L.s defensive stars of the 1960s. Karras died on Wednesday of kidney failure at his home in Los Angeles. He was 77. A few thoughts:

title: Are You Less Religious Than Your Parents?
description: Twenty percent of Americans say they have no religious affiliation. That is a major shift from five years ago, when 15 percent claimed no affiliation, or 40 years ago, when only 7 percent did. The numbers are even more stark for 18- to 22-year-olds, among whom more than one-third say they have no religious affiliation.

title: Malaysian Court Rejects Challenge to Cross-Dressing Ban
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  A challenge to a law barring Muslim men from dressing or posing as women was dismissed on Thursday by a Malaysian court, prompting concern that more transgender people in the Muslim-majority country may be prosecuted.

title: Turkish Premier Says Russian Munitions Were Found on Syrian Jet
description: MOSCOW  Turkeys confrontation with Syria spread on Thursday to include Russia, Syrias principal military ally, when Turkeys prime minister said Russian munitions intended for Syrias government had been impounded from a Syrian commercial jetliner forced to land in Turkey.

title: Bakrie Family Offers to Buy Assets from Bumi
description: 8:28 a.m. | Updated

title: Is Jugaad Going Global?
description: The word refers, literally, to a makeshift truck which my colleague Anand Giridharadas once memorably described as being tossed together, saladlike, in the sheds of northern India, beyond regulators view. Jugaad has also entered the lexicon as a concept known in management-speak as frugal innovation. For some in India, jugaad represents the best of India  the ability of an enterprising people to make do with less. For others, it represents shoddy products and shady practices for which the country has long been known, and a fatalistic acceptance of that reality.

title: Cute Androids From a 3-D Printer
description: While the iPhone 5 still commands the spotlight, the Android smartphone operating system has something that Apple never will: an adorable mascot, the Droid.

title: Harmony Touch Remote Needs Some Tuning
description: Logitechs Harmony remotes have long made it possible to reduce the collection of clickers on your coffee table by combining them into a single Harmony device.

title: Japan and South Korea Seek to Strengthen Economic Ties
description: TOKYO  The finance ministers of Japan and South Korea declared on Thursday that their nations would closely cooperate on economic and financial issues, in talks aimed at limiting the political damage from a diplomatic clash over contested islands.

title: A Closer Look at Romneys Small-Business Tax and Jobs Claims
description: At the first presidential match-up in Denver last week, Mitt Romney injected new charges into the discussion of what will happen to small businesses if taxes are raised on the wealthy. Speaking of President Obamas proposal to let the Bush-era tax cuts expire for those who earn more than $250,000, the Republican candidate told the president that the impact would be felt by only 3 percent of businesses but that those businesses happen to employ half  half  of all the people who work in small business. Those are the businesses that employ one-quarter of all the workers in America. And your plan is to take their tax rate from 35 percent to 40 percent.  The National Federation of Independent Businesses has said that will cost 700,000 jobs.

title: The Legend of the Potato King
description: A story in potato prints.

description: BERLIN &#8212 When Jess Erickson was still new to Berlin, only months into her first job at a young start-up company, she came to me with a question.

title: Self-Interest Leads to Collapse of BAE-EADS Merger
description: LONDON  So much for European integration.

title: R.B.S. Raises $1.3 Billion in Listing of Insurance Unit
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland stands to collect 787 million ($1.3 billion) through the initial public offering of its insurance unit Direct Line, which started trading on Thursday.

title: N.F.L. Week 6 Game Probabilities: Penalizing Pittsburgh
description: The numbers for my game prediction model arent always going to be perfect, so what I like to do is find out where the model differs most from the general consensus and then dig deeper to find out why. Looking over the game probabilities this week, one game stood out: tonights Steelers-Titans game. Pittsburgh is heavily favored by most experts, but surprisingly the model makes the Titans the favorite. Here are the stats that make up the inputs of the model. (YPA refers to passing yards per attempt, and SR refers to running Success Rate.)

title: For Solar Panel Industry, a Volley of Trade Cases
description: HONG KONG  The solar panel manufacturing industry in the United States and Europe has begun a volley of trade cases against imports, following the same track as the steel industry before it  and for many of the same reasons.

title: Oct. 10: Is Romney Leading Right Now?
description: Polling since the debate in Denver last week has generally been very strong for Mitt Romney. But there have also been a couple of rays of hope for Democrats and President Obama.

description: ON her new show, The Mindy Project, Mindy Kaling plays a single doctor who is irked but not undone by a male colleague telling her she should lose 15 pounds.

description: Dear Diary:

title: The Best Parenting Advice I Ever Got
description: It was 2006. Winter, and I was picking up my oldest son, Sam, at preschool. My friend Laura and I were going to take our boys and our bundled up baby girls ice skating. The gear was packed, and the plans were made, and Sam was running wildly around the cloakroom, disregarding again and again and again my pleas that he put on his coat and his boots. I asked him. I asked him again. And again. And then

title: On Our Radar: Death of an Oil Spill Survivor
description: One of the last two sea otters rescued from the 1989 Exxon Valdez oil spill in Alaska is euthanized at the Shedd Aquarium in Chicago after a rapid health decline. During the offshore spill, her oil-coated mother died, but a biologist was able to care for the otter cub in a hotel bathtub. [Associated Press]

title: Thursday Reading: Motorists Warned About Counterfeit Air Bags
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

description: From the editorial page

title: Indian River Dispute Pits Regional Control Against National Desires
description: My latest Letter From India column is about a bitter dispute between the southern Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu over the sharing of a river. It is a dispute that is more than a hundred years old, marked by long lulls and weeks of sudden tension.

title: Tip of the Week: Posting Photos Quickly to Facebook in iOS 6
description: Want to post pictures from e-mail messages directly to your Facebook page? If you have iOS 6  and the official Facebook app installed and configured on your iPhone, iPad or iPod Touch  you can post with a tap. (To install and set up the Facebook app, tap the Settings icon on the Home screen and select Facebook from the Settings menu.)

title: A Conversation With: Sushila Sharma, Haryana Women Commission Chief
description: At least thirteen rape cases have been reported in Haryana over the last 30 days  a disturbing statistic. Perhaps even more disconcerting is the diktat that a member of states Khap Panchayat, or self-styled council of village heads, issued late last week, in an attempt to stem such crimes. He said girls and boys should be married by age 16 to prevent rape. Under current law, men in India can get married at 21 years and woman at 18 years.

title: SiriusXM Set to Start Soccer Channel
description: Radio is a sound salvationRadio is cleaning up the nationThey say you better listen to the voice of reasonBut they dont give you any choice cause they think that its treasonSo you had better do as you are toldYou better listen to the radioRadio Radio by Elvis Costello

title: Yemeni Officer at U.S. Embassy in Sana Is Shot Dead
description: SANA, Yemen  A senior Yemeni officer working in the United States Embassy in Sana was killed here in the capital on Thursday in an attack that security sources said bore the hallmarks of the regional franchise of Al Qaeda. The killing comes amid sharp American scrutiny of security at foreign diplomatic posts in the wake of the militant assault one month ago on the United States Mission in Benghazi, Libya, which killed Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens and three other diplomatic personnel members.

title: Daily Report: Softbank Is Said to Be Near Sprint Deal
description: Softbank of Japan is nearing a deal to buy control of Sprint Nextel, giving the struggling American cellphone service provider a deep-pocketed backer to help finance its turnaround effort, Michael J. de la Merced reports for DealBook.

title: Voters in Three Swing States Predict Ryan Will Win Debate
description: More voters in three swing states said they expected Representative Paul D. Ryan would win tonights debate against Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., according to the latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News polls in Colorado, Virginia and Wisconsin.

title: Fab Revamps Mobile Shops Ahead of Holidays
description: For most Internet companies, mobile is synonymous with the future. For Fab, an online shop that sells designer furniture, housewares and other items, its synonymous with right now.

title: Celebrity Recruited to Make Case on Campaign-Finance Reform
description: Borrowing a tactic from the successful campaign to persuade Albany lawmakers to legalize same-sex marriage, advocates for the public financing of state elections are turning to a celebrity to make their case to New Yorkers.

title: Ad Conference Poised to Set New Attendance Record
description: The Association of National Advertisers, whose members are the senior marketers at Americas largest companies, expects to set another record for attendance at its annual conference.

title: Bookshelf | This Is a Cookbook
description: Theres plenty of people who go to fancy restaurants and eat awesome food but havent made the connection of making these awesome things at home, says Eli Sussman, a cook at Mile End Deli and co-author of the just-released cookbook This Is a Cookbook: Recipes for Real Life (Olive Press; $23). Adds Max, who is Elis brother, a chef de cuisine at Robertas and co-author of the book: Our approach is simple. We want people to cook, and not just be impressed with our pictures and recipes. The whole point is that we want people to get excited about cooking in their own house.

title: The Price in Politics for the Post-No-Bills Law
description: Maybe its time, even long past time, to rethink an important regulation governing political campaigns in New York City. To capture the spirit, we could call it the Anatole France Revision.

title: In New Poll, Kaine Ahead in Virginia Senate Race
description: Tim Kaine, the former Democratic governor of Virginia, has the lead in his race to join the Senate, despite a torrent of negative advertising from third-party groups on behalf of his Republican rival, George Allen, the states former senator.

title: In Hyderabad, a Focus on the Worlds Shrinking Biodiversity
description: HYDERABAD  If its Thursday, it must be Tree Diversity Day  at least for the nature lovers milling about the ballroom of a massive conference center in Hyderabad, home of the 11-day United Nations Conference on Biodiversity.

title: The Rolling Stones Bemoan Doom and Gloom
description: Over the course of their career the Rolling Stones have revealed themselves to be a surprisingly neurotic band: keeping tallies of your nervous breakdowns, pleading to be given shelter and wondering  were just paraphrasing here  if theyd ever attain any measure of satisfaction in their lives. Now, on their first single in six years, and at an average age of 68 1/4, Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Ronnie Wood and Charlie Watts have declared, once and for all, that all is Doom and Gloom. This song, which made its debut Thursday on BBC Radio 2 (and which we were pointed to by Stereogum) is one of two new tracks that will be included on GRRR!, a multi-disc greatest hits compilation that will be released on Nov. 12 to celebrate the bands 50th  50th?, yes 50th  anniversary. Doom and Gloom finds the Stones in classic, apocalyptic blues-rock-stomp mode, but with its contemporary references to shooting up hordes of zombies (and hydraulic fracturing), will it be their first track to find its way onto a trailer for The Walking Dead?

title: The Fallout From JPMorgans Loss
description: FALLOUT FROM JPMORGAN LOSS | Federal authorities are developing criminal cases related to the multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan Chase, and arrests could come in the next several months, report DealBooks Ben Protess and Azam Ahmed. As part of their effort, investigators are poring over thousands of recorded phone calls; in some, employees discussed how to value the troubled bets in a favorable way.

title: Views of Life, Straightforward and Spare
description: In her introduction to the excellent 1973 anthology The Poetry of Black America, Gwendolyn Brooks suggested that there were essentially two varieties of young black poets then extant. One type was made up of those who worked from what she called stormy resentments and may have begun their careers with columns of expletives or exhortations to kill the honky kill the honky kill the honky.

title: J. K. Rowling: By the Book
description: The author of Harry Potter and, now, The Casual Vacancy, says her favorite literary character is Jo March: It is hard to overstate what she meant to a small, plain girl called Jo.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Washington Post: Ann Romney has a cooking meltdown on the kitchen set of Good Morning America. Her famous Welsh cakes come out more like Welsh coals, and then the butter erupts.  Patrick Farrell

title: New Broadway Play to Star Estelle Parsons and Stephen Spinella
description: The Academy Award-winning actress Estelle Parsons (Bonnie and Clyde) and the Tony Award-winning actor Stephen Spinella (Angels in America) will come to Broadway in the spring of 2013 in The Velocity of Autumn, a new play by Eric Coble (Bright Ideas), who will be making his Broadway debut. Molly Smith, the artistic director of the Arena Stage in Washington, will direct. A Broadway theater and run dates are to be announced.

title: U.S. Increases Estimate for the Soybean Crop
description: WASHINGTON  After months of battling sweltering heat and drought, a bit of good news emerged for farmers on Thursday: the Agriculture Department revised its estimates for soybean production higher, a sign that the drought had less of an impact on the crop than feared.

title: Leading Off: Coast to Coast, Comeback Fever
description: For a night, it seemed, two baseball playoff games were trying to outdo each other for sheer audaciousness. On one coast you had the Yankees, down a run in the bottom of the ninth and the hapless Alex Rodriguez due up, only to have Manager Joe Girardi snap to his senses and create a hero out of whole cloth named Raul Ibanez, who not only tied the game with a home run, but later won it with another. On the other coast, you had the Oakland As topping that pandemonium from two runs down in the bottom of the ninth, the final heroics delivered by someone named Coco Crisp.

title: Paul Ryans Debate Challenge
description: Long before he was anointed Mitt Romneys running mate, Paul D. Ryan was the young hero of Washingtons supply-side crowd. And so it will be interesting to see how Mr. Ryan, in his debate with Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday, plans to navigate between his running mates latest ideological turn, on one hand, and the orthodoxy of economic conservatives on the other.

title: Is it a Good Time to Be a Girl in India?
description: Its one of the best times to be a girl in Indias history, according to a government release earlier this year. The number of girls in schools has increased. The maternal mortality ratio has dropped. The government has carved out more money for womens welfare measures in the budget. And for the first time, women outnumbered men in the number of literates added to the country in the last decade.

title: This Just In: Breaking Puzzle News
description: SPECIAL POST  Some items of interest for my fellow puzzleheads:

title: Browser Tools Can Help Block Tracking by Social Networks
description: Those small buttons on Web sites that are designed to let you share what youve read with your social networks have an equally important function: They let the social networks track your travels on the Web, whether or not you click on them. Now, there are a growing number of start-ups offering tools that help consumers keep that kind of tracking at bay.

title: Putting Losses on the Record
description: Business Day Live: Prosecutors using tapes to build criminal case over JPMorgan loss. | Privatizing Greeces Port of Piraeus. | E-mails suggest collusion between private equity giants.

description: Prosecutors using tapes to build criminal case over JPMorgan loss. | Privatizing Greeces port of Piraeus. | E-mails hint at collusion between private equity giants.

title: Study: Teenage Drivers Propensity for Risky Behavior Rises With Number of Teenage Passengers
description: Analyzing crash data from 2005-10, authors of a new study found speeding, drinking and late-night driving were more prevalent among 16- and 17-year-old drivers involved in fatal crashes when the drivers were accompanied by teenage passengers. The risk of a fatal crash increased as the number of teenage passengers increased.

title: Flying Without a Photo ID
description: Not only are extra fees for checked bags annoying, but they nearly caused me to miss a flight.

title: Week 5 Film Review, Including Cassel, Quinn and Flacco
description: Andy Benoit takes a closer look at some of the Week 5 games, with the benefit of film analysis.

title: Occupation Tourism
description: MOUNT GERIZIM, West Bank  Last week, with family in tow, I took the day off to go on an organized tour of the West Bank. The trip started in Peduel, a Jewish settlement half an hour from central Tel Aviv. Its a scenic spot. Ariel Sharon used to call it the balcony of Israel: located on top of a mountain in the Samaria region, Peduel reveals below the big cities of Israel that lie near the Mediterranean shore.

title: Poetry Pairing | Hip-Hop Ghazal
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches Hip-Hop Ghazal by Patricia Smith with Why Afghan Women Risk Death to Write Poetry, an article about a womens literary society based in Kabul.

Sign of Change on a Block Skipped, Until Now, by Harlems Rebirth
description: There have been promises of a shiny hotel, a big office tower and a prominent commercial corridor. But in one bleak little pocket of Harlem, things have had a way of coming undone.

description: 4:19 p.m. | Updated

title: Sprint Says It Is in Negotiations With SoftBank of Japan
description: 9:47 p.m. | Updated

title: Turhan Bey, Actor With Continental Charm, Dies at 90
description: Turhan Bey, whose dark good looks, swept-back hair and soothing, Continental voice brought him fame in swashbuckling films of the 1940s, died in Vienna on Sept. 30. Mr. Bey, who was a fashion photographer in his later years, was 90.

title: Globespotter  South Korea: Gangnam Style and 304 Films at Busan Festival
description: Asias largest film festival is under way in Busan, South Korea. With 304 films showing on 37 screens, guest appearances by Asias biggest movie stars and a live performance of Gangnam Style by the goofy rapper (and overnight international sensation) Psy, the 2012 Busan International Film Festival (BIFF) is set to be the glitziest in its 17-year history.

title: Zero Motorcycles Refreshes Lineup With Faster and Longer-Range Electric Rides
description: With few units actually produced and sold, the electric motorcycle business has, by and large, been more hype than horsepower. The 2013 model line for Zero Motorcycles, recently introduced at the Intermt Motorcycle, Scooter and Bicycle show in Cologne, Germany, indicates the companys determination to make owning and riding an electric bike more appealing to the riding public.

title: University of Virginia Announces Chair in Mormon Studies
description: The University of Virginia has announced a new endowed chair in Mormon studies, making it the first university in the East to have such a position. The chair will be named for Richard Lyman Bushman, a distinguished historian of early America who taught for many years at Columbia University and more recently directed the Mormon studies program at Claremont Graduate University in Claremont, Calif., which in 2008 became the first secular institution outside Utah to offer such a program.

title: V.I.P.s, and a Few Buyers, at Frieze Art Fair
description: LONDON  There was an air of focused intent  schmoozing later, please  as Frieze, the annual contemporary art fair in Regents Park, opened its doors for the V.I.P. preview yesterday. Down a corridor of eye-popping green, yellow, black and red (a commissioned Frieze Project, from the German artist Thomas Bayrle) went the Serious Collectors, the museum curators, the art advisors and anyone well-connected enough to procure a coveted early pass.

title: Carine Roitfeld Adds Harpers Bazaar to Her Portfolio
description: A month after introducing her new CR Fashion Book magazine, Carine Roitfeld has added a title to her rsum. On Thursday, Hearst Magazines named Ms. Roitfeld to the newly created position of global fashion director for Harpers Bazaar, a somewhat unusual role in that she will collaborate with editors from all 26 international editions of the magazine.

title: Mushrooming Interests
description: AZDAVAY, Turkey  The best way to preserve biodiversity is to attack it with a knife and fork.

title: Reaching 90 With Only Three Prescriptions
description: My father, Murray Span, turned 90 a few days ago.

title: Banks See Home Loans as Gateway to Big Gains
description: 8:35 p.m. | Updated

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: What Will You Be Watching?
description: The National Hockey League season was to open Thursday with four games: Boston at Philadelphia, Ottawa at Montreal, St. Louis at Colorado and Vancouver at Calgary. But those games will not be played. Instead the leaders of the N.H.L. and its players union are meeting in New York to continue negotiations for a new labor contract. Instead the Vezina Trophy finalist Pekka Rinne is likely to be in goal for Dinamo Minsk against Ruslan Fedotenko and Alexei Ponikarovsky of Donbass in a K.H.L. game in Ukraine. Instead of skating for the Flyers tonight, Claude Giroux and Danny Briere are expected to suit up for Eisberen Berlin on Friday.

title: A Call to Parents: Ask an Expert About Paying for College
description: If you are an older parent who has questions about financing your childs college education, there is an expert who wants to hear from you.

title: A Lament About Tasting Menus Strikes a Chord
description: The reaction to my piece about the pitfalls of tasting menus and the rise of restaurants that specialize in them has been a little overwhelming. There were moments as I was writing it when I thought I was climbing far out on a limb all by myself.

title: How to Read Like a Magazine Designer
description: Drea Zlanabitnig is a designer at the magazine.

title: Drug Case Against Lance Armstrong
description: The U.S. Anti-Doping Agency said on Wednesday that Armstrong was at the center of the most sophisticated doping program in recent sports history.

title: 10 Years After Bali Bombings, Local Militants Still Pose Threat
description: JAKARTA  Ansyaad Mbai, the director of Indonesias National Counterterrorism Agency, has a genealogy of terrorism spread across his office wall. It starts in 1949, the year Dutch colonizers acknowledged Indonesias independence, and extends to 2011. Like a family tree, it begins with one line and gradually branches out into an increasingly complex web with names and photos of the countrys most notorious terrorists.

title: The Candle Man
description: Does the world really need more scented candles? Bien sr, says Frederick Bouchardy, whose Brooklyn-based fragrance house, Joya, produces candles for companies like Malin & Goetz, Barneys New York and Kiki de Montparnasse, as well as for his own line.

title: Novel Neighborhoods
description: Two years ago, when a magazine named me one of five Brooklyn writers to look out for, I was thrilled and gratified, but troubled by just one thing: I didnt live in Brooklyn, and never had.

title: The Port of Piraeus
description: A port in Greece that is half leased by Cosco, a Chinese global shipping company.

title: Inside Girardis Big Decision That Won Game 3
description: In the ninth inning of Game 3 of the A.L.D.S. between the Yankees and Orioles on Wednesday night, after seeing one lost slugger after another fail to generate any momentum at the plate, Yankees Manager Joe Girardi did what would have been unthinkable just a few years ago: he pinch hit for Alex Rodriguez.

title: Savoring the Rewards of Button Pushing
description: THE work of the playwright Thomas Bradshaw has been described as depicting life with all the boring parts taken out. It might also be described as life with all the ghastly extremes  incest, pedophilia, rape, racially motivated murder  added back in, and depicted in a deadpan style that has prompted both big laughs and angry walkouts. In Job, which runs at the Flea Theater through Nov. 3, Mr. Bradshaw, 32, takes on that biblical story in a production Ben Brantley of The New York Times called a jolting treat. Speaking with Jennifer Schuessler by phone from Evanston, Ill., where he teaches at Northwestern University, Mr. Bradshaw talked about the play and the philosophy behind his button-pushing work. Here are excerpts from the conversation.

title: Enough Struggling Sluggers to Fill a Dugout
description: Alex Rodriguez might have been the batter replaced in the pinch-hit heard round the Internet on Wednesday night, but he is far from alone when it comes to star players who are struggling in the American League division series between the Yankees and the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Tom Hanks to Star on Broadway in Lucky Guy
description: Tom Hanks will make his Broadway debut in March playing the New York tabloid columnist Mike McAlary in the world premiere production of Lucky Guy, a bio-drama by Nora Ephron that she had been writing for years until her death in June, the producers of the play announced on Thursday.

title: How the South Lost the Bluegrass State
description: As John Hunt Morgans cavalry dashed across central Kentucky in July 1862, this scion of the Bluegrass, the man known as the Thunderbolt of the Confederacy, promised local citizens that he would respect their private property and target only the Federal military supply lines and depots guarded by poorly trained Home Guard units.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Family Gatherings and Green Men Sightings Shift in Vancouver
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  A tradition takes place in the Stephens household at this time of year. All the adult children, their children and significant others congregate to the family home in Richmond, British Columbia, to watch Vancouver Canucks games on TV.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Argo
description: Ben Affleck, the director of Argo, discusses a scene from the film.

title: Health Care Under Romney: The Status Quo Ante
description: Mitt Romney, who has promised to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, but has never explained what the replacement will look like, hinted on Wednesday that his secret plan is to bring back the status quo ante.

title: Channel Surfing: Supernatural, Sapped of Energy
description: This season, the critics Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger are checking out favorite shows and seeing how they hold up. Previous entries in this series include posts on New Girl, NCIS, Scandal, The Good Wife, 30 Rock and Dexter.

title: The Women Pulling Your Pints
description: Bar work for women is no longer just the terrain of widows or fearsome brutes.

title: Women Behind Bars
description: For much of the citys history, it seems, the only women for whom bar work was deemed appropriate were widows or fearsome brutes. W. Harrison Bayless 1915 history, Old Taverns of New York, recounts tales of female barkeeps stretching back to the 17th century, when a widow named Annetje Cock inherited her husbands tavern. Early in the next century, another establishment, the Widow Posts, became a favorite place for members of assembly. Then there was Gallus Mag, bouncer and general factotum of a notorious Water Street dive mentioned in Herbert Asburys Gangs of New York, who stalked fiercely about the dive with a pistol stuck in her belt.

title: What a Crate in Syria Says About Saudi Help to the Rebels
description: Earlier this week, the BBC published a report documenting the apparent hand of Saudi Arabia in the transfer of Ukrainian arms to Syrias rebels. The report was accompanied by a photograph of a wooden munitions crate bearing a label showing that the crate had been packed at a factory listed as LCW, in the eastern Ukrainian city of Luhansk, and then shipped to Saudi Arabia.

title: Report Describes How Armstrong and His Team Eluded Doping Tests
description: Throughout his career, Lance Armstrong always responded to doping accusations by saying he had been tested for banned substances hundreds of times and never produced a positive result. How could the worlds greatest cyclist, always in the cross hairs of doping officials, never fail a drug test if he was doping, Armstrong reasoned.

title: A Start-Up Helps Tourists Plan Vacations and Local Businesses Sell Tickets
description: Booking flights and hotels online is easy, but what about planning your daily itinerary once you arrive at your destination? Peek, a San Francisco start-up that opens to the public Thursday, tries to help with that.

title: Outwitting the Ayatollah With Hollywoods Help
description: At one point in Argo, a smart, jittery thriller about a freakish and little-known chapter of the Iranian hostage crisis, a Hollywood producer says that history starts as farce and ends up as tragedy. He seems, as someone rightly points out, to have it backward. But as a professional dissembler, he knows better. Because much like the revolutionary shock troops who seized the United States embassy on Nov. 4, 1979, and turned the crisis into gripping political theater watched by the entire world  tune in tomorrow when America goes on trial, with the special guest star the Ayatollah Khomeini  the producer knows that historical events alone dont cut it. You need lights, camera, action.

title: Pok Pok Phat Thai
description: Inside Andy Rickers new restaurant, which replaced Pok Pok Wing.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Argo
description: For his third feature as a director, Argo, Ben Affleck looked to alittle-known chapter of the 1979 Iranian hostage crisis that was ripe for film treatment. Argo tells the story of Tony Mendez (played by Mr. Affleck), a C.I.A. exfiltration specialist who devises a plan to extract six Americans in hiding out of Iran by posing as the producer of a movie.

title: Debate Coverage at a Glance
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan will square off Thursday in Danville, Ky., at 9 p.m. Eastern in their only vice presidential debate. Visit nytimes.com for comprehensive coverage, including:

title: Drinks That Come With the Perfect Soundtrack
description: Sometimes the music really can make the place. A couple of weeks ago at the Guthrie Inn on upper Park Avenue, it was Motown: Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell singing Aint No Mountain High Enough; Smokey Robinson and the Miracles Youve Really Got a Hold on Me; the OJays Use ta Be My Girl.

title: Poking Fun at My Patients
description: My patient was sitting on the exam table when I walked in. She was 40 and had recently completed a course of chemotherapy in the hospital for acute leukemia, diagnosed six weeks earlier when it cropped up all of a sudden, as leukemia is wont to do, after blood tests acquired in the setting of a head cold came back horribly wrong.

title: Kids Draw the News: A Baby Walrus Arrives
description: New Assignment

title: Go Ahead, Milk My Day
description: Buffalo mozzarella is the Great White Whale of American cheesemaking: a dream so exotic and powerful that it drives otherwise sensible people into ruinous monomaniacal quests. Despite all the recent triumphs of our countrys foodie movement (heirloom-turkey-sausage saffron Popsicles; cardamom paprika mayonnaise foam), no one in the United States has, as of yet, figured out how to recreate precisely this relatively simple Old World delicacy  a food with essentially one ingredient (buffalo milk) that is made every day in Italy.
