Over the last 15 years, in fact, the attempt to make authentic buffalo mozzarella  to nail both its taste and texture  has destroyed businesses from Vermont to Los Angeles. It seems truly doomed. A Polar wind blows through it, Melville might have written about it, if he had been a food writer, and birds of prey hover over it.

title: Kids Draw the News: Spider-Man in Brooklyn
description: Children share their visions of the superhero in New York City, the subject of a new comic.

title: Pad Thai Has a New Best Friend
description: THE crimes committed against pad Thai in this country include: Congealed noodles. White sugar by the fistful. Soy sauce. Ketchup. Apocalyptically, peanut butter.

title: The Dangers of Allowing an Adversary Access to a Network
description: Schoolchildren learn the tale of the Trojan Horse, the giant gift in which Odysseus and a platoon of 30 Greek soldiers hid to gain access to the heavily defended city.

title: Now Booking | Boscolo Bari
description: Though it has been prized by Italian alpha males from Augustus to Mussolini, the Mediterranean city of Bari always basked in relative obscurity. But now Puglias warm and rambunctious capital is coming into its own as a serious travel destination, comfortably removed from the tourist trifecta of Venice, Florence and Rome. Last month, this city welcomed its first five-star hotel, the 115-room Boscolo Bari (doubles from about $250 per night). And if youve ever wanted to take a luxury cruise that doesnt go anywhere, your ship has come in.

title: A Roving Troubadour, With an Eye on Your Couch
description: A touring musician needs a way to transport his gear, so Gideon Irving, a singer-songwriter who plays about a dozen instruments during his one-man show, recently bought a used shopping cart and a pair of Rollerblades for his monthlong tour of New York City.

title: Flights Wont Change, but Bus to La Guardia Will Get Easier
description: Getting to La Guardia Airport by public transportation has never been a picnic.

title: No Pride in Prejudice: Looking Beyond the Gender Labels to Experience Literature
Stoudemire to Miss Knicks Preseason Opener
description: WASHINGTON  The Knicks will play their preseason opener Thursday night against the Washington Wizards without forward Amare Stoudemire, who will sit out after bruising his left knee in practice Wednesday. The Knicks said Stoudemire bumped knees with a teammate and could not finish the practice.

title: Icahn Bids to Take Control of Oshkosh Truck
description: 4:56 p.m. | Updated

title: Preview of the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: TimesCast Politics: New data from Virginia, Colorado and Wisconsin. | Highlights from past vice-presidential debates. | The role of the moderators. | Challenges for each candidate.

title: Sibling Rivalry Plays Out in Cardinals-Nationals Series
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  Judy Baradas husband could not make it to a dinner honoring St. Louis Cardinals shortstop Ozzie Smith upon his retirement in 1996, so Bob Carpenter, one of the teams television broadcasters, escorted her instead.

title: Latinos Favor Obama by Wide Margin, Poll Finds
description: Latinos who are registered voters favor President Obama by 69 percent to 21 percent over Mitt Romney, according to a national poll published on Thursday by the Pew Hispanic Center. The margin has not changed during this year despite recent efforts by Mr. Romney to lure some Latinos.

title: TimesCast Politics: New Polling From Swing States and a Debate Preview
description: Getty Images

title: Chinese Parents Sue Consultant After Sons Are Rejected by Harvard
description: A cautionary tale about educational consultants:

title: As Manager Provides Calmness in Wild Series
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  It was March 1999 and Bob Melvin was in his first spring training as a member of a major league coaching staff. He was at Maryvale Baseball Park in Phoenix at the behest of Milwaukee Brewers Manager Phil Garner, who had tabbed his old San Francisco Giants teammate to be his bench coach, his right-hand man  and on this day, his taskmaster.

title: Planned New York Media Center Gets a Developer, and an Address in Brooklyn
description: The planned Made in NY media center, a project favored by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, took a big step forward on Thursday as New York City officials designated the Independent Filmmaker Project, a nonprofit, as its developer and operator. They also named a building at 20 Jay Street in Brooklyns Dumbo district as the centers location. The building, designed in 1909 for the Arbuckle Brothers coffee roasting company, is currently a New York City landmark.

title: A Cocktail History Lesson, Page by Page
description: Bartenders and cocktail enthusiasts intent on searching out-of-print cocktail books for the bygone mixology secrets therein need to have a lot of money, a lot of luck and quick eBay reflexes. In the near future, however, they may only need Internet access.

title: A Restrained Outlook on Jobs
description: Moodys Analytics hasnt changed its near-term forecasts this week in its latest update to our weekly pre-election jobs tracker. But its economists add a splash of cold water to some of the numbers that have emerged in recent days.

title: Theater Talkback: When Stardom Bites Back
description: Can an actors devoted following also be his worst enemy?

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Alls Quiet at the Prudential Center
description: NEWARK  The Devils, the reigning Eastern Conference champions, would have been finishing a late-morning practice and would have been headed for their season opener Friday in Washington. There was no practice Thursday, and there was no bus bound for the airport in the driveway next to the arena.

title: Why Wasnt Libya Hearing on Page A1 of The Times?
description: Stories about Wednesdays Congressional hearing on Libya were prominently displayed on the front pages of major newspapers throughout the United States on Thursday morning.

title: His Style Is Gangnam, and Viral Too
description: THERE are global cultural phenomena, and then there is Gangnam Style. The viral video for that Korean pop song has racked up over 400 million views on YouTube, becoming the most-liked video in the sites history. Its flashy style and galloping, invisible-horse dance have inspired hundreds of tributes, from West Point cadets to Filipino prisoners.

title: Plump and Proud
description: Actresses like Mindy Kaling and Lena Dunham are challenging the stereotype of the svelte leading lady.

title: Scenes From Siena, Italy
description: Travel from the heart of this medieval city to the surrounding Tuscan countryside.

title: 36 Hours in Siena, Italy
description: In many ways Siena hasnt changed much in 800 years. And thats a good thing. The towns gorgeous 13th-century main square, the Piazza del Campo, is still the citys symbolic and physical heart. The twice-a-summer bareback horse race, Il Palio, is still the most anticipated event, and the contrade, or neighborhood associations, still inspire a loyalty as deep as they did in medieval times. At the same time the ancient university here continues to deliver important research while imbuing the town with a youthful spirit. Florence, Sienas biggest rival to the north, may have won the battle in terms of historical significance and blockbuster art over the centuries, but Siena is decidedly less touristy and more livable. In the past few years, new boutiques and wine bars (not to mention updated restaurants) have been sprinkled in among some newly restored treasures.

title: A Meeting of French and American Minds
description: The Salon de Fleurus, a mysterious SoHo installation recreating Gertrude Steins art-filled Paris living room that James Barron profiles in City Room today, has closed for the season. But New Yorkers seeking a virtual encounter with the space can still get a seat tonight at the Museum of Modern Art, where five writers and artists will discuss their experiences with the room the art critic Kim Levin called a black hole with the potential of sucking 80 years worth of avant-garde incident into its force field.

title: The E-tail Flea | Kneeland Mercado
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: One Fathers 100 Must-Read Picture Books  and Mine, Too
description: Mike Petrilli, education analyst, blogger and father of two sons, has come up with The Kindergarten Canon, a list of 100 picture books that every English-speaking child should be familiar with. No, should isnt really the right word. Its a list, he says, of the books every English-speaking child, or adult, already is familiar with: books known to nearly everyone. Books that we reference. Stories that make up the backbone of casual, allusion-filled conversation, like Green Eggs and Ham and Where the Wild Things Are and Winnie-the-Pooh.

title: Increasing Savings With Promotional C.D. Rates
description: Earlier this week, Bucks wrote about using laddering of certificates of deposit as a way to eke out extra interest on your savings. The Web site NerdWallet has done an analysis of banks and credit unions, and has another suggestion for increasing savings rates: promotional or bonus rates on C.D.s.

title: City of Oakland vs. the Federal Government
description:
The City of Oakland filed a complaint in United States District Court 
seeking to prevent the federal government from seizing a building used by a medical cannabis dispensary.

title: Trailer: 'El Gusto'
description: The film explores chaabi musicians.

title: U.S. Struggles to Rescue Green Program Hit by Fraud
description: WASHINGTON  A Maryland man is awaiting sentencing for what may seem an unusual crime: selling bogus renewable energy credits and using the $9.3 million in illicit proceeds to buy jewelry and a fleet of luxury cars.

title: Before Ibanez Pinch-Hit, There Was Dusty Rhodes
description: It is one of the most shamelessly theatrical moments in sports, almost too implausible for a novel or movie: the modestly regarded substitute comes off the bench and wins the game by smashing a home run  or even two.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Plenty of Games, if You Have Two Goalies
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y.  Whenever the N.H.L. has one of its periodic lockouts, like the one that canceled what would have been opening night Thursday, people say theres no hockey.

title: Digital Ad Report Finds Big Growth in Mobile
description: Mobile continues to be a sweet spot for digital advertising according to a report issued by the Interactive Advertising Bureau on Thursday. For the first half of 2012, revenue in the category increased 95 percent to $1.2 billion, nearly eclipsing total mobile advertising revenue for the entire year of 2011, at $1.6 billion.

title: Nicks Still Hopes to Play Against 49ers
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Hakeem Nicks, who has missed three consecutive games for the Giants with injuries to his knee and his surgically-repaired right foot, is still hoping to be able to play at the San Francisco on Sunday.

title: A New iPad Browser Surfs the Web So You Dont Have To
description: What if your Internet browser showed you what it thought you wanted to see online, instead of waiting for you to direct it?

title: On Abortion, an Ideologue and a Flip-Flopper
description: Last November, before the primaries were under way, Bill Clinton helped President Obama devise a strategy against Mitt Romney. As Ryan Lizza reported recently in The New Yorker, Mr. Clinton told the Obama campaign to paint Mr. Romney as a right-wing ideologue, rather than a flip-flopper: If they defined Romney as a flip-flopper, undecided voters might think that he could return to his moderate roots once he was in office.

title: For Its American Debut, Jaguar F-Type Gets an Unexpected Chaperone
description: PARAMUS, N.J.  Ratan Tata, chairman of Tata Motors, the parent of Jaguar Land Rover, paid a visit to this realm of shopping malls and car dealerships on Wednesday evening to inaugurate Prestige Jaguar Land Rover of Paramus. The store is operated by Prestige, one of the companys top-performing dealers.

title: Things We Love (That We Think No One Else Loves)
A Good Season for Valverde, but Not an Overpowering One
description: OAKLAND  Expecting a second consecutive year of closing perfection from Jose Valverde would have been ridiculous. Since saves became an official statistic in 1969, only three relievers saved as many as 40 games in a season without a single failure  Detroits Valverde last year (49), Eric Gagne of the Dodgers in 2003 (55), and Brad Lidge of the Phillies in 2008 (41).

title: Excerpt: 'Cyrano de Bergerac'
description: Douglas Hodge as the title character in the Roundabout Theater Company's revival at the American Airlines Theater.

title: Burberry Confirms Slowdown in Chinese Sales
description: LONDON  The Burberry Group, the British fashion house whose shares plunged last month after a profit warning sent shock waves through the luxury goods industry, sought to reassure investors Thursday with an interim report of slightly higher sales in the first half, driven by strength in several overseas markets.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate Poses Challenges on Substance and Style
description: The debate on Thursday night between Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.  and Representative Paul D. Ryan will be split into nine, 10-minute segments, with Martha Raddatz, the moderator, choosing the topics for each.

title: Mile 4: Where Tony Manero Stayed Alive
description: With New York City Marathon runners now settled on Fourth Avenue for a lengthy stretch, many take stock of their pace, grab their first cup of water or high-five a child for the first of, oh, a hundred times.

title: Documentary Promises the Personal Side of L.T.
description: Pete Radovich, the creative director for CBS Sports, had been hearing Lawrence Taylor stories for years from his longtime broadcasting colleague Phil Simms. There seemed such an endless supply of Taylor yarns that Radovich was stunned to learn last year that no one had done a documentary on Taylors life or career.

title: Suspect in Soccer Coachs Killing Left Apology, Police Say
description: The main suspect in the stabbing death of a British soccer coach in Manhattan left a note in his apartment apologizing for his actions before fleeing to Mexico, the New York police commissioner said Thursday.

title: Executives Missteps Doomed Aerospace Merger
description: PARIS  No sooner had negotiations over the would-be aerospace mega-merger of BAE Systems and European Aeronautic Defense & Space collapsed than the recriminations began.

title: Rodriguez Batting Fifth; Jeter Designated Hitter for Game 4
description: We now have answers to the most pressing questions surrounding the Yankees lineup for Game 4.

title: Fallen Police Officers Are Remembered
Mo Yan: Excerpts From His Work
description: Below are selections from the work of Mo Yan who was awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize in Literature on Thursday. The excerpt from Red Sorghum is reprinted by arrangement with Penguin Books, a member of Penguin Group (USA) Inc. All other excerpts appear courtesy of Arcade Publishing. The books were translated from the Chinese by Howard Goldblatt.

title: Yankees Run Allows Girardi No Time to Grieve
description: Joe Girardi has managed the Yankees in the entire division series after his father, Jerry, who had Alzheimers disease, died at age 81.

title: Mets Exhibition Catalogs Revived for a Digital Life
description: Thomas P. Campbell, director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, said he remembered working for years on sumptuously illustrated, erudite exhibition catalogs only to see them quickly fall out of print.

title: What He Prefers: Staying at Home to Spin Gold
description: THERE are times when Daniel Brush appears to be a modern-day version of Melvilles naysaying Bartleby the Scrivener: Usually he would prefer not to do any of the things that a contemporary artist normally does.

title: Will Seismic Blasts Upend Atlantic Marine Life?
description: As a federal decision draws near, environmental and commercial fishing groups are marshaling their forces to protest a plan by the Obama administration to allow seismic airgun testing for oil and gas exploration off the Atlantic coast.

title: A Defector Goes Unseen, Embarrassing South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A North Korean soldier who defected to South Korea this month not only scaled three barbed-wire fences along one of the worlds most heavily patrolled borders without being detected, he also had to knock on barracks doors  twice  when he reached the South to get any attention.

title: Blue Steel Gold Light
description: A look at the work of the artist Daniel Brush.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Long Drives Are Worth It for DePaul Team
description: NORTHBROOK, Ill.  Trish Murray loves hockey. But after years spent in drafty rinks watching her son Ryan play, she also likes to bring a good book to help her get through long practices. On Thursday afternoon at the North Shore Ice Arena in suburban Chicago, Murray was immersed in Gillian Flynns bestseller Gone Girl, while her husband, James, the only other spectator at the rink, watched Ryan and his teammates on the DePaul University Blue Demons work on their power play.

title: Drunk With Power
description: Standing in the low-ceilinged basement of a rundown Seattle bungalow, among the shiny steel vats and plastic tubing that constitute Animale winery, the wine merchant Jon Rimmerman swirled his glass, sniffed its bouquet, took a sip and moved his mouth around as if chewing. A fair-skinned, dapper and somewhat elfin man, Rimmerman wore Kelly green jeans, a lavender sweater and a black-and-white plaid sportcoat. Salt-and-pepper curls bushed out from under his Greek fishermans cap as he bent over a white plastic bucket. Spitting out a great purple jet of wine, Rimmerman signaled to the winemaker Matt Gubitosa that he could taste exactly one more vintage before leaving.

title: Cooking Isnt Creative, and It Isnt Easy
description: Inside the renovated Le Bernardin in Midtown Manhattan, the pink flowers are as tall as dogwoods and the latticework walls give off a coppery, sci-fi sheen, and Christopher Kimball, the most influential home cook in America, prods a fork into an appetizer of Wagyu beef, langoustine and osetra caviar from China. He pulls apart the cylinder and glances skeptically inside. Im happier eating at Di Fara, he claims, meaning the slice parlor in an Orthodox Jewish section of Midwood, Brooklyn, that has been occasionally hounded by the citys Health Department. Just real pizza, Kimball enthuses. No duck sausage and crap. Its true that he appears out of place amid the restaurants boardroom-in-space dcor; with his bow tie, suspenders and severely parted hair, Kimball looks like someone who mightve sold homeowners insurance to Calvin Coolidge.

title: Who Made That Whisk?
description: In 1963, Julia Child appeared on a television show called Ive Been Reading, to promote her book Mastering the Art of French Cooking. While most guests chatted primly about their new releases, Child brandished a bulb-shaped whisk and then performed magic, inflating egg whites into snowy peaks of foam. She told the audience that you needed a soft balloon whisk if you were trying to get air into a meringue, and a stiff whisk for mixing, says Stephanie Hersh, who worked as Childs assistant for 16 years. After Childs bravura performance that day  27 viewers wrote in to the station to demand more  she was given her own show and became one of Americas most-recognized TV celebrities. The whisk, with its soigne curves and the jazz-brush sound it made in the bowl, proved to be just as telegenic.

title: David Lynch Double Bill
description: Whether you see David Lynch as the North Star or the black hole in the Hollywood firmament depends on your taste. But as the director of films like Blue Velvet and Wild at Heart and the co-creator of the cult television series Twin Peaks, Mr. Lynch is responsible for some of the most bizarre and macabre characters and scenes in the history of cinema.

title: How to Stuff Your Face Like a President
description: A photo gallery of presidents, candidates and food.

title: Dale Talde Joining Thistle Hill Tavern
description: Dale Talde has become the chef and a partner in Thistle Hill Tavern, in Park Slope, Brooklyn. The owners of Thistle Hill, John Bush and David Massoni, are his partners in his new restaurants, Talde and Pork Slope, nearby, so now the three of them own all three places. Mr. Talde has put Kerwin Chu in the kitchen at Thistle Hill as the executive chef, and he is casting a more traditional American tavern menu, in place of the Mediterranean-accented menu that the previous chef, Rebecca Weitzman, was serving. The menu includes a Southern fried half-chicken, a house-smoked 16-ounce pork chop and a squash-and-pear soup with a grilled cheese sandwich.

title: Photo Replay: Oct. 11
description: The day in sports included international tennis, basketball in China and the major league baseball playoffs.

title: Fantasy Football: Thursdays Matchups
description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: The Searcher
description: In 1993, when Lois Lowry shocked adult and child sensibilities alike with her Newbery Medal-winning novel The Giver, J. K. Rowling had not yet begun scribbling magic words on the back of cafe napkins and Stephenie Meyer had just graduated from her (presumably vampire-free) high school. Suzanne Collins had just sold her first teleplays for the gentle, nonviolent world of childrens television, and dystopia was a 50-cent SAT word unlikely to trip off the average sixth-grade tongue.

title: When I Was a New York Times Restaurant Critic ...
description: Worst dish ever encountered

title: Pakistani Girl Airlifted to Military Hospital
description: Malala Yousafzai, the 14-year-old Pakistani schoolgirl who was shot in the head by Taliban militants this week, was airlifted on Thursday to a leading military hospital in Rawalpindi, near the headquarters of the Pakistani Army.

title: Chicken Kneecaps in Tokyo, Soil-Inspired Cocktails in London and Other (Unusual) Culinary Quests
description: In Search of the TonguegasmBy Nathaniel Rich

title: What Im Into ...
description: Al Michaels Broadcaster

title: If the Dude Abides, So Should You
description: Sweet stuff has a pretty sour reputation. Not only is it supposed to be bad for us, but where liquor is concerned, its also regarded as unsophisticated (The Big Lebowski notwithstanding  the Dude changed the fortunes of the White Russian forever).

title: Before a Wave of Meningitis, Shots Were Tied to Risks
description: Perry D. Clark says that a steroid injected near his spine to relieve persistent back pain instead left him way, way worse. Twelve years later, he still suffers from continuous stinging in his legs and feet and occasional bursts of excruciating pain.

title: The Food and Drink Issue
description: This years Food & Drink issue is about obsessions, great and small, from eating reindeer steaks in Greenland to one former tech moguls pursuit of the perfect buffalo mozzarella.

title: Loud and In Tents | Frieze London
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Bahrain, Nepal and India.

title: Light Gang Rape Penalties Provoke Outcry in France
description: PARIS  A French jury handed down light sentences and acquittals in a closely watched gang-rape case late Wednesday, prompting outrage from womens advocacy groups and consternation from government ministers.

title: After Fiery Florida Rally, Obama Focuses on Debate Work
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  To campaign or to study? For President Obama, that has become the question.

title: Two Sets of Two-Wheeling Adventures
description: ON a recent weekend bike ride, David Winner paused on Randalls Island for a gulp from his water bottle. Although Mr. Winner, a television sports producer, had already cycled through Brooklyn and Queens from his home in the West Village, he couldnt resist a spin on the waterside paths on the island before calling it a day. You just totally get away, he said.

title: A Celestial Show From a Tiffany Window
description: Louis Comfort Tiffany encouraged his crafts people to specialize in catering to the grief-stricken. His factory, in Corona, Queens, offered stock and custom window designs for houses of worship, to be installed in memory of loved ones.

title: Editor's Note: The Food Issue
description: Special guests help editor-in-chief Hugo Lindgren and the story editor Jon Kelly craft a lineup for the magazine's Food & Drink issue.

title: Bush-Era Feud Plays Out in Senate Ad in Arizona
description: 11:13 a.m. | Updated In perhaps no race has the Bush administration played a bigger role than the Arizona Senate contest, where a new attack features a former health official accusing Richard Carmona of severe anger issues.

title: Robert Adams at Matthew Marks Gallery
description: On Any Given Day in Spring and Light Balances

title: At Home in Italy, Wherever You Are
description: EARLIER this year, when asked what Italian cuisine hed like to see better represented in New York, Mario Batali said, without hesitation, the food of Apulia.

title: In Southern Italy, a Chance to Be More Than Just a Bargain
description: LIKE Italian food, Italian red wine has an innate, almost elemental appeal. Regardless of where in Italy it comes from, good Italian red wine speaks directly to the soul, and the gut, of place and people and food and love. And thats just the beginning; great wines embrace the head as well.

title: Sarah Oppenheimers D-33 at P.P.O.W.
Zoe Leonards 453 West 17th Street at Murray Guy
description: 453 West 17th Street

title: Comedy Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Comedy

title: Movie Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Movies

title: Family Biking at Lehigh Gorge State Park
description: IM no topologist, but I think I know a thing or two about hills. And one of those things is that if they go down on one side, they almost certainly go up on the other. That latter part is of particular interest to bicyclists, especially if the hill is on the large side.

title: We the People at Robert Rauschenberg Foundation Space
description: Robert Rauschenberg Foundation Project Space

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: No Sulking, Just Skating in Minnesota
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn.  Here in the land of 10,000 lakes and countless backyard ponds, home of the coaching legend Herb Brooks and his largely Minnesotan Miracle on Ice Olympians, where Disney based its Mighty Ducks and the former Gov. Tim Pawlenty was known to lace up on Sunday nights, the puck does not stop with an N.H.L. lockout.

title: Body and Soul, From the Surrealistic to the Fetishistic
description: The small but intense survey of Alina Szapocznikow at the Museum of Modern Art is in some ways the story of postwar sculpture. Classical bronzes give way to puddles of poured resin; the figure walks down off the pedestal and comes back in pieces.

title: Pop Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Pop

title: Wade and Li-Ning Make an Apparel Deal
description: Take that, Nike. Dwayne Wade of the Heat has signed a deal with the Chinese company Li-Ning to create an apparel and footwear line called drum roll please Wade.

title: Theater Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Theater

title: A Human Superstar Among the Superheroes
description: COMIC book fans cant get enough of Grant Morrison these days. Last month Mr. Morrison, the Scottish writer of series including All-Star Superman, Batman, Animal Man and New X-Men, was the star of his very own three-day convention, MorrisonCon, in Las Vegas. On Friday Mr. Morrison will star in Grant Morrison Spotlight at New York Comic Con, the sold-out four-day extravaganza that runs through Sunday at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center.

title: 'Cry for Peace: Voices From the Congo'
description: A scene from a production featuring refugees from the Democratic Republic of Congo, performed at Syracuse University in September.

title: Jazz Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Jazz

title: After Unlikely Comeback, Giants Advance to N.L.C.S.
description: CINCINNATI  Buster Poseys fifth-inning grand slam Thursday was the kind of moment that baseball history is made of. It was a majestic blast  434 feet off a pitch from Cincinnati Reds starter Mat Latos that sailed over an auxiliary scoreboard and gave the Giants a commanding 6-0 lead in the fifth, and deciding, game of their division series with the Reds.

title: Classical Music and Opera Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Classical

title: Game 4 Highlights and Analysis: Orioles 2, Yankees 1, 13 Innings
A Fugitives Identity Theft Has a Highly Personal Twist
description: The adage Its never too late to be who you might have been, ascribed to George Eliot, is given a cruel twist in the terrific French thriller The Big Picture.

title: Where to Watch Borgen
description: Trying to find Borgen is a little like trying to do arithmetic with the Red Queen in Through the Looking Glass  it can seem foolhardy to even try.

title: She Seems to Have It All, a Whole Nation in Fact
description: Behind every great woman there is a manservant. Or there should be.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate Preview
description: Vice President Biden has a relatively simple task  to describe, anyway  at tonights Vice Presidential debate. He needs to respond to all the lies and half-truths that Mitt Romney tossed at President Obama at last weeks debate, to which Mr. Obama did not respond. And he needs to remind voters that despite Mr. Romneys recent attempts to seem moderate, the Romney/Ryan ticket is severely conservative.

title: Hotel Rooms With Charm, Off the Radar
description: Aix-en-Provence, FranceLa Maison dAix

title: The Right Way for Turkey to Intervene in Syria
description: Washington

title: Spare Times for Children for Oct. 12-18
description: FANCY NANCY

title: Their Cheating Art: Reality and Illusion
description: Perhaps you have seen the famous photograph of a dirigible touching its nose to the tip of the Empire State Building. I had always thought there was some factual basis for this improbable image, and indeed there was. The buildings developers had announced plans to create an aerial mooring post where travelers from Europe could debark. The idea turned out to be unfeasible because of dangerous winds, but the photographic vision of its realization  a montage created by an unknown artist in 1930  went out over the news wires and continues to circulate over the Internet today, causing many like me to wonder, did this really happen?

title: Dance Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Dance

title: Martin McDonagh on Seven Psychopaths
description: Martin McDonagh, the writer and director of Seven Psychopaths, discusses his film.

title: V.A. Loans Surge in Fiscal Year
description: MORTGAGES guaranteed by the Department of Veterans Affairs surged by 50 percent in the fiscal year ended Sept. 30, as tighter credit standards on conventional financing made these programs all the more attractive to current and former military members.

title: The Message Over the Medium
description: WASHINGTON  Ai Weiwei, the lionhearted Chinese artist, architect and activist who is having his first American museum survey here at the Hirshhorn, might be the worlds most famous living artist. But going by the Hirshhorn show, Ai Weiwei: According to What?, it would be inaccurate to say that Mr. Ais fame rests primarily on his visual achievement, even factoring in his role in helping the Swiss architects Herzog & de Meuron design the Beijing Olympic stadium popularly known as the Birds Nest.

title: The Pen, Mightier Than the Brush
description: If Drer to de Kooning: 100 Master Drawings From Munich were an exhibition of paintings, not drawings, the Morgan Library & Museum would have to be thinking about crowd control. A show of little-seen pictures by Michelangelo, Rembrandt, Rubens and Pontormo, with Picasso and Sigmar Polke tossed in? Issue timed tickets. Extend your hours.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Oct. 12-18
description: Art

title: Live World Cup Qualifying on ESPN
description: Friday nights United States World Cup qualifying match at Antigua and Barbuda (7 p.m. ET) may be out of sight for most fans because it is an away game that is only being carried live by Al Jazeeras beIN Sport network, but that has not stopped ESPN from using its resources to provide access to 43 matches (all but one a World Cup qualifier).

title: The Sad Sack of Postpunk, Snarling Through the Blues
description: Its a rock-star ritual: Work up concert momentum and call out How are you feeling? to get a happy roar. Thats not how Morrissey did it on Wednesday night at a sold-out Radio City Music Hall. Instead, he asked glumly, Are you feeling anything?

title: Spare Times for Oct. 12-18
description: Around Town

title: His Ink Has Dried Up, but Look at All the Blood
description: In his sporadically funny, blood-splattered comedy Seven Psychopaths, the playwright turned movie director Martin McDonagh looks to turn writers block into grim comedy. Colin Farrell, whos even better looking than the pretty Mr. McDonagh, author of plays like The Pillowman and director of the film In Bruges, plays Marty Faranan, a struggling Irish writer who lives in Los Angeles, where he fights with his girlfriend, Kaya (Abbie Cornish); hangs with his best bud, Billy (Sam Rockwell); and chugs the hard stuff until he blacks out. The words drip from Martys pen slowly, but he has faith or at least a promising title for his next project: Seven Psychopaths. All he needs to do is write the thing.

title: Ryan Pumps Iron in Time Magazine Photos
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan is pumped. Seriously. Hes like Arnold Schwarzenegger-pumped.

title: Solid South Reversed, but Still Divided by Race
description: We continue our Presidential Geography series, an examination of each states political landscape and how its changing. Here is a special two-in-one look at Alabama, the Yellowhammer State, and Mississippi, the Magnolia State. FiveThirtyEight spoke with Marvin King Jr., an assistant professor of political science at the University of Mississippi; Natalie Davis, a professor of political science at Birmingham-Southern College; Jess Brown, a professor of political science and justice studies at Athens State University; and William H. Stewart, a former political science professor at the University of Alabama.

title: Shifting Moods on a Vigorous Trip Embracing Nielsen and Tchaikovsky
description: Alan Gilbert, the music director of the New York Philharmonic, has become best known for eclectic programs that may range over centuries and styles but that feature connecting threads, be they rhythm, harmonic exploration, theme.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate Fact-Checks and Updates
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan square off on Thursday night in Danville, Ky., in the only vice-presidential debate. Live coverage begins at 8 p.m. eastern. The Times will be providing updates and analysis on our live dashboard. You can also follow along on Twitter @thecaucus, or follow our list of Times journalists covering the debate.

title: Small Pleasures, Scattered Amid Struggles
description: The writer and director Ava DuVernay is after something exquisitely simple in Middle of Nowhere: she wants you to look, really look, at her characters. Mostly, Ms. DuVernay, who won the directing award at the 2012 Sundance Film Festival, wants you to look at Ruby, a lonely young nurse (Emayatzy Corinealdi), whose husband, Derek (Omari Hardwick), is serving time. At once tethered to the world and seemingly detached from its thrum, Ruby dedicates herself to Derek, whom she regularly visits by riding a bus to the prison with all the other dutifully waiting women.

title: Democratic Group Brings Comedy to Fact-Checking
description: Fact-checkers will be out in force on Thursday night, offering plenty of serious assessments of the claims made by Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan.

title: The Caucus Click: Split Crowd
Get Batali on the Phone
description: The magazines Food & Drink issue is now online, featuring stories by Mark Bittman, Michael Pollan, Sam Anderson and more.

title: Rey Akdogans Night Curtain at Miguel Abreu
description: ROBERT ADAMS

title: Neighborhood Joint: Yummy Mummy
description: A sign out front at Yummy Mummy, a boutique on the Upper East Side, reads Happy breastfeeding.

title: Workday Prices I.P.O. at $28
description: The initial public offering of Workday, a provider of cloud-based applications for human resources, was priced at $28 a share on Thursday evening  well above its expected range.

title: In Fight for a Mexican Company, a Peek Into a Tycoons World
description: High above Columbus Circle, atop the Time Warner Center, is one of the most expensive apartments in Manhattan, a sleek aerie of steel and stone, high windows and soaring views.

title: Pampering for Mothers Who Nurse
description: UNDERNEATH Yummy Mummys cheerful purple awning on Lexington Avenue between 81st and 82nd Streets, a mannequin wearing a Boob brand striped nursing top has one breast peeking out. The cheeky tableau announces the shops mission as clearly as the slogan stenciled on the door: Happy breastfeeding.

title: Congos Pain, Told by Those Who Lived It
description: THE thought of Kambale Syaghuswa performing on a Manhattan stage is all but unimaginable. Just a few years ago he fled the Democratic Republic of Congo, having escaped a training camp for child soldiers on farmland that had once belonged to his father. And just one month ago he was a truck driver in Syracuse, N.Y., where he was part of that citys robust Congolese population.

title: This Weeks Movies | October 12, 2012
description: The New York Times critics on Argo, Seven Psychopaths and Middle of Nowhere.

title: Blood and Cocktails
description: Photos and recipes for cocktails inspired by Blood Play.

title: High Jinks Draw Neighbors Away From Their 1950s Suburban Worldview
description: The first few moments of action in the Debate Societys Blood Play, are drawn in broad, manic strokes. A basement pipe has burst, spraying water everywhere, including on Bev, a screaming housewife, who yells upstairs for her husband, Morty, who yells right back: Wha wha wha what?!

title: Less Commuting, More Halloween Candy
description: LAST year Tim Graham bought a business. In the process, he and his wife, Duval Hopkins Graham, acquired a car, a garage space and an E-ZPass.

title: Reconceiving Partnering With a Dose Of Politics
description: The German choreographer Raimund Hoghe is a lover of romance and beautiful things. Soaring arias and tender love songs; low, warm lights; ritualistic tasks completed with great care; supple and sensual young dancers  all of these elements tend to come into play in his languid, lengthy productions.

title: Saying Its Miraculous for Me, Levine Will Conduct Again at Met
description: James Levine is making a comeback.

title: Chinese Parents Sue Consultant After Sons Are Rejected by Harvard
description: This week on The Choice on India Ink, we present news that might serve as a cautionary tale for international students who hire educational consultants.

title: Werths Homer Keeps Nationals Alive
description: WASHINGTON  The atmosphere inside Nationals Park on Thursday never seemed like it would match the relentless vivacity of the previous day, when this city hosted its first postseason baseball game since 1933. The crowd of 44,392 stood constantly and cheered in full voice, but also seemed muted at times by anxiety, particularly as the game wore on and the specter of elimination grew.

title: The Images That Bind a Director and His Son
description: How accurate is your memory as you get on in years? How much do old home movies and vintage photographs reveal about the past? Or does the process that the filmmaker Ross McElwee calls decontextualization, in which the picture remains while the circumstances surrounding it are forgotten, erase its significance? What, if anything, do these reflections have to do with digital versus film photography?

title: At the Scene of the Crime
description: Something wicked comes creaking along the floorboards in Sinister before racing prematurely out the door. Ethan Hawke plays a true-crime author who, when this creepy horror flick opens, is moving his family into a house where another family was slaughtered. Hes investigating the murders for his next book and tells his wife its the only house they can afford. The tree from which members of the other family were hanged  a scene that the director Scott Derrickson, who shows it several times, is clearly proud of  looms in a picture window like an omen.

title: A Drug to Quicken the Blood
description: Santa Barbara, Calif.

title: Egypts Chief Prosecutor Resists Presidents Effort to Oust Him
description: CAIRO  President Mohamed Morsi and Egypts chief prosecutor clashed Thursday as the prosecutor refused the presidents attempt to remove him.

title: Republicans Like Golf, Democrats Prefer Cartoons, TV Research Suggests
description: It sounds like a clich, but if the results of a TiVo-based research study are to be believed, registered Republicans are very interested in golf.

title: A Kiddie Kegger?
description: My husband grabbed our sons lunchbox and filled it with beer as we were leaving for an 11 a.m. birthday party for a 1-year-old (whose family we dont know very well). I told him it was inappropriate to take alcohol to a childrens party. He said he had had a rough week and would take them out only if another father he knew wanted one, too. I said if the hosts wanted alcohol at their party, they would serve it. Then he called me judgmental and boring, and refused to go. Wasnt I right? D. L., New York

title: Gay Rights May Get Its Brown v. Board of Education
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: New Zoning for Midtown
description: To the Editor:

title: Drugs to Improve Learning
description: To the Editor:

title: Lena Dunhams Book Deal
description: To the Editor:

title: When Children Reject a Healthy Lunch
description: To the Editor:

title: Laws to Fight Warming
description: To the Editor:

title: Suit Over Flood Damage
description: To the Editor:

title: A Relationships Glue Is Made of Alcohol
description: Dramas about alcoholism and recovery have little room to maneuver between two basic stories: one of resilience and regeneration, the other ending in self-destruction. How good they are depends on the degree of truthfulness they convey about a subject that was once shrouded in secrecy and shame but is now a reality-television staple. Alcohol addiction may not seem to be the big deal that it once was, except that it often remains a matter of life and death.

title: In Miami, Wondering About a Bubble
description: A DOZEN years ago, I lived through the hype machine of the energy trading industry in Houston.

title: A Global 1937
description: Back in 2009, when there was (briefly) a policy consensus in favor of active fiscal policy to fight the slump, there were many warnings to the effect that we must not repeat the infamous mistake of 1937, in which FDR was persuaded to focus on balancing the budget while the economy was still weak, terminating the recovery from 1933 and sending America into the second leg of the Great Depression.

title: Romney Offers Sharp Criticism of Obamas Handling of Libya Terrorist Attacks
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  Mitt Romney delivered his most pointed criticism to date of President Obamas handling of the lethal attack in Benghazi, Libya, on Thursday, a possible foreshadowing of how Representative Paul D. Ryan will address the issue in the vice-presidential debate.

title: Cutoff of U.S. Money Leads Unesco to Slash Programs and Seek Emergency Aid
description: PARIS  A year after the United States cut off its financing to Unesco, following a vote to make Palestine a full member, the organization remains engaged in a frantic effort to cut back programs, reduce costs and raise emergency money.

title: Biden and Ryan Debate in Kentucky
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan quarreled aggressively over the administrations handling of foreign affairs and the nations economic recovery.

title: A Legal Brawl in Mexico as Bond Buyers Look On
description: Trouble is brewing in the industrial heartland of Mexico, but its not the violent drug wars that have plagued the boomtown of Monterrey. It is a legal brawl over the bankruptcy of the countrys largest glassmaker, Vitro.

title: At New York Comic Con, Outfitting Female Fans
description: All Ashley Eckstein wanted was a Star Wars T-shirt. It was 2009, and Mrs. Eckstein, a TV actor, was making a promotional appearance at Comic-Con International in San Diego, but she had trouble finding any apparel for women.

title: Why Iran Cant Follow Chinas Lead
description: Washington

title: Tribes Add Potent Voice Against Plan for Northwest Coal Terminals
description: FERNDALE, Wash.  At age 94, Mary Helen Cagey, an elder of the Lummi Indian tribe, has seen a lot of yesterdays. Some are ripe for fond reminiscence, like the herring that used to run rich in the waters here in the nations upper-left margin, near the border with Canada. Others are best left in the past, she said, like coal.

title: Belfast Clinic for Abortions Due to Open
description: DUBLIN  A British nonprofit organization said Thursday that it would open an abortion clinic next week in Belfast, the first ever on the island of Ireland, raising a furious reaction from anti-abortion campaigners who promised to pressure local politicians to refuse to grant an operating license.

title: First the Proposal, Then Remodeling
description: EVERYTHING was going so well until he proposed.

title: Dale Earnhardt Jr. Is Sidelined by Concussions
description: CONCORD, N.C.  Two concussions in a six-week span have forced Dale Earnhardt Jr. out of the No. 88 Chevrolet for at least two weeks in the middle of the Sprint Cup playoff race and raised questions about head injuries in the sport.

title: The Wests Stalwart Ally in the War on Drugs: Iran (Yes, That Iran)
description: HIRMAN, Iran  Sitting next to the half-open door of a Russian-made Mi-17 transport helicopter, the general who leads the Islamic Republics antinarcotics department pointed toward the rugged landscape of Irans volatile southeast, where its border meets those of Afghanistan and Pakistan.

title: Debating Points, Vice Presidential Edition
description: The editors of Campaign Stops asked columnists and contributors to weigh in with their thoughts on the vice presidential debate.  1:17 a.m. | Updated

title: Open Space and Fewer Rides in Westchester Parks Reinvention Plan
description: Rye Playland, the 1920s-era amusement park owned by Westchester County, would get a complete makeover under a proposed development that emphasizes year-round activities and more green space, county officials announced Thursday.

title: No Campaigning for Oscar Votes, but Please Add Recommendation Here
description: LOS ANGELESThe Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences normally takes extraordinary pains to limit the process of campaigning for Oscar votes from its members. Mailings that extol the merits of a film, an achievement or an individual are not permitted, say the official Academy campaign rules. E-mails sent to Academy members by those associated with a film are similarly supposed to avoid direct promotion, beyond those polite words, for your consideration. Negative remarks about a competing film are strictly prohibited, as is telephone contact with members by campaigners, other than to verify an address.

title: No, He Really Doesnt Want to Be on YouTube
Old Battle Ax Gets a Face-Lift
description: THE Seventh Regiment Armory, completed in 1880 at Park Avenue and 66th Street, is one of the oldest buildings on the Upper East Side. The huge full-block fortress, now often called the Park Avenue Armory, was recently released from construction netting after a yearlong exterior repair, and although forbidding and martial in character, it is the only original fragment left of the giant campus of charities and public benefit organizations that carpeted post-Civil War Lenox Hill.

title: What the Presidential Candidates Say About Tech
description: New York Tech MeetUp, a nonprofit group that represents computer coders and other technology industry people in New York, asked the Democratic and Republican presidential candidates to pitch how their policies would benefit the growth of New York start-up community and other start-up entrepreneurs.

title: Hezbollah Says It Flew Iranian-Designed Drone Into Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of the Lebanese militant group and political party Hezbollah, declared Thursday that his fighters had assembled and piloted a drone that flew 35 miles into Israel on Saturday, calling the flight an unprecedented achievement in the history of the resistance.

title: Two Families Become One in World War II
description: With its exhilarating World War II narrative and performances that touch notes intimate and grand, Simon and the Oaks has an exquisite, and epic, ache. Simons parents are working-class Swedes, but he develops a surrogate family in his schoolmate Isak and Isaks father  wealthy, German and Jewish. To help their troubled children, these contrasting sets of parents blend into an affecting unit that expands over the years, eventually forming a business together and spanning generations.

title: Slim Jim Gives Snackers Something to Play For
description: In the world of snacking, something goes terribly wrong for some dried meat brands when a young man enters his mid-20s. He stops buying as much jerky.

title: A Veteran and a Neighbor Boy, Both Troubled
description: Tragedy and redemption arrive hand-in-hand in Least Among Saints, a dawdling coming-home drama about two damaged souls and one very unlucky dog.

title: Oakland Sues U.S. to Prevent Closing of Marijuana Dispensary
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The City of Oakland has filed a lawsuit in federal court to prevent the Department of Justice from seizing property leased to the largest medical marijuana dispensary in the country.

title: In China, a Writer Finds a Deep Well
Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Touching Lord Stanleys Mug
description: LOS ANGELES  The Stanley Cup found itself Thursday in an upscale outdoor shopping complex reminiscent of Disneylands Main Street, U.S.A.  complete with trolley  only with an eclectic blend of Art Deco, modernist and 19th-century architecture.

title: Making a Baby in a Shockingly Usual  Way
Marine Mammals and the Navys 5-Year Plan
description: Between 2014 and 2019, the United States Navy hopes to conduct testing and training exercises in the Atlantic and the Pacific that will involve sonars and explosives of many different kinds.

title: Safeguards Against Speculative Banking
description: Bank bailouts were supposed to be followed by financial reform to limit the banks destructive power. Instead, bailed-out banks are bigger than ever and have resisted reforms to limit their size and complexity. The lack of progress, however, may yet give way to change.

title: A Newsmans Muse
description: THE dignified prewar duplex at 730 Park Avenue that belonged to Mike Wallace, the trailblazing broadcast journalist whose esteemed and intermittently turbulent career at 60 Minutes spanned four decades, and his fourth wife, Mary Yates, has been put on the market by their heirs at an asking price of $20 million. Mr. Wallace died in April at 93; Ms. Yates continued to live in the apartment, decorated with exotic artifacts and textiles from their travels, until her death at 83 in September.

title: A U.S. Basketball Player in the Axis of Evil
description: As indicated by its title, The Iran Job is about a workplace: the Iranian Super League, which beckons Kevin Sheppard to play professional basketball in 2008, when hes greeted by ubiquitous Down With U.S.A. graffiti. Still, this observant documentary avoids pedagogy; its not always artful, but it has a relaxed, light touch that never topples into pretension.

title: Lawmen Against the Law
description: SEATTLE  Last November, the former chief federal prosecutor from Washington State took the stage before a hall full of cops and tried to persuade the people who enforce the drug laws to change them  specifically, to get aboard what will most likely turn out to the nations first successful campaign to legalize marijuana.

title: MarShon Brooks Could Miss Much of Nets Preseason
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  MarShon Brooks, the Nets promising young sixth man, could miss most of the preseason schedule because of tendinitis in his right foot.

title: Grieving, Girardi Vows to Finish Job
description: Joe Girardi got the phone call Saturday as the Yankees were riding down the Henry Hudson Parkway on their way to a train station and another postseason opener.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Back on Broad Street
description: PHILADELPHIA  At 7:02 p.m., or just about the time the Philadelphia Flyers and Boston Bruins would have opened the N.H.L. season across the parking lot at Wells Fargo Center, a video began playing on the 32-foot screen at Xfinity Live, a gleaming South Philadelphia sports bar that stands on the site of the old Spectrum.

title: Ex-Aide to Governor Walker Pleads Guilty in Wisconsin
description: A former top aide to Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin pleaded guilty to one count of felony misconduct in public office in a deal with prosecutors Thursday, a week after Mr. Walker was subpoenaed to testify at the trial.

title: Leaders Expound on Political Oppression
description: A Whisper to a Roar is a vivid documentary with unusual access to the key players in the geopolitical dramas it recounts. When we hear its stories of political oppression in Zimbabwe, Ukraine and Malaysia, they come straight from the mouths of President Morgan Tsvangirai, the dioxin-poisoned ex-president Viktor A. Yushchenko, and the former Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad and his defiant deputy, Anwar Ibrahim. These and other trenchant, polished interviews lend a firsthand immediacy to a whirlwind tour of supposed democracies and bold resistance.

title:
Panetta Warns of
Dire Threat of
Cyberattack on U.S.
description: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta warned Thursday that the United States was facing the possibility of a cyber-Pearl Harbor and was increasingly vulnerable to foreign computer hackers who could dismantle the nations power grid, transportation system, financial networks and government.

title: Triumph of the Wrong?
description: In these closing weeks of the campaign, each side wants you to believe that it has the right ideas to fix a still-ailing economy. So heres what you need to know: If you look at the track record, the Obama administration has been wrong about some things, mainly because it was too optimistic about the prospects for a quick recovery. But Republicans have been wrong about everything.

title: Sutured Slasher Is On the Loose
description: Perhaps because almost everyone in Michael Gallaghers Smiley, men included, appears to be wearing the same shade of fuchsia lipstick, this remainder-bin horror movie is impossible to take seriously. Forget the atrocious acting, simple-minded script and horrendously flat photography: when your budget cant stretch to more than one lip stain, its time to call Cut.

title: For an Armstrong Insider, a Passion for Cycling Gave Way to Corruption
description: How could a young Christian Vande Velde know what illicit, deceitful things were in store for him in the sport of cycling when he first fell in love with it?

title: In Rehab, Surrounded by Older Men
description: Ric Klass cannot be excused for making Excuse Me for Living, a lumbering mess in which he has somehow trapped several recognizable actors.

title: An Inspector General for the Police
description: Mayor Michael Bloomberg of New York is firmly opposed to a bill pending in the City Council that would make the nations largest police department subject to oversight by an inspector general with broad powers to review departmental policies  including controversial policies that involve stop-and-frisk tactics. Inspectors general are a common feature in other city divisions, in federal agencies like the F.B.I. and C.I.A., and in police departments in Los Angeles and elsewhere. But the mayor says there is no need for such an office in New York because crime is at an all-time low and the department is working well under its current leadership.

title: Biden Speaks About Attack in Benghazi
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. opened the debate addressing the administration's reaction to the killing of the ambassador J. Christopher  Stevens.

title: Electric Motorcycles in Search of a Market
description: JUST when weve accepted that we wont be blasting to Starbucks on jetpacks any time soon, another icon of techno-fantasy has raised its emission-free, pennies-per-mile head: electric motorcycles.

title: The Bad Boys of the Road Warm Their Engines
description: IN a limping postrecession economy, one can imagine a spouses response when a car lover pulls a hot new two-seater into the driveway: Are you crazy? Take that thing back.

title: For Lightweight Cars, a Materials Race
description: THANKS to tough new federal fuel-efficiency rules, automakers must meet a fleet average of 54.5 miles per gallon by 2025. More efficient engines and electric powertrains cant carry the whole load, so carmakers and the federal government are pouring resources into lightweighting auto platforms to meet the Corporate Average Fuel Economy, or CAFE, standards.

title: The New Classics
description: Auto writers imagine which of todays vehicles will take pride of place at collectors car shows down the road.

title: Living With an Electric Car
description: ALTHOUGH sales of electric cars have remained slow since they came to the American mass market in late 2010, early buyers tend to be true believers and quite likely to give their new vehicles the benefit of the doubt. For many, the honeymoon period is still on, even if for some the romance is definitely over  or transferred to another electric car.

title: Ryan Questions Obama Foreign Policy
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan's first statement in the vice-presidential debate challenged the Obama administration's handling of the terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya.

title: If Only It Were All About the Buttons
description: Christophe Barratiers War of the Buttons retells a story well known in France. (Its based on a 1912 novel by Louis Pergaud, and Yves Roberts 1962 film adaptation.) Boys from neighboring towns fight a turf war, and to the victors go the spoils: buttons and shoelaces. The vanquished slink off, holding up their pants. More or less childs play at first, the war becomes darker and more violent, even as it sags under the weight of Mr. Barratiers broader purpose.

title: Handsets vs. Dashboards
description: AMERICAS love affair with the automobile has nearly been matched by its newfound passion for smartphones. So what could be better than joining the two in connubial bliss? Automakers this fall are introducing connected in-car systems that bring apps to the dashboard, but the features vary widely depending on how the connection is made between the car, the phone and the driver.

title: New Apps for Old Cars
description: JUST because your car was made in the pre-iPhone era, doesnt mean you cant teach it some new digital tricks. A stereo system upgrade can add not only built-in navigation, but also support for smartphone apps.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: The Waiting Game
description: What N.H.L. hockey has come down to these days is reporters and cameramen standing in a semicircle outside a doorway in a small covered plaza in Midtown Manhattan  the back entrance of the office building where the league is headquartered. Thats what it was like again on Thursday.

title: GPS Apps That Fight Obsolescence
description: AVOIDING in-dash navigation options that can cost $800 to $1,500, smartphone owners are increasingly opting for $50 apps and free maps on their handsets to help them get around.

title: White House Appoints Veteran Retired Diplomat to Serve as Senior Envoy in Libya
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Thursday that it had recalled a veteran diplomat, Laurence Pope, who retired from the Foreign Service 12 years ago, to serve as the senior American envoy in Libya.

title: Biden Calls Ryan's Answer 'Malarkey'
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. called Representative Paul D. Ryan's assertion that if the United States looked weak it would embolden adversaries to test America, "a bunch of malarkey."

title: After a Lifetime of Waiting, the Big Hit
description: WASHINGTON

title: Tracing the Peaks and Valleys of Partisanship
description: The documentary Split: A Deeper Divide is not a pretty film. Thats partly because it outlines the entrenched popular and political partisanship that threatens to render the democratic process a ceremonial ritual rather than a form of self-government. Its also an unlovely movie that resembles an overstuffed dossier held together with tape, crammed as it is with more than 15 talking heads, cartoonish history lessons, clips of protesters screaming and a needless narrator.

title: The Classics-to-Be for Tomorrows Car Collectors
description: ITS hard to know which creative works will endure. Which current pop songs will be played at nostalgia-themed parties 20 years from now. Which movie quotations will join the ranks of Luke, I am your father or Were gonna need a bigger boat. And which cream puffs will be proudly displayed at classic-car shows a generation from now.

title: New Orleans Limits Hurricane-Themed Excursions
description: The lumbering buses that carry camera-wielding tourists through New Orleans still stop at Bourbon Streets bars, Jackson Squares cathedral and the Garden Districts mansions.

title: A Veteran Returns to the Mound: The Bullpen Car
description: BULLPEN cars last roamed ballparks nearly 20 years ago, whisking relief pitchers to the mound during games. Christopher Hill never forgot them.

title: Espada to Plead Guilty to Remaining Charges After Being Convicted of Theft
description: Pedro Espada Jr., a former legislator who rose to the heights of New York State government before later being convicted of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars from a nonprofit health care network, is expected to plead guilty on Friday to the remaining charges against him, signaling an end to a case that has stretched on for years.

title: Biden Says 'Facts Matter' About Iran
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. stressed that "facts matter" when dealing with Iran's pursuit of a nuclear weapon.

title: The Perfect Political Movie
description: Did I dream this, or what?

title: The Trials and Tribulations of a Failed Charity
description: An examination of Yle, the charity created by the hip-hop artist Wyclef Jean, indicates that millions in donations for earthquake victims went to the organization, not the country.

title: In Haiti, Little Can Be Found of a Hip-Hop Artists Charity
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  In a new memoir, Wyclef Jean, the Haitian-born hip-hop celebrity, claims he endured a crucifixion after the Jan. 12, 2010, earthquake when he faced questions about his charitys financial record and ability to handle what eventually amounted to $16 million in donations.

title: This Heros Plight: Speak Well and Carry a Big Nose
description: Five or 10 minutes into the new revival of Cyrano de Bergerac, at the American Airlines Theater, something like a hurricane whooshes through the house. Its the kind of wind that makes jaded theatergoers widen their eyes and hold tight to their seats as it sweeps away cobwebs, preconceptions and dank mustiness.

title: Whats a Gang to Do? Join the Other Crooks to Snare a Jewel
description: Its not surprising that the highest-domestic-grossing film in South Korea in recent years is The Thieves, Dong-hoon Chois sprawling, relentlessly entertaining thriller. Its labyrinthine plot  rival gangs of high-tech criminals collaborate on a jewel heist taking them to Hong Kong; Busan, South Korea; and Macau, China  is loaded with all the twists, disguises, glamorous settings and split-screen montages you could ask for.

title: When a Crisis Comes With a Reset Button
description: ONCE again, the global auto industry is discovering that America is still the best place in the world to make money selling cars.

title: Leader of the Pack
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Welcome to Friday, the first day of the week where constructors get to really push cruciverbal boundaries. Sometimes its in the wordplay and the cluing, sometimes its a funky new grid design. Sometimes, constructors like to see how many sparkling 15-letter words or phrases they can stack on top of each other without the fill degenerating into nonsense.

title: Corrections: October 12, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Councilman Proposes a Bill to Let Motorcyclists Park Free
description: Nicknames are something of a prerequisite in the New York City motorcycling community.

title: Beano Cook, Irreverent College Football Analyst, Is Dead at 81
description: Beano Cook, whose authoritative growl and curmudgeonly but witty observations as an analyst for ESPN and other networks earned him the nickname the Pope of College Football, was found dead on Thursday morning in a Pittsburgh nursing home. He was 81.

title: A Tough Team Out to Save a Journalist in Peril
description: Anybody who believes the French are over-intellectual, under-macho gastronomes unwilling to, oh, say, lend air space to American fighter jets will think otherwise after seeing Special Forces, a Gallic actioner as jingoistic as anything out of Hollywood. Call it Saving Journalist Elsa: when Elsa (Diane Kruger), a reporter in Afghanistan, interviews a woman describing abuses inflicted by the Taliban, she and her sympathetic Muslim guide, Amin (Mehdi Nebbou), are captured and spirited to Pakistan.

title: U.S. Panel to Hear Opponents of Indian Point Nuclear Plant
description: The Indian Point nuclear plant is going on trial.

title: Ryan and the Words out of Biden's Mouth
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan teased Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. for sometimes getting in trouble with off-the-cuff remarks.

title: Romneys Pledge Puts Focus on Public TV
description: It has been a strange week for public television executives. Meetings have been postponed. Trips have been canceled. And conversations have turned in urgency to, of all things, Big Bird.

title: Fighting, Literally, to Save a School Program
description: If you can choke down the implausible notion that the doughy Kevin James would last more than five seconds in a mixed martial arts ring, Here Comes the Boom is a moderately enjoyable, nontaxing sort of comedy.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Its Something to Watch on a Thursday Night
description: CORNWALL, Ontario  With an extra large Tim Hortons coffee in one hand and a pregame cigarette in the other, Tommy Sosnowsky said that he normally wouldnt have been outside the Ed Lumley Arena in the cold and drizzle of Thursday night.

title: With No Animal Shelter Nearby, Bronx Rescuers Are Left to Their Own Devices
description: Behind a Bronx apartment building, two elusive trespassers were about to be taken down in a stakeout. The bait: a stinky pile of tuna fish.

title: Bay Area Baseball Fever Grips Els, an Instant As Fan
description: SAN MARTIN, Calif.  On the second nine of his round Thursday at the Frys.com Open, Ernie Els heard gasps and claps and throaty cheers from fans in the skyboxes and corporate tents at CordeValle Golf Club. He was puzzled because the only reaction he expected his play to elicit was a yawn.

title: With Tea Party Support, an East Texas Republican Takes on House Speaker
description: MINEOLA  It was not a Sunday, and he was not standing at a pulpit, but Bryan Hughes was preaching.

title: Biden Describes Medicare Under Obama
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. outlined the Obama administration's handling of Medicare against the proposed policies of the Romney-Ryan ticket.

title: New York State Tightens Drug Rules for Racehorses
description: The New York State Racing and Wagering Board enacted a series of new rules on Thursday that significantly restrict the use of legal drugs on horses and require trainers to disclose what treatments their horses have received.

title: A Man, Nature and Not Much Else
description: Two Years at Sea, an enveloping portrait of a Scottish Highlands hermit from the experimental filmmaker Ben Rivers, is shot on 16-millimeter black-and-white film that feels at once tactile and evanescent. Similarly, the daily life we see of Jake Williams (the hermit who actually does live alone in a forest) is mundane and mysterious. The bearded Mr. Williams putters among junk, LPs and scarified snapshots (shown in montage), through varying shades of light and darkness, in a car, a raft and a camper. But his motives and means remain as cloudy as the overcast sky.

title: Lottery Numbers
Readying a Rail Bridge Over the Rio Grande
description: Residents along the Texas-Mexico border last witnessed a ribbon-cutting for a railway bridge well before World War I, and before Mexico had fought its own revolution.

title: Suit Is Filed Over Move to Regulate Circumcision
description: Several Jewish groups filed a lawsuit on Thursday seeking to prevent New York City from enforcing a rule on circumcisions, arguing that the regulation would violate religious freedoms.

title: Torah Fraud Earns Rabbi Prison Term
description: Rabbi Menachem Youlus, who was called a Jewish Indiana Jones and provided Torahs through a charity while fraudulently claiming they had been rescued after being hidden or lost during the Holocaust, was sentenced to just over four years in prison on Thursday by a judge who called his scheme sad and incomprehensible.

title: Ryan Questions Timetable on Afghanistan
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan challenged the Obama administration's plan to withdraw American forces from Afghanistan on a timetable.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: The Other Blackhawks
description: WINNETKA, Ill.  The Blackhawks took to the ice in Chicago on Thursday night, but some of them had to be coaxed into playing. Patrick Kanes mother had to coerce him onto the ice with the promise that he could watch a movie after practice. Marian Hossa threw a fit when his mom tried to physically push him onto the ice.

title: A Heartland Conservative? Not Really
description: In the months leading up to this years Iowa caucuses, Janeane Wilson, a 47-year-old home-health-care aide struggling to make ends meet, made the Republican rounds. She attended rallies for every presidential candidate and spoke with most, even sat down with Michele Bachmann; she was interviewed by reporters and briefly featured on ABC News.

title: Ryan and Biden Spar Over Medicare
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. challenged Representative Paul D. Ryan on how the Romney-Ryan ticket would deal with Medicare.

title: 2013 Race? Mayor Says Dont Ask About It
description: Count at least one New Yorker who does not want to talk about the 2013 mayors race  Michael R. Bloomberg.

title: Biden and Ryan Quarrel Aggressively in Debate, Offering Contrasts
description: DANVILLE, Ky.  It was the debate that President Obama and Mitt Romney did not have a week ago.

title: A Smug Writer Meets His Match
description: Miguel, the arrogant newspaper columnist at the center of Madrid, 1987, has spent decades building up a tough outer shell. Pompous, calloused, dismissive, hes a parade float begging for a hole to be poked in it. That comes in the form of a would-be acolyte, Angela, and a malfunctioning door lock in this sweet, sometimes dull and certainly overlong film, written and directed by David Trueba.

title: Italy: Head of Legionaries on Leave
description: The Rev. Alvaro Corcuera, superior general of the Legionaries of Christ, a worldwide religious order besieged by a sex scandal, stepped aside on Thursday, citing poor health. The orders vicar general will take over until a new superior is elected, Father Corcuera, 55, wrote in a letter to his colleagues. The order has been under close scrutiny from the Vatican since 2010, after revelations that its founder, the Rev. Marcial Maciel Degollado had molested his seminarians and fathered at least one child.

title: Ryan Outlines U.S. Foreign Intervention
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan said his criteria for American intervention overseas would be what is in the national interest of the American people.

title: 1950s Los Angeles, Hazy and Mysterious
description: Hotel Noir, a black-and-white homage to the genre that made the 1950s so bleakly lurid, certainly tries to get the details right: cigarettes, fedoras, nylons, tough guys and the wisecracking molls who crave them.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.: Hockey Sticks Aweigh
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.  McMullen Hockey Arena looks no different from any rink. The parking lot is shared with an adjacent golf course and driving range, the floors are covered with rubber mats, and theres a cove of vending machines off the lobby.

title: Pakistan: Drone Strike Kills 18
description: An American drone fired missiles into a compound in the Orakzai tribal region on Thursday, killing 18 Afghans and wounding 4, a senior local official in the area said. Drone strikes are rare in Orakzai, which lies to the west of the regional capital, Peshawar. Most strikes in the C.I.A.-directed drone campaign occur along the border with Afghanistan, concentrated in North and South Waziristan.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate: Full Video
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. squared off against Representative Paul D. Ryan in the vice-presidential debate on Thursday in Danville, Ky.

title: The Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Follow along with this interactive replay of the vice-presidential debate, using fact checks and graphics to take a closer look at Mr. Biden and Mr. Ryans assertions and attacks.

title: No Fan of George W. Bush
description: In The Prosecution of an American President, the former Los Angeles deputy district attorney Vincent T. Bugliosi (famous for prosecuting Charles Manson) presents his case for trying George W. Bush for murder, given his pursuit of war against Iraq. He contends that the Bush White House sold a lie to the American public: that Saddam Hussein posed an imminent fatal threat. Killing is justified only when mortal peril to a person (or citizenry) looms, and in the matter of Iraq, Mr. Bugliosi argues, it didnt.

title: Biden and Ryan Discuss Views on Abortion
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan talked about their Catholic faith and their views on abortion.

title: Syrian Gets 12 Years in Terror Case
description: Jamal Yousef, a former member of the Syrian military who pleaded guilty in May to conspiring to provide material support to a Colombian terrorist organization, was sentenced to 12 years in prison on Thursday in Manhattan. Mr. Yousef, 54, became ensnared in an international sting operation run by the Drug Enforcement Administration; an indictment charged that he had agreed to provide weapons to the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia in exchange for hundreds of kilograms of cocaine.

title: Mexico: U.S. Affirms Drug Lord ID
description: Four days after he was gunned down by Mexican Marines, American law enforcement officials on Thursday acknowledged the death of Heriberto Lazcano Lazcano, one of the most wanted and ruthless drug lords in both countries. The Drug Enforcement Administration issued a statement congratulating Mexico on killing Mr. Lazcano, the leader of the Zetas.

title: Luck, a Step Ahead as a Rookie, Hits Stride With Colts
description: INDIANAPOLIS  It was just a few practices into Andrew Lucks professional career, during the Indianapolis Colts rookie minicamp in the spring, when Clyde Christensen turned on the tiny camera and microphone attached to Lucks helmet.

title: Oregon: Fluoride Foes File Petitions
description: Opponents of a plan to add fluoride to the water supply in Portland filed petitions that could put the issue to a vote. The plan was passed by the City Council last month, set to take effect in 2014, but foes said the idea was rushed and that concerns about fluoride in dental decay prevention are unresolved. A group collecting petitions, Clean Water Portland, said that more than 41,000 signatures were submitted, more than twice the number needed to put the matter on the ballot.

title: France: 2 Arrested Islamists Were Headed for Syria, Prosecutor Says
description: At least 2 of the 12 French Islamists arrested in raids on Saturday were planning to join jihadists fighting the government of President Bashar al-Assad in Syria and to recruit others to do so, a French prosecutor said Thursday. Five of the 12, all born in France and between the ages of 19 and 25, were released Thursday, but seven were kept in detention as the counterterrorist police continued to investigate a cell of Islamists that tried to blow up a kosher grocery store last month in Paris and had munitions, bomb-making equipment and a list of Jewish organizations in their possession. The prosecutor, Franois Molins, who called the group extremely dangerous, said two of them had visited Egypt and Tunisia recently, and said of the grocery bomb, The intent was to kill.

title: Opening Day Without the N.H.L.:  Dropping the Puck in Ann Arbor
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  The hockey fans started streaming into Yost Ice Arena on Thursday night as scheduled. By the start of the Michigan hockey teams season opener against Rochester Institute of Technology, the arena was more than half full.

title: Russia: Private Charged After Cigarette Detonates Explosives
description: The Main Military Investigative Department has filed charges against a private, Alexander Kasatkin, for violating a ban on smoking while handling explosives, officials said Thursday. A discarded cigarette butt apparently ignited a fire that caused 4,000 tons of ammunition to detonate Tuesday morning outside Orenburg, in southern Russia. Private Kasatkin, who survived, admitting to smoking while unloading ammunition from a train, Russian news media reported.

title: In Praise of Martha Raddatz
description: Let me say a few words about the really astonishing person who appeared at the vice presidential debate on Thursday  the moderator.

title: Mexico: Torture Reports Triple, Group Finds
