description: LONDON  In a victory for anti-extradition campaigners in Britain, the government ruled on Tuesday that a hacker wanted in the United States for accessing top-secret military computers will not be sent there to face trial.

title: View From San Diego After Epic Collapse
description: The Chargers led, 24-0, at halftime against the visiting Broncos on Monday night.

title: Theres a Music Marathon, Too
description: Most musicians laugh at the notion of a 6 a.m. gig in the cold air of a New York November. Frostbitten fingers and musical instruments dont go together all that well.

title: Too Many Yogurt Bowls
description: Dear Diary:

title: Britain Refuses to Extradite Computer Hacker Sought in U.S.
description: LONDON  British authorities on Tuesday blocked a longstanding demand for the extradition of Gary McKinnon, a computer hacker wanted in the United States to face charges of intruding into Pentagon computer networks in a case that has become a touchstone of the delicate jurisdictional balance between the two countries since the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.

title: Goldman Beats Expectations
description: GOLDMAN BEATS EXPECTATIONS | Goldman Sachs may be getting its groove back. The Wall Street firm said on Tuesday that it swung to a profit in the third quarter, reporting net earnings applicable to common shareholders of $1.46 billion, compared with a loss of $428 million in the quarter a year ago. The third-quarter profit amounted to $2.85 a share, beating the $2.12 a share analysts were expecting. Goldman also said it was increasing its dividend to 50 cents from 46 cents. (The conference call to discuss the results is at 9:30 a.m. Dial 1-888-281-7154 to listen in the United States.)

title: Paul Krugman and Frank Bruni, Live
description: In a Times Talks event today, Paul Krugman and fellow Op-Ed columnist Frank Bruni will talk about the state of the economy, prospects for the future and the presidential campaign. The sold-out show will be streamed live at nytimes.com/opinion at 6:30 p.m. ET.  The Editors

title: The Peel Sessions
description: What does the ideal complexion look like? You want your skin nice and smooth, almost powdery, said the medical aesthetician Dangene Enterprise, whose Institute of Skinovation is located at Manhattans Core Club. And it should have a nice glow, like youre a 3-year-old who just woke up from a nap.

title: Acid Test
description: Products and treatments designed to ease wrinkles and refresh skin  without the wax-paper effect.

title: So Far, Underdogs and Unpredictability Rule in N.F.L.
description: Chase Stuart writes about the historical and statistical side of football at his site, FootballPerspective.com

title: As the Yankees Go, So Goes the Nation
description: With the presidential candidates in the neighborhood for their second debate  Hofstra University on Long Island isnt far away  lets explore national politics and the Yankee Connection. This is relatively good news for President Obama and not-so-cheery tidings for Mitt Romney.

title: Breakfast Meeting: The Rules of Debate Engagement
description: The second presidential debate, which takes place Tuesday night, will have a more freewheeling town hall format that is intended to produce a more spontaneous interaction between the candidates and the audience. But as Jeremy W. Peters reports in The Times, little is actually left to chance. The process for selecting participants, and the rules and time limits they will participate under, are tightly managed in order to minimize surprises.

title: News Corporation Shareholders Meeting: Much Ado Might Not Add Up to Much
description: News Corporation will be holding its annual meeting Tuesday on the Fox studio lot in Los Angeles and there will be several efforts by large shareholders to diminish Murdoch family control, citing the hacking scandal in England.

title: Former Bosnian Leader Begins His Defense at Genocide Trial
description: PARIS  He was once known for his virulent speeches throughout Bosnia, but on Tuesday as Radovan Karadzic began his defense in a new phase of his genocide trial, he told international judges that he was a mild and tolerant man and that instead of standing accused, he should be rewarded for all the good things I have done.

title: Wine News Online: A Paying Proposition
description: PARISOnce in a while a story comes along that straddles my two areas of journalistic interest: wine and the media. So it is with the growth of paid-for digital publications that focus on very specific wine regions or niches.

title: Bank of America Merrill Lynch Hires Chairman for China Operations
description: Bank of America Merrill Lynch is bolstering its operations in China with the appointment of a new executive.

title: Klinsmann Sees a Big Upside for Cameron
description: Despite a lackluster 2-1 win Friday over Antigua and Barbuda on a rain-drenched field, United States defender Geoff Cameron says he is confident the team will rise to the occasion when it faces Guatemala on Tuesday in a crucial World Cup qualifier in Kansas City, Kan. (The game is at 7 p.m., Eastern time, on ESPN2.) The Americans are tied for first place in Group A of Concacaf World Cup qualifying and only need a draw to advance to next years final round. A loss, however, could potentially eliminate the Americans.

title: What Were Reading
description: Princeton Alumni Weekly: One way to try to make sense of the global economy: the Big Mac Index.  Jeff Gordinier

title: How to Write a College Application Essay
description: Evaluate a significant experience, achievement, risk you have taken or ethical dilemma you have faced. Indicate a person who has had a significant influence on you, and describe that influence. Discuss.  Describe.  Illustrate.

title: Vintage Manning (and Chargers)
description: John Elway used to be fond of saying he had so many great comebacks as a quarterback because he had played so poorly earlier in those games that the great comebacks were necessary. But as Elway watched the comeback-for-the-regular-season-ages unfold Monday night from his current spot overseeing the Broncos  a comeback engineered by Peyton Manning this time  he had to know Manning had one advantage he never did: Elway never got to play against this eras San Diego Chargers.

title: Old Globe in San Diego Finds New Artistic Director at Public Theater
description: Barry Edelstein, a director, producer and author, has been appointed artistic director of the Old Globe in San Diego, the theaters board announced Tuesday. He will start in the position on Nov. 1 and move to San Diego in January.

title: Adept Moves in Financial Crisis Clear Citigroup Chiefs Path to Top Job
description: Michael L. Corbat inherited one of Wall Streets most thankless jobs after the financial crisis. As head of Citigroups bad bank, a segregated unit of unwanted investments, he was asked to haul the bank back from the brink.

title: Microsoft Surface to Start at $500
description: As the days tick down to Microsofts introduction of its Surface tablet, the company has revealed how it plans to price the product  more like Apple than Amazon.

title: Switching Problems Snarl Morning Commute on Lexington Ave. Subways
description: A switch problem at one of New York Citys busiest subway stations snarled commutes along the Lexington Avenue line Tuesday morning.

title: In a Comics War Stories, Humor Sometimes Takes the Back Seat
description: Standing backstage, I hear the audience making small talk and opening candy. The last song of preshow music is playing, and I can feel tiny beads of sweat on the back of my neck. I wonder if I have time to run to the ladies room again? Do I have lipstick on my teeth? I hope my kids are behaving themselves. Oh, who am I kidding? They are definitely not behaving themselves. I take a deep breath and walk on stage.

title: A Surprising Departure
description: Business Day Live: Vikram Pandit resigns as chief executive of Citigroup. | Glengarry Glen Ross as a classroom text on business ethics. | How a loan relief plan may help well-off students the most.

title: Private Student Loan Gripes Echo Mortgage Complaints
description: Gripes received about the handling of private student loans bear an uncanny resemblance to complaints about mortgage servicing during the housing crisis, and the government should consider changes to address some of the problems, says the federal ombudsman for student loans.

title: Business Day Live: A Surprising Departure
description: Vikram Pandit resigns as chief executive of Citigroup. | Glengarry Glen Ross as a classroom text on business ethics. | How a loan relief plan may help well-off students the most.

title: Daily Report: The Stigma of the BlackBerry User
description: The BlackBerry was once proudly carried by the high-powered and the elite. But as Nicole Perlroth reports in Tuesdays New York Times, those who still hold one today say the device has become a magnet for mockery and derision from those with iPhones and the latest Android phones.

title: Justice Department Seeks to Dismiss Lawsuit Over Operation Fast and Furious
description: The Justice Department has asked a federal court to dismiss a lawsuit by the House oversight committee seeking to compel the Obama administration to release more internal records involving the botched gun-trafficking case known as Operation Fast and Furious.

title: Wheelies: The Empowered Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Johnny Depp Starts New Literary Imprint at Harper
description: Having hacked his way through adversaries playing screen roles like Captain Jack Sparrow and Sweeney Todd, Johnny Depp will now be slicing into manuscripts (ideally with a red pen, and not with a cutlass or a razor blade) as he starts his own literary imprint.

title: India Pledges Millions for Global Biodiversity
Carrying on With a Phantom Customer
description: SOME designers wont rest until their initials are imprinted on eyeglasses, bedsheets and perfume bottles in the farthest reaches of Waziristan. Others, like Yigal Azroul, seem a little less sure-footed in the brand-management department.

title: Citigroup C.E.O. Steps Down
description: October 16, 2012 - Vikram Pandit resigns as chief executive of Citigroup.

title: Image of the Day: Oct. 16
Debate Could Provide Romney Chance to Close Gender Gap
description: Mitt Romneys second debate appearance Tuesday night will provide him another high-profile opportunity to offer an image of reasonableness and moderation that could be crucial in winning over key voting blocs, especially women, with whom President Obama has had long-standing leads.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: A Better Way to Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Apple Expected to Unveil Smaller iPad Oct. 23
description: Apple sent invitations on Tuesday to members of the media for an event next week where it is expected to introduce a smaller version of the iPad.

title: The Time for Glengarry Glen Ross
description: Fairfield University in Connecticut tries to use David Mamets evil characters for good one week before a new production, starring Al Pacino, is set to start performances in New York.

title: What Wall Street Is Saying About Citi
description: Wall Street analysts had barely finished digesting the third-quarter results that Citigroup had released on Monday when the news broke of a shake-up at the top of the bank. Here is what the analysts had to say about the departures of Vikram S. Pandit, the banks chief executive, and John Havens, the president and chief operating officer, and the naming of Michael Corbat as the new chief:

title: 1980 Times Interview With Robert G. Anders
description: Mr. Anders was one of the Americans whose escape from Iranian hostage takers is chronicled in the film Argo.

title: On a Long Afghanistan Editorial, Bill Kellers Column and the Use of Famous Images
description: With about 200 e-mails rolling in each day to the public editors e-mail basket, I find that its sometimes useful to group them into subject categories and ask a ranking editor to address the questions. The three below have to do with editorials and opinion pieces. The questions, which are paraphrased, have been answered by Andrew Rosenthal, the editorial page editor.

title: Easing Path Out of Country, Cuba Is Dropping Exit Visas
description: MEXICO CITY  In a country of limits, it is the restriction that many Cubans hate the most: the exit visa that the government requires for travel abroad, discouraging all but the favored or fortunate from leaving the island.

title: Attention, Shoppers | Elmgreen & Dragset at Louis Vuitton
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Halting a Slow Fade to History
description: WASHINGTON  Thirty-three years after the event, Hollywood has turned its attention to an episode that traumatized the United States for months: the seizure of the American Embassy in Tehran. But it has focused on what one participant called a footnote: the escape of 6 embassy personnel, not the 52 Americans who spent 14 months in captivity.

title: Hillary: The Missed Opportunity
description: Back in January I proposed that President Obama do a switcheroo, sending Joe Biden to the State Department and making Hillary Clinton his running mate. I acknowledged the reasons that this was probably a fantasy, but contended the arguments in favor were as simple as one-two-three:

title: Appeals Court Overturns Terrorism Conviction of Bin Ladens Driver
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court on Friday overturned the terrorism conviction of Salim Ahmed Hamdan, a former driver and bodyguard for Osama bin Laden whose case has been one of the most tangled to emerge from the war crimes trials of detainees held by the military at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: A U.N. Discussion Seeks a New Set of Global Goals
description: Heres the Twitter flow around a special session Ive been running this morning at the United Nations, called Conceptualizing a Set of Sustainable Development Goals:

title: Battle of Incumbents
description: Redistricting has left Representatives Tom Latham and Leonard L. Boswell, both entrenched incumbents, in an unusual face-off for a seat in Iowas Third Congressional District.

title: As Two Iowa Incumbents Compete, the White House Race Reverberates
description: CRESTON, Iowa  As the sun fell behind a nearby barn, Representatives Tom Latham and LeonardL. Boswell nipped at each other with unconcealed disdain begotten by months of negative advertisements and campaign miles.

title: A Tiny Pacific Island Nation That Does Not Smell Like Paradise
description: FUNAFUTI, Tuvalu  The sun is setting over the Pacific islet, casting the isolated lagoon in brilliant shades of red, orange and topaz. Towering palm trees sway slowly in the warm tropical breeze. Out in the distance, fishermen in a small boat slowly troll the coral atolls for reef fish, much as the people of Tuvalu have done for hundreds of years or more.

title: Ford Recalls 155,000 Fiestas to Address Side-Curtain Air Bag Issue
description: Citing an issue with the side-curtain air bag on the passenger side, Ford informed the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration that it would recall nearly 155,000 of its Fiesta subcompacts.

title: Who Won the Debate? Think Twice About the Answers on Twitter
description: As President Obama and Mitt Romney finish their closing statements in the presidential debate on Tuesday night, viewers at home will quickly consider who won and who lost. People wanting objective assessments of that question might not want to turn to their Twitter feeds for the most fair-minded answers.

title: Income Inequality May Take Toll on Growth
description: WASHINGTON  Income inequality has soared to the highest levels since the Great Depression, and the recession has done little to reverse the trend, with the top 1 percent of earners taking 93 percent of the income gains in the first full year of the recovery.

title: The Great Hanging at Gainesville
description: October is the time when summer finally releases its grip on the flat plain of North Texas. But in the fall of 1862 this part of Texas was in the grip of a cycle of violence: Texan against Texan, even as the Civil War pitted Southerner against Northerner.

title: CMJ: It Begins. Brace Yourselves.
description: The grass-roots music business spills out onto the streets this week with the 31st annual CMJ Music Marathon. From Tuesday through the wee hours of Sunday morning, it brings some 1,300 acts  bands, rappers, songwriters, laptoppers and no doubt some ukulele players  in search of attention and its dividends. There once were thoughts that the Internet, where nearly every CMJ band can be sampled at leisure (and in higher fidelity), would make a mass live showcase like CMJ obsolete. Instead, paradoxically, more and more musicians arrive, eagerly hoping that a 25-minute set in some firetrap basement might be witnessed by someone useful  or, now, recorded and uploaded to YouTube.

title: Obama-Backed Battery Maker Files for Bankruptcy
description: An electric car battery maker that President Obama touted as part of a vanguard of a new American electric car industry has filed for bankruptcy and is selling its major assets, the company announced on Tuesday.

title: In Setback for Military Tribunals, Bin Laden Drivers Conviction Is Reversed
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday threw out the terrorism conviction of a high-profile former detainee at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, Salim Hamdan, a Yemeni who served as Osama bin Ladens driver and bodyguard and whose case led to a landmark 2006 Supreme Court ruling striking down the Bush administrations first version of military commissions.

title: In Citigroup Shake-Up, a New Show of Power by Boards
description: The departure of Vikram S. Pandit shows clearly who is in charge of Citigroup: the board of directors. For good or for bad, boards are increasingly taking charge of corporate America. The reign of the imperial chief executive is over.

title: Town Hall Format Poses Risks for Obama and Romney
description: As President Obama and Mitt Romney prepare for their debate on Tuesday night, they face an unpredictable variable that was not a factor in their previous encounter: the common voter.

title: If You Like Hearts Hard Rock. . .
Why Private Medicare Plans Dont Cost Less
description: Dana P. Goldman is the director of the Leonard D. Schaeffer Center for Health Policy and Economics at the University of Southern California. Adam Leive is a graduate student at the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. Daniel McFadden is a senior fellow at the Schaeffer Center and the 2000 Nobel winner in economic science.

title: The People Who Make Up Citis Board
description: Vikram S. Pandits sudden exit from Citigroup appears to have much to do with tension with the banks board.

title: Ranting Elmo Finds Prosperity Out West
description: Following the tradition of Broadway performances that strike out on national tours, the man known for dressing up in an Elmo costume and shouting anti-Semitic rants in New York City seems to have taken his show on the road.

title: Women on the Verge of a Political Breakthrough
description: NEW YORK  Already American women are setting records in this election cycle, running for office in ground-breaking numbers, as I write in my latest Female Factor column. But beyond the sheer numbers, among the scores of veterans and newcomers, several women stand on the brink of making history.

title: Five Players to Watch This Season
description: With the N.B.A.s season only weeks away, teams are settling in to a regular routine of training camp practices and exhibitions, while fans get their first full look at the newest additions to their teams. With the league back to its standard 82-game schedule, which players can we expect to make the leap from rising star to household name? Here are five likely candidates.

title: Raising Snails
description: To raise delicious snails, you need to know what makes them tick.

title: People Powered | Istanbul Design Biennial
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Arrests of 2 U.S. Sailors in Rape Case Threaten to Fan Okinawas Anger
description: TOKYO  Two United States Navy sailors were arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of raping a woman in Okinawa, local news reports said, an episode likely to fan anger on an island increasingly outraged over the presence of a large American base.

title: The Snail Wrangler
description: STRATHMORE, Calif.

title: Justices Clear the Way for Early Voting in Ohio
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday cleared the way for early voting in Ohio the weekend before Election Day. The justices, in a one-sentence order without noted dissents, let stand an appeals court ruling that had blocked the efforts of officials in Ohio to restrict early voting there. The Supreme Courts action was a victory for the Obama campaign, which had sued to overturn the restrictions.

title: Superheroes Occupy New York
description: Growing up, I never collected comic books. That doesnt mean I didnt enjoy comics. The Sunday funnies brought me Hal Fosters Prince Valiant and Ripleys Believe It or Not. The one superhero of my childhood was Superman, and he was in a black-and-white TV. This might explain my current fascination with New York Comic-Con.

title: Art Theft Strips Dutch Museum of Masterpieces
description: Works by Matisse, Monet and Picasso were taken from a Rotterdam museum.

title: Rainbow Room Is Given Landmark Status
description: Now it is official: The Rainbow Room, a personal landmark for New Yorkers who proposed there or dreamed of putting on their finest and dancing away the night there, is a city landmark.

title: No Guarantee of Obama Rebound in Second Debate
description: President Obama was soundly defeated in the first presidential debate in Denver, contributing toward about a four-point swing toward Mitt Romney in head-to-head polls  enough to turn the race from one in which Mr. Obama had a clear lead into a very close contest.

title: Energy Price Increases Pose Challenge for Merkel
description: BERLIN  In the aftermath of the tsunami and nuclear meltdown in Japan last year, Chancellor Angela Merkel announced perhaps her most sweeping domestic ambition, a plan to shutter Germanys 17 nuclear reactors and switch to 80 percent reliance on wind, solar and other renewable sources by 2050.

title: Left Unsaid
description: Tonight marks the last chance to hear the presidential candidates debate domestic issues, since their third and final debate next week will concern foreign affairs.

title: Disneys Magic Kingdom Will Be Dry No More
description: The Magic Kingdom Park at Disney World in Florida is about to get even more enchanting, for those 21 and older. Next month, it is ending its 41-year-old policy of no alcohol by serving wine and beer during dinner hours at Be Our Guest, its new Beauty and the Beast-theme restaurant. The parks executives have realized, apparently, that no French meal is complete without a glass of Chablis or Bordeaux.

title: Preview of Second Presidential Debate
description: TimesCast Politics: Looking ahead to the town hall debate. | The challenges of direct voter interaction. | Two incumbents face off in Iowa.

title: A Memorial for Robert Hughes at the Met
description: The life of Robert Hughes, the art critic and historian who died in August at the age of 74, will be remembered by a group of writers, editors and fellow critics who knew him, as well as family members, at a ceremony on Thursday at 2 p.m. at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The memorial, in the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium, will include remarks by Tina Brown, Leon Wieseltier, Peter Carey, Simon Schama, Michael Kimmelman and Mr. Hughess longtime editor at Knopf, Peter Gethers, and by Mr. Hughess wife, Doris Downes, and stepson, Fielder Jewett. (Mr. Gethers, Ms. Downes and Mr. Jewett are new additions since the roster of speakers was announced on Tuesday; Peter Mathiessen, who was originally announced as a speaker, will not be appearing.) Jeremy Denk will perform at the piano. The ceremony is open to the public.

title: CNN to Interview Reddits Violentacrez: A Troll Comes Out From Under the Bridge
description: Last weeks article on Gawker that outed Violentacrez, the moderator of several controversial forums on the online community of Reddit, hit all the Webs hot buttons: Freedom of speech versus privacy, anonymity versus accountability, and community versus the broader community.

title: TimesCast Politics: Looking Ahead to the Second Presidential Debate
description: Getty Images

title: A Trip Down the Short, Sad Path of Old Lane
description: Perhaps the best trade Vikram Pandit made as a hedge fund manager was selling his firm to Citigroup.

title: Conservative Group Calls for Tennessee Republicans Resignation
description: Tennessees oldest and largest conservative organization is mounting a campaign to force the resignation of Representative Scott DesJarlais after a taped phone call of Mr. DesJarlais, an anti-abortion Republican, appeared to show him pressuring a mistress to terminate a pregnancy.

title: Nominees for the Clive Barnes Foundation Awards Are Announced
description: Joaquina Kalukango (Hurt Village), Derek Klena (Dogfight), Rob McClure (Chaplin) and Stephen Tyrone Williams (My Children, My Africa) are the nominees in theater and Lauren Lovette (New York City Ballet), Steven Melendez (New York Theater Ballet) and Ashley Murphy (Dance Theater of Harlem) are the nominees in dance for the Clive Barnes Foundation Awards, the organization announced on Tuesday. The awards are given to two talented young professionals, one in the field of theater and one in the field of dance. The winners will be honored at an awards ceremony on Dec. 10 at the Walter Reade Theater, Lincoln Center.

title: Fresh Ricotta
description: Rich, homemade ricotta thats done in an hour, courtesy of Mark Bittman.

title: Holmgrens Browns Tenure Ends With a Thud
description: As it became official on Tuesday that new ownership for the Cleveland Browns means Mike Holmgren exits stage left, the only real question is whether getting bounced from the hapless Browns is a good or a bad thing. No one likes to get fired, but on the plus side for Holmgren, he no longer has to absorb his teams weekly Three Stooges routine as a personal affront.

title: The Get | Rebecca Minkoffs Earrings
description: Playing off her prim-with-an-edge aesthetic, the designer Rebecca Minkoff took her first step into the jewelry business with a costume bijoux collection that follows suit: punky bangles in yellow gold with a faux pav trim come with matching studs; black crystals set on silver metal mimick a rivire-style necklace; and neon yellow enamel earrings mix Art Deco modernism with space-age slickness. Our favorite pieces are these pav earrings that can be worn forwards or backwards and cling to the ears like little glittering claws. Consider us captured.

title: A Woman From the Country in Mitterrands Kitchen
description: PARISAs truffle season in France inches closer and the smell of damp leaves in the forest evokes the seasonal change in food, a film called Les Saveurs du Palais is arriving in Paris. The films English title, Haute Cuisine, misses a beat: Palais means palace as well as palate in French. The story is based on a two-year period when Franois Mitterrand, then president of France, hired a personal cook, ruffling the feathers of the official in-house Elyse chef.

title: Here Today, Gone Tomorrow: Preserving Culture in Changing Times
description: Overview |  What aspects of our lives deserve saving for future generations? What relics and traditions are in danger of disappearing forever, and should be preserved? In this lesson, students examine a range of efforts to preserve history and culture, from rural India to the Apollo lunar missions. Students can take the role of preservationist, investigate cultural theft and play referee on local and international preservation debates.

title: Hip-Hop Meets Hipster in Bed-Stuy
description: We spotted Lance Fresh, sporting a leather jacket and a retro hat, taking photos with his friends on the corner of Nostrand Avenue and Halsey Street.

title: Ted Turner Cited for Place-Based Media Efforts
description: Ted Turner is known for his pioneering efforts in cable television, founding channels like CNN and TBS. He was honored on Tuesday for his leadership role involving other types of screens.

title: Hollywood Moguls Pledge $90 Million to Organization Supporting Workers
description: Following in the philanthropic footsteps of entertainment moguls like Barry Diller and Rupert Murdoch, a trio of Hollywood heavyweights  David Geffen, Jeffrey Katzenberg and Steven Spielberg  pledged on Tuesday that they would each donate $30 million to the non-profit Motion Picture & Television Fund.

title: Spain Nears a Decision on Asking the European Union for a Bailout or Loan
description: LONDON  After months of delay, the Spanish government is edging closer to making a decision about whether to ask for European financial assistance.

title: Neil Young: One Show Well Worth Our Time and Money
description: Like most families, we try to keep a tight rein on discretionary spending. But when I heard that the musician Neil Young would be touring with the band Crazy Horse, I decided that if he played anywhere near where we live, wed certainly buy tickets.

title: Something in a Sleeve for Spring
description: From the look of the spring shows last month, fashion has had a wake-up call. Designers who routinely cater to stringy adolescents, or parade arm-baring sheaths that only Michelle Obama could love, suddenly seemed to get that their most devoted clients  women well over 40 with upscale tastes and incomes to match  view the first ladys biceps with serious pangs of envy.

title: $11 Million Severance Reported for Murdoch Aide
description: LONDON  Rebekah Brooks, the former chief executive of News International, Rupert Murdochs British newspaper group, received about $11 million when she resigned last year in the midst of the scandal over phone hacking and other malpractice at two of the companys tabloid newspapers, people familiar with the terms of her severance agreement say.

title: A Picasso and a Gauguin Are Among 7 Works Stolen From a Dutch Museum
description: PARIS  With impeccable timing and taste, thieves in the wee hours of Tuesday morning plundered an art museum in the Netherlands that was celebrating its 20th birthday and made away with seven borrowed paintings, including valuable works by Picasso, Monet, Gauguin, Matisse and Lucian Freud.

title: Krugman: Blatant Sneering Dishonesty
description: Part 6: The economist and Op-Ed columnist talks about how he thinks President Obama can best advance his agenda in his second term.

title: Krugman: Build a Bridge to Nowhere
description: Part 10: The economist and Op-Ed columnist describes the short-term and long-term things he thinks the government needs to do to ensure a strong recovery.

title: Krugman: The Problem With the Banks
description: Part 11: The economist and Op-Ed columnist shares what he thinks the American rights true objective is, and weighs in on whether the big banks should be broken up.

title: Krugman: What the Stimulus Actually Did
description: Part 4: The economist and Op-Ed columnist argues that the notion and fear of a culture of dependency have outlasted the actual possibility of plausibly living on government benefits.

title: Krugman: Saving Galactic Civilization
description: Part 8: The economist and Op-Ed columnist talks about how he would change the tax code, and shares his favorite science fiction novel.

title: Krugman: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the economist and Op-Ed columnist Paul Krugman.

title: Krugman: How to Destroy Greece
description: Part 12: The economist and Op-Ed columnist explains why the EUs policies in response to the Eurozone crisis have made the crisis worse, not better.

title: TimesTalks | Paul Krugman: Preview
description: The economist and Op-Ed columnist shares his prescription for economic recovery, offers advice to President Obama, and explains why a country and a household shouldnt budget the same way.

title: Krugman: These Are Not Ordinary Times
description: Part 7: The economist and Op-Ed columnist explains why the Federal Reserve doesnt have the power it once did.

title: Krugman: The Awesomeness of This
description: Part 2: The economist and Op-Ed columnist explains the single intellectual failure keeping our economy from roaring back to full health.

title: Krugman: Economists Behaving Badly
description: Part 13: The economist and Op-Ed columnist reflects on why he thinks his fellow economists failed in response to the financial crisis.

title: Krugman: An Incredible Mistake
description: Part 9: The economist and Op-Ed columnist explains why the politicians considered the most serious about fiscal matters are also often the most wrong.

title: Krugman: Austerity Jones
description: Part 3: The economist and Op-Ed columnist explains why the idea that austerity can rescue the economy from a downturn is reasonable but wrong.

title: Krugman: Self-Aware Villains
description: Part 5: The economist and Op-Ed columnist shares what he thinks is the worst long-term effect of the economic downturn.

title: A Gratifying Adventure in Group Cooking
description: THERE is the potluck, but there is also collective cooking. And given a willing helper or two, it can turn a fairly standard weeknight meal into a rocking party. The pace is not necessarily relaxed, but its fun.

title: Mile 8: Where the Nets Now Roam
description: Once athletes cross the Mile 7 mark, theres less than a mile to go on Fourth Avenue before the complexion of the course changes dramatically.

title: Suspect in Lower East Side Killing Surrenders to Police
description: The suspect in the Oct. 6 fatal shooting outside a Lower East Side barbershop was arrested on Monday after turning himself in at the neighborhoods police precinct house, the police said.

title: A Second Act, Stuffed With Pie
description: It was the glass ceiling that drove Alicia Scotti into the kitchen full time. This 54-year-old mother of two from the Riverdale section of the Bronx had a career in entertainment marketing for television, but finally quit to follow her love of baking. She grew up with 10 siblings in Rhode Island in a family that cooked and baked; with her own family, she cooks dinners from scratch most nights. She started her pie business a little over a year ago, baking to order at a commercial kitchen in the Bronx. Her pies, which are outstanding, include honey-pine nut, chocolate-walnut and pear-butterscotch from a list of more than three dozen. Her old-fashioned Nesselrode pie is not made in the style that was popular in New York  a gelatin custard studded with candied fruits  but with a chestnut cream filling, the original European recipe. She also bakes cookies, bars and cakes.

title: After a Ban, Wagyu From Japan Returns
description: After an absence of nearly three years, wagyu is being allowed back into the United States from Japan. Imports of the beef had been discontinued because of an outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease in Japan, and so restaurants and shops sold beef from wagyu cattle raised in the United States, and many will continue to do so. But there is a big difference. The genuine Japanese version, bottom, is as costly for one steak as a cashmere sweater and is much more densely marbled with fat. Its muscle is paler in color than its American counterpart, top. There are grades of Japanese wagyu, the highest being 10 to 12. It has a more complex flavor, think umami. And when cooking it to medium, its essential to put a good bit of sear on the buttery fat.

title: Beer Turns to Whiskey
description: Richard Stabile, an electrical engineer, has been making vodka on the North Shore of Suffolk County for the last four years. His Long Island Spirits is the first distillery to open on the Island since Prohibition. Now, in the handsome 100-year-old stone-and-shingle horse barn that houses his distillery, he is also making a whiskey and a brandy. Though he starts his vodka from raw materials (local potatoes that are cooked and mashed), for the base of his whiskey he uses a strong beer, Old Howling Bastard, made by Blue Point Brewing in Patchogue on the South Shore.

title: Students Pepper-Sprayed by Classmate at Queens School
description: Thirty-four Queens middle school students were pepper-sprayed by a classmate at lunch on Tuesday, according to the citys Department of Education.

title: Iran Sanctions May Cut Supply of Currency
description: Western economic sanctions imposed on Iran over its disputed nuclear program have severely depressed the value of its national currency, the rial, causing higher inflation and forcing Iranians to carry ever-fatter wads of bank notes to buy everyday items. But the sanctions have also presented a new complication to Irans banking authorities: they may not be able to print enough money.

title: Pandit, a Low-Paid C.E.O. Among Wall Street Peers
description: Vikram S. Pandit worked as Citigroups chief executive for just under five years. But during that time, he earned a good deal less than what other Wall Street chieftains made.

title: A Little Taste of Time Travel
description: When it comes to our senses, vision and hearing get us through the bulk of our workaday lives, but to reach deeper into our spiritual selves, nothing jogs the memory or jars the soul like smell and taste. And nothing stirs long-forgotten feelings like food, which is why Culinary Quests, the globe-trotting culinary experiences in our Food & Drink Issue, is such a remarkable collection of anecdotes. As you read dispatches of delicacies from the far corners of the world, not only does it make you hungry (I gained 40 pounds while copy-editing the thing) but it also transports you back to your own journeys.

title: Now in New York: Delhis Moti Mahal and a Dosateria
description: Indian restaurant openings in New York City arent always newsworthy, but the two new eateries this fall stand out  theyre neither the typical nondescript corner curry joint, nor are they the new breed of Michelin star-aspiring, high-end botes.

title: Michel Richard to Move In to Le Cirques Old Home
description: The French chef Michel Richard has announced that he will open a multifaceted restaurant in New York this summer. The restaurant, as yet unnamed, will be installed in the New York Palace hotel, 455 Madison Avenue (50th Street), in the rooms whose landmark interiors were once home to Le Cirque.

title: Romney Donors Meet to Schmooze . . . and Raise More
description: So just what did Mitt Romneys high-dollar donors come to the Waldorf-Astoria to do this week?

title: Lies, Damned Lies, and Jobs
description: Aha. Via Greg Sargent, the Romney campaign is lying about its jobs plan.

title: Asked & Answered | Swizz Beatz
description: The Grammy-award winning artist and hip-hop producer Swizz Beatz, born Kasseem Dean, is all about moments, he says. And hes had quite a few. His first was in 1998, when he produced a hip-hop ballad for the rapper DMX, entitled Ruff Ryders Anthem for his uncles label on Def Jam. The track stupefied hip-hop lovers and haters alike with its sitar-looping sound. Then, in 2001, he started his music label Full Surface, which helped start the careers of musicians like Bone Thugs-n-Harmony and Eve. At the time Dean was 23. When someone goes right, I go left, he says of his career choices, which brought him next into the world of design with Kidrobot in 2006, and then into fashion four years later when he collaborated on a sneaker line with Reebok. Even the automobile industry came knocking  he became the face of the sports and racing brand Lotus Cars.

title: After 42 Years, a Lichtenstein Goes Home
description: In 2006 the Roy Lichtenstein Foundation put an image of a lost painting by Lichtenstein, Electric Cord, on its holiday greeting card. The foundation used the occasion to ask for help in tracking down the work, and the fruit of that effort was on display on Tuesday when Preet Bharara, United States Attorney in Manhattan, finally returned Electric Cord, gone for 42 years, to its owner.

title: From the White House, Beer We Can Believe In
description: IT may well have been the most famous home-brewing experiment in history. The White House chefs, using a kit bought last year by President Obama, produced their own beer with honey harvested at the White House.

title: Seldon Seen
description: And now for something completely different (and fun): The Folio Society has just issued a deluxe new edition of Isaac Asimovs Foundation trilogy. And they picked an unusual person to write the introduction (pdf).

title: In a Slow Market, Intel Exceeds Lowered Expectations
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Intel crossed an earnings bar it lowered for itself last month, but the problems plaguing its main market for semiconductors  personal computers  seemed no closer to ending.

title: The Caucus Click: Spin Room Prep
Photo Replay: Oct.16
description: A view of the day in sports, including surfing in Indonesia and 2014 World Cup qualifying soccer matches.

title: Murdoch Hears Critics as His Board Wins Election
description: 8:20 p.m. | Updated For a second year in a row, Rupert Murdoch faced shareholder critics of his News Corporation at the companys annual meeting. And for a second year in a row their proposals for management changes were shot down.

title: The Envelope Please: Chandler Buckingham
description: Chandler Buckingham, a student at Rogers High School in Rogers, Ark., warns fellow students to write everything down!

title: Alain Ducasse to Close Adour in New York
description: Alain Ducasse and the St. Regis New York have agreed to terminate their partnership, and Mr. Ducasse plans to close Adour, his five-year-old restaurant there, with the final dinners scheduled for Nov. 17. Mr. Ducasse said that he had been considering this move since the spring, but he would not elaborate on his reasons.

title: Live Blog: Citigroups Conference Call
description: 5:08 p.m. | Updated

title: On Television, Nets Are a Hit
description: The Brooklyn Nets have already set a record: Monday nights 98-88 victory over the Washington Wizards was the new-look, new-city teams highest rated preseason game ever on the YES Network.

title: Happy Birthday, Clean Water Act
description: Thursday, Oct. 18, marks the 40th anniversary of the Clean Water Act,a critical turning point in the nations efforts to rescue its rivers, streams, lakes and wetlands from centuries of industrial, municipal and agricultural pollution. But what should be a moment of celebration is also a moment of apprehension: Republicans in the House have spent the last two years trying to undercut the law, and should they gain control of the White House and Congress in next months elections, they could well succeed.

title: Chevrolet Tries to Spark Curiosity at New York Comic-Con
description: 5:34 p.m. | Updated

title: Medvedev Calls for Public Smoking Ban in Russia by 2015
description: MOSCOW  Prime Minister Dmitri A. Medvedev voiced support on Tuesday for a proposed ban on public smoking by 2015 in Russia, where close to a third of the population smokes.

title: America, Soccerland
description: That guy up there may just be the best expression of the state of soccer in America right now. I dont mean Clint Dempsey, whos being impersonated by the Lego-ish figure. Deuce is pretty integral at the moment, to be sure  in fact, tonight, in a qualifying match against Guatemala, he may well be the driving force that keeps the U.S. mens team on track to make the next World Cup. (We really dont want to lose this game.)

title: Sketch Released in Sexual Abuse of 10-Year-Old Inside Queens Library
description: The police released a sketch Tuesday of a man they say sexually abused a 10-year-old girl on Monday inside the Pomonok branch of the Queens Public Library on Jewel Avenue.

title: I.B.M. Squeezes Out a Profit as Its Revenue Declines
description: I.B.M. delivered a mixed and somewhat unsettling quarterly performance on Tuesday. Profits barely exceeded Wall Streets expectations, while revenue fell well below.

title: 7 Manhattan Hotel Rooms for $150, More or Less
description: Can you get a decent hotel room in Manhattan for under $150 a night?

title: Blanca
description: Inside the 12-seat restaurant located on the grounds of Robertas in Bushwick.

title: Decoding Apples Media Invitation
description: Its game time! No, were not talking about the football game, or the baseball game. This is the nerds game: an Apple media event.

title: Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation Names New Executive Director
description: The Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation chose the man in charge of its fund-raising, marketing and public relations to become the next executive director, the foundation said on Tuesday. He is Bennett Rink, who joined Ailey in 1994 as special events manager and rose to become senior director of development and external affairs. Mr. Rink succeeds Sharon Gersten Luckman, who joined the institution in 1992 and became executive director in 1995. She will step down at the beginning of next year. The foundations centerpiece is the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater company, and includes a large school and educational programs. Mr. Rinks appointment will complete a turnover in the foundations artistic and executive leadership. Robert Battle succeeded Judith Jamison, the long-time artistic director, last year. Mr. Battle could also be considered an insider, having choreographed many works for the company since 1999.

title: Hilary Mantel Wins a Second Booker Prize
description: LONDON  The British novelist Hilary Mantel won the 2012 Man Booker Prize on Tuesday night for Bring Up the Bodies, the second book in her planned trilogy about the life and machinations of Thomas Cromwell, King Henry VIIIs chief minister and master manipulator.

title: Instruments From Past Eras, Played for Modern Ears
description: Normally it is not news when an orchestra sounds like, well, an orchestra.

title: A Tiny Stage Full of Song in Bushwick
description: ACCORDING to this newspapers longtime tradition, I had to eat at the Brooklyn restaurant Blanca at least three times before reviewing it. I secured one reservation simply by phoning on the first day of the month, when Blanca opens and then closes its reservation book for the coming weeks. That tactic never worked again.

title: N.H.L. Offers Players a 50-50 Division of Revenue
description: The N.H.L. made a surprise offer in talks for a new collective bargaining agreement on Tuesday in Toronto, proposing a 50-50 split of hockey-related revenue with the N.H.L. Players Association and a mechanism guaranteeing that current contracts would be honored without rollbacks.

title: Game 3 Highlights and Analysis: Tigers 2, Yankees 1
Beyonc to Headline Super Bowl Halftime Show
description: The halftime performance at the next Super Bowl, the ultimate star turn for pop divas, will go to Beyonc, the National Football League confirmed on Twitter on Tuesday. The official announcement came after The Associated Press reported earlier in the day that Beyonc, the Houston-born R&B singer, was this seasons pick for the job.

title: The Adelson Phenomenon Spreads Among Donors
description: There is more than one Sheldon Adelson-type donor in the world of super PACs, according to new filings with the Federal Election Commission.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ivory Coast and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ivory Coast, Pakistan, France and Brazil

title: Home-Schooling, Comic Con Style (Part 1)
description: Ask your average Comic Con vendor if hes got any educational titles, and prepare to be met with the rather-too-swift assertion that his cyborg-superheroes and rotting zombies promote literacy. Mmm. Actually, what my 12-year-old home-schooled son and I were in the market for was something closer to the Epic Battles of the Civil War series we picked up at the New York Historical Society. I was surprised to learn it was published by Marvel Entertainment, something that failed to spark any recognition or even interest in those working Marvels huge Javits Center booth last Sunday. In their defense, it was the final day of a well-attended convention, and the cacophony of the surrounding video game demo stations rivaled that of the Kids Day throng. Surely thats why they treated me like the nun who blundered into a porn shop, in search of Holy Host. I mean, its not as if I was wearing a nun costume  or any costume, for that matter.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: 'Holy Motors'
description: Leos Carax, the director of "Holy Motors," discusses a scene from his film.

title: Deal Is Reached on Placement of Donors Names at a Roosevelt Monument
description: The fight over the placement of inscriptions acknowledging two donors to the new Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park on Roosevelt Island was resolved in a court hearing on Tuesday.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Benefits

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Fte Accompli | All Heart
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Intersection: Hip-Hop and Hipster Styles Converge in Bed-Stuy
description: Lance Darrell, also known as Lance Fresh, decided early in his life that he would never blindly follow trends. Mr. Darrell, 26, a native of Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, said that for years Jordans, team jerseys and pretty much whatever Jay-Z wore dominated the direction of street style in Bed-Stuy. His closet was not without those items, but Mr. Darrell was known to mix it up, so much so that his peers often called him out in school for style choices. As the years passed his look continued to evolve, much like the neighborhood.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Holy Motors
description: In Holy Motors, the latest film from the French director Leos Carax, a man is chauffeured around the streets of Paris in a limousine while taking on different roles. Denis Lavant plays the shape-shifting character and, in this scene, he encounters a woman from his past, played by Kylie Minogue. Above, Mr. Carax discusses the scenes location and how he came to cast Ms. Minogue in his film.

title: Sit Back, Relax and Turn the Page
description: THE phrase literary salon has a whole new meaning.

title: Predebate Scenes From the Postdebate Spin Room
description: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y.  Four hours before the candidates step on the stage at Hofstra University here, the cavernous spin room is already crackling with narratives and counternarratives  most about how pugilistic President Obama is likely to be.

title: The Truth That Was Obscured After Protesters Were Killed
description: Sociopolitical themes are invariably woven into the fabric of the great contemporary Irish dramatist Brian Friels works, but few are as direct in their focus as The Freedom of the City, which is being given a trenchant revival at the Irish Repertory Theater.

title: World Cup Qualifying: U.S. 3, Guatemala 1
description: The United States can advance to the final round of Concacaf World Cup qualifying with a win or a tie against Guatemala on Tuesday night in Kansas City, Kan (7 p.m., ESPN2). A loss could complicate things a bit, if Jamaica posts a big win over Antigua and Barbuda, and that is naturally what the glass-is-half-full crowd has focused on since Fridays lackluster, last-minute win at Antigua.

title: With Bare Feet, Bringing Gods and Beasts to Life
description: When an aging performer returns after an absence of several years, the question naturally arises, Has he still got it? Such was the case on Saturday, when the Indian dancer Pandit Birju Maharaj appeared at Symphony Space (courtesy of the World Music Institute) in his first New York performance since 2008. Mr. Maharaj is nearly 75, but moments after he walked onstage, his age seemed irrelevant.

title: Excerpt: 'Falling'
description: Daniel Everidge, Julia Murney and Celia Howard in a scene from Deanna Jents drama about an 18-year-old boy with autism.

title: A Family Dynamic Dictated by Autism
description: The Martin family in Deanna Jents Falling tries to lead a normal life: the father, Bill (Daniel Pearce), would like more time alone with his wife, Tami (Julia Murney); their teenage daughter, Lisa (Jacey Powers), wants to adopt a dog; Bills mother, the Bible-toting Grammy Sue (Celia Howard), is coming to visit for a few days. Their suburban home (convincingly conjured by the set designer, John C. Stark) reflects their seemingly mundane affairs. But everyones schedule (and patience) is strained by the 18-year-old Josh (Daniel Everidge), who is severely autistic.

title: Who Knows What Evil Lurks in the Hellish Sanitarium?
description: American Horror Story starts over again on Wednesday night, with 17 Emmy nominations in the bank for its first season last year on FX. That it won only two awards  for hairstyling and for Jessica Langes supporting performance as the psycho granny of the Antichrist  can be taken as a sign that people thought there was something there but werent sure what it was.

title: Its Not About the Destination, but About the Dizzying Ride
description: Holy Motors, from the French filmmaker Leos Carax, is a dream of the movies that looks like a movie of dreams. It is a reverie that begins, appropriately, with a seated audience waiting in the dark (like us) and then cuts to a dimly lighted room, where a man (Mr. Carax) rises from a bed that he shares with a dog. He lets the sleeping dog lie (no need for trouble just yet) and creeps over to a mysterious door hidden in a wall. With a strange metal key thats apparently grafted to one of his fingers, he unlocks the door and  like Little Nemo tumbling into Slumberland, Dorothy crossing over the rainbow and Alice falling down the rabbit hole  leaves one world for another.

title: When Sure Proof Proves to Be Unsure
description: The world is flat. The Sun revolves around the Earth. Yes, todays certainty is tomorrows oops, a realization that is particularly alarming when applied to criminal investigation techniques, as it is in Forensics on Trial, Wednesday nights episode of Nova on PBS.

title: With an Eye to Digital, Music Publishing Agency Appoints a New Chief
description: The Harry Fox Agency, one of the main licensing clearinghouses of the music publishing business, has appointed a new chief executive, in a move that may signal a push into new forms of business as traditional revenue sources diminish.

title: Romney Campaign Makes $12 Million Ad Buy
description: The Romney campaign, flush with cash from its impressive haul of $170 million last month, is reserving large quantities of airtime for the coming week.

title: Sad Songs, at Their Wits End
description: The breezy, smart cabaret duo Eric Comstock and Barbara Fasano are not the first performers who come to mind when you think of heavy-duty ballads steeped in mystery, seduction and obsession. Mr. Comstock is a conversational pop-jazz pianist and singer with impeccable enunciation who observes lyrics from afar and savors their wordplay, but is too fastidious to roll around in emotional mud.

title: Bin Ladens Driver
description: The story of Salim Hamdan, a Yemeni man who worked as a driver for Osama bin Laden and today won a significant court battle, is the story of how little President George W. Bush cared about the rule of law.

title: Reading to Drinkers and Drinking to Books
description: Until Kara Newman, author of The Secret Financial Life of Food, invited me to participate in tonights drink.think event, I didnt know that there was a New York City reading series entirely devoted to writing about drink. Further proof that this is a great town. I look forward to reading with a gaggle of my fellow drinkcentric writers.

title: For the Crowded Masses, a Push to Provide More Escape Patches
description: MUMBAI, India  Not far from where Anusaya Nair lives, a room that measures barely 5 feet by 5 feet, is her main escape: a 9,200-square-foot park, boxed on three sides by a ramshackle garage, tenement housing and an apartment complex. A few women take their evening stroll on the walking track circling the park; elderly companions exchange gossip on a handful of scattered benches; neighborhood children play on a swing set at the back.

title: Even at Home, All Their Worlds a Stage
description: Partly reverent, mostly sendup, Just 45 Minutes From Broadway depicts theater folk as those lovably quirky people who cant stop performing in life, for better or worse. This film might be perfect for a preteen acting camp, or anyone whose eyes have that glowing, cultlike spark of the stage-obsessed.

title: After 15 Years, a Roadside Performer Is Getting the Spotlight
description: Before social media made it easier to reach an audience, Otis Houston Jr. had already figured out a way to catch the attention of thousands of people every day.

title: Economic Health? Its Relative
description: With financial markets careening around the world, in January 2009 a newly inaugurated President Obama acknowledged he had to fix the problem pretty fast. If I dont have this done in three years, he told NBCs Matt Lauer, then theres gonna be a one-term proposition.

title: Just the Thing for Those Who Have It All
description: SO youve earned it. Now, how to spend it? We have a few ideas. These products may be in the fantasy realm. But, as the interior designer Miles Redd says, sometimes luxe pleasures and products can have outsized effects. When great wealth is attached to creativity, what it can render can be extraordinary, said Mr. Redd, the author of The Big Book of Chic. Unusual, for sure.  STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

title: A Guiding Hand for Bequests, Beyond the Grave
description: THERE is a QTIP that is not for people with delicate cleaning problems. It is for those with a very different problem  the delightful problem of expecting to leave substantial assets to heirs.

title: In Demanding Homes, Help in High Demand
description: DELORES BETHELMIE seemed perfect to work as a nanny for the 1 percent.

title: High Returns and a Tax Break in One Investment
description: WITH payouts on conventional investments miserly and tax increases looming on Jan. 1, financial advisers are talking up an alternative investment that offers much greater income and tax breaks: master limited partnerships, or M.L.P.s.

title: The Best Seats in the House, or Maybe Ballpark
description: AS a boy in Tennessee, F. Perkins Hixon said he grew up listening to recordings of Maria Callas. So after he moved to New York, he subscribed to box seats at the Metropolitan Opera, gradually upgrading to the top class, a parterre center box of eight seats, at more than $16,400 a season.

title: Courting the Next Generation of the Rich
description: ON most weekday afternoons, Jason Franklin is frenetically busy in his crowded office on West 38th Street in Manhattan, fielding calls or pushing projects forward as the executive director of Bolder Giving, a nonprofit organization that promotes philanthropy.

title: A Private Office on the Highway
description: AS the favored car customizer for many moguls and movie stars, Howard Becker fields plenty of unusual requests from exacting clients.

title: Off the Beaten Track and Away From the Crowd
description: MORE wealthy travelers are skipping packaged tours and choosing tailored trip itineraries that fit individual interests, needs, schedules  and even whims.

title: Parceling Out a Nest Egg, Without Emptying It
description: MANY people nearing the end of their working lives may have resigned themselves to cutting back in retirement. But for the affluent and the wealthy getting on in years, this is a time to figure out how much to spend so that they neither run out of money before they die or leave too much to their children when theyre gone. For the affluent, say, those who have accumulated a nest egg of $500,000 to $5 million, maybe even $10 million, the calculation is stark: how much should they budget to spend each year when they could live another 20, 30, perhaps 40 years?

title: Financial Survival in a Time of Fiscal Peril
description: BETWEEN now and the end of the year, investors who are paying even the slightest bit of attention to the news will hear the term fiscal cliff repeated so often that it will surely either strike fear into their hearts or numb them to possible risks ahead.

title: Falling Prey to the Dangerous Temptation to Cherry-Pick Polls
description: This post appears in Wednesdays paper. It is a revised version of a post that was published online Monday. The full version is here.

title: Time, Pen and Paper, and Now the Ear of the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  Kim Millbrook, an inmate at a federal prison in Pennsylvania, has 31 years of hard time on his hands. He has been using it to sue people.

title: Gritty Koreatown Block Turns Hot With a Taste of Home
description: When Ja-Bun Kwak opened Kang Suh, her two-level, 24-hour restaurant almost 30 years ago at the base of 1250 Broadway, at 32nd Street in Manhattan, there was just a spare handful of Korean businesses on the block catering to the Korean garment industry and import-export laborers.

title: Las Vegas Project Survives a Case of Bad Timing
description: LAS VEGAS  An $8.5 billion city within a city called CityCenter Las Vegas  built in this gambling towns heyday but opened after the recession had set in  continues to struggle, though it is benefiting from growing numbers of visitors to the area.

title: Second Presidential Debate Fact-Checks and Updates
description: President Obama and Mitt Romney square off on Tuesday night in Hempstead, N.Y., for the second of three presidential debates. Live coverage begins at 8 p.m. Eastern. The Times will be providing updates and analysis on our live dashboard. You can also follow along on Twitter @thecaucus, or follow our list of Times journalists covering the debate.

title: Trial Run
description: Richly hued matte lips graced many a model on the fall runways earlier this year, and now several beauty brands have introduced intensely pigmented liquid lipsticks. These bold shades have a lip-gloss-style wet application but dry within seconds into a velvety, glamorous-looking finish. Theyre meant to be long lasting and moisturizing at the same time, with only one coat. We put three new collections to the test.

title: Michael Namer
description: Mr. Namer, 58, is a founder and a principal of Alfa Development/Management, a New York company that specializes in residential and hospitality developments. Its projects include Chelsea Green and 151 Wooster Street, and it will soon begin construction on the Mott Hotel in NoLIta.

title: Despite Its Problems, Dodd-Frank Is Better Than the Alternatives
description: Repeal Dodd-Frank? It sounds so simple. But repealing the Dodd-Frank Act wont end too big to fail banks, and it may even make things worse.

title: High-Speed Trading Executives Shut Firm
description: A high-frequency trading firm founded less than two years ago by former Citigroup executives is ending operations as the industry confronts a slowdown.

title: N.Y.U. Law Plans Overhaul of Students Third Year
description: There is an old saying that in the first year of law school they scare you to death; in the second year, they work you to death; and in the third year, they bore you to death.

title: After a Bullet in the Head, Assaults on a Pakistani Schoolgirls Character Follow
description: Last Updated | Wednesday, 5:26 p.m. As a Pakistani schoolgirl who was shot in the head by Taliban militants last week fights for her life in a British hospital, a battle to tarnish her reputation is being waged on social networks and news sites in Pakistan.

title: Daughter of Mexican Drug Lord Detained in California, U.S. Says
description: MEXICO CITY  A daughter of Mexicos most-wanted drug lord is in custody in the United States after she tried to cross the border illegally into California to give birth in Los Angeles, an American law enforcement official said Tuesday.

title: China: Committee May Strip Bo of Immunity
description: Xinhua, the Chinese state news agency, has reported that the standing committee of the National Peoples Congress was scheduled to meet for four days next week to review a report on the qualifications of certain national delegates, which analysts say could mean stripping Bo Xilai, the senior politician, of his congress membership and immunity from prosecution. The review announced by Xinhua on Monday is to begin on Oct. 23; Mr. Bo was expelled from the party last month and is expected to stand trial on a wide range of criminal charges. Mr. Bo is a delegate to the congress, which gives him immunity from prosecution. A cancellation of his membership would pave the way for an indictment and a trial. Earlier, Wang Lijun, the former police chief of Chongqing and an associate of Mr. Bo, had his congress membership canceled before he was put on trial. Mr. Wang received a 15-year prison sentence in September for various crimes, including defection.

title: Georgia: Incoming Premier Favors Joining Russia Olympics
description: The incoming prime minister, Bidzina Ivanishvili, said Tuesday that Georgia should participate in the 2014 Winter Olympics in the Russian resort of Sochi. President Mikheil Saaakshvili, whose party was soundly defeated by Mr. Ivanishvilis coalition in this months parliamentary elections, has said he planned to boycott the games as an act of protest against Russia, whose troops have controlled two Georgian enclaves since a brief war in 2008. Mr. Ivanishvili promised, as part of his campaign, that he would work to improve relations with Russia, but he has also said he does not plan to abandon his predecessors course toward integrating Georgia into NATO, and indicated his warmth toward America by saying his first foreign trip will be to Washington.

title: John Hoffman, a Force in Energy Efficiency, Dies at 62
description: John Hoffman, who helped shape an international treaty in the 1980s to protect the ozone layer and later developed  the Energy Star program, a widely recognized government stamp of approval for energy-efficient products, died on Sept. 24 in Washington. He was 62.

title: New Jersey Sports Betting Law Spurs Move by N.C.A.A.
description: The N.C.A.A. is planning to relocate six championships from New Jersey, blaming a new state law there allowing sports betting on collegiate and professional games.

title: California: Money Found for Move of Duroville Residents
description: Riverside County and state officials reached a deal this week for the state to release $10 million to complete the court-ordered relocation of residents of a squalid trailer park on tribal land, known as Duroville, to a new housing development. The move had been in jeopardy because the state eliminated the agency that was financing the plan.

title: An Unlikely Cheddar Is Suddenly Boastful
description: STEVEN JENKINS, author of Cheese Primer, was visiting his mother on the coast of Alabama recently when he discovered a package of Cracker Barrel Cheddar in her refrigerator.

title: Murdoch Hears Critics as His Board Wins Election
description: For a second year in a row, Rupert Murdoch faced shareholder critics of his News Corporation at the companys annual meeting. And for a second year in a row their proposals for management changes were shot down.

title: Dismissal of Gun Suit Is Sought
description: The Justice Department has asked a federal court to dismiss a lawsuit by the House oversight committee seeking to compel the Obama administration to release more internal records involving the botched gun-trafficking case known as Operation Fast and Furious. The judiciary should play no role in a dispute like this one between the executive and legislative branches, the department said in a brief filed Monday night in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia. In this case, the White House has asserted executive privilege over its internal deliberations, and the House of Representatives has voted to hold Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. in contempt for refusing to comply with the committees demands.

title: Cholesterol Is Falling in Adults, Study Finds
description: Cholesterol levels in adults are falling, and changes in the amount of trans fats in the American diet may be part of the reason, new research suggests.

title: Will Privacy Go to the Dogs?

title: How to Score the Debate
description: I had to write this column before the presidential debate was finished, so I thought the most useful thing I could do is to offer the scoring system Ill be using to determine who did best. You can fill in your own scores. My system is not based on zingers or extra points for energizing the base, but rather on what I believe many Americans really want from the next president. You see, I believe this time is different  that many Americans understand something is very wrong, that we could go the way of Greece or Japan if we dont shape up, and that they will embrace a candidate who trusts them with the truth, that is, an honest diagnosis of where we are and how we get out of this mess. Up to now, neither candidate has been willing to do that.

Alvarez then placed the champions belt around the referees waist. In front of a capacity crowd here at MGM Grand Garden Arena, De La Hoya leaned toward Cortez and told him, Youre the champion. It was very touching, Cortez, 69, said. I will treasure it forever. When do you see a championship fighter say this to a ref?

title: Social Changes Age of Enlightenment
