description: N.F.L. teams usually see red when a penalty flag is thrown. This Sunday at MetLife Stadium, theyll see pink.

title: McNamara Memorabilia Goes for $1 Million at Auction
description: The personal memorabilia of Robert S. McNamara, secretary of defense during the Kennedy and Johnson administrations, was auctioned off at Sothebys on Tuesday and brought in just over $1 million, a Sothebys spokesman said. Timed to coincide with the 50th anniversary of the start of the Cuban missile crisis, in which McNamara played a crucial role, the sale  totaling $1,008,571  far exceeded the pre-auction estimate.

title: Republican Homes Bounce Back
description: The uneven recovery in home prices seems to be favoring Republican voters over Democratic ones.

title: A Cruise With Tee Times Is in Scotland and Ireland
description: While Windstar Cruises new golf fantasy may remain just that  a fantasy  to most of us, a few travelers can play five historic courses while cruising the coasts of Scotland and Ireland on a luxury yacht.

title: Hot Air | Dan Colens A Real Bronx Cheer
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Hard Decisions in the I.C.U.
description: Your relative has spent five days in a hospital intensive care unit, unable to breathe without a ventilator and incapable of making her own medical decisions. Because she appointed you her health care proxy, or simply because youre her closest relative, the choices about treatments  trying them or stopping them  fall to you.

title: In Contest for Rescue Robots, Darpa Offers $2 Million Prize
description: The Pentagons advanced research agency said on Wednesday that it will offer a prize of $2 million to the winners of a contest testing the performance of robots that could be used in emergencies like the Fukushima nuclear crisis in Japan.

title: Scene City: Starry Night for Gabrielles Angel Foundation
description: Kanye West, Kim Kardashian, Nelly, Ashanti and others light up annual gala.

title: The Many Moods of Mitt Romney
description: Gail Collins: David, can we discuss the Many Mitts today?

title: Candidates and Baseball Come in Second
description: YOU know the world has gone topsy-turvy when a single date with Kim Kardashian is valued at $15,000, while a weeklong retreat in Palm Springs, Calif., as the guest of Bill Clinton, including a tte--tte with him, goes for just $25,000.

title: Terrorism Suspect Threatens to Boycott His Trial
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  A Saudi man accused of helping to plotAl Qaedas attack on the destroyer Cole in 2000 told a military commission judge at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, on Wednesday that he would boycott his case if military guards forced him to wear chains as a condition of coming to court.

title: Dove and the Wolf for Tucker
description: The model Yuri Pleskun, and Paloma Gil and Louise Hayat-Camard of the band The Dove and the Wolf star in a video for Tuckers resort collection, set to their song Springtime.

title: This Week in the Global Arts Guide
description: The Sonderbund, a gathering of young German artists and art lovers, organized its third and last exhibition in Cologne in 1912, of more than 600 paintings and sculptures by 173 artists from the post-Impressionist and German Expressionist movements. Now, at the Wallraf-Richartz Museum & Fondation Corboud in that city, an exhibition called 1912  Mission Moderne: The Centennial Retrospective of the Sonderbund Exhibition, has 100 of the works from that 1912 show on display, including Vincent van Goghs 1890 painting Die Grabenden, shown here. Through Dec. 30.

title: Facebook Posts Largest Single-Day Gain
description: 5:03 p.m. | Updated with closing share price.

title: An Assortment of Food Links
description: The right to eat junk for lunch, or lets get vending machines out of schools.

title: How Bill Clinton May Have Hurt the Obama Campaign
description: When the histories of the 2012 campaign are written, much will be made of Bill Clintons re-emergence. His convention speech may well have marked the finest moment of President Obamas re-election campaign, and his ads on the presidents behalf were memorable.

title: Shifting Mood May End Blank Check for U.S. Security Efforts
description: WASHINGTON  Last week, a Bangladeshi student was charged in an F.B.I. sting operation with plotting to blow up the Federal Reserve Bank in New York. A Somali-American man was convicted of sending young recruits from Minneapolis to a terrorist group in Somalia. In Libya, extremists responsible for the killing of four Americans last month in Benghazi remained at large.

title: Mile 16: Where Runners Go Up, Up and Away
description: Funny thing, this marathon. We try to do everything right  the long runs, the speed workouts, the stretching  yet nothing fully braces us for the physical punishment and emotional test of race day.

title: For Older Parents, Expert Advice About Financial Aid
description: A financial aid expert is revisiting Booming on Wednesday to answer financial aid questions from older parents.

title: An Unspoken Risk of Vaginal Birth
description: As a writer, Im not timid about womens bodies. Ive covered teen sex, vibrators, and transvaginal ultrasounds, but vaginal tears are different. Its not a phrase that rolls easily off the tongue or out of the keyboard. Unlike many child-related topics, there is a strange moratorium on discussing the complications of vaginal births. Coverage of birth injuries are often buried under studies about the escalating rates of C-sections and the too posh to push women fueling them, as well as more progressive reports suggesting that if only women relaxed better, oiled better, breathed better, all births would be just grand.

title: Space Out: Modeling the Solar System
description: Overview | Space is enormous. How can we conceptualize the vast distances between objects in our solar system and beyond? In this lesson, students calculate the relative distances between planets in our solar system, build a model illustrating those distances to scale and compare the model with standard solar system illustrations. Note to teachers: Be prepared to extend this model throughout the school and the school grounds.

title: Apple Takes On Smaller Tablets
description: TimesCast Media+Tech: Apple reveals the iPad Mini. | David Pogue reviews the Microsoft Surface in 60 seconds. | The Mr. GIF artist collective.

title: Recent Spinal Shots May Pose Greatest Meningitis Risk
description: The more recently a patient received a spinal injection with the contaminated steroid implicated in a nationwide outbreak of fungal meningitis, the higher the risk of developing the disease, federal health officials are reporting.

title: Insights Into the Koalas Genetic Challenge
description: Scientists have long been aware that Australias beloved koala suffers from low genetic diversity. The assumption has been that this genetic flat line is relatively new, a result of the 19th-century fur trade, which nearly decimated the koala population before the species rebounded. But a study published this week in the journal BMC Genetics suggests that this low diversity predated the fur trade, meaning that whatever thinned the genetic soup may have occurred much further into the past.

title: What Obama Said About Immigration in His Off-the-Record Interview
description: Curious about what President Obama might say when he believes he is off the record and can therefore afford to be very blunt?

title: TimesCast Media + Tech: Apples Smaller Tablets
description: Apple reveals the iPad Mini. David Pogue reviews the Microsoft Surface in 60 seconds. The Mr. GIF artist collective.

title: For Regular Guys, a Look of Combat
description: WATCHING the fanfare that follows any new product announcement from Apple, like the one on Tuesday that included a smaller version of the iPad, the thought occurs that fashion designers are not doing enough to foster innovation in their field. People just dont seem to get as excited about a new pair of pants as they do a faster computer processor.

title: Fed Pledges to Maintain  Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve said Wednesday that it would continue its economic stimulus campaign, aimed at reducing unemployment, amid fresh evidence of a housing recovery that could help to bolster those efforts.

title: The Third-Party Debate
description: Few voters realized there was another presidential debate on Tuesday. Even fewer watched it. The biggest name there wasnt a politician, but the moderator, Larry King, who called the candidates Don Quixotes.

title: Warriors Choosing a Path to Relevance: Offense or Defense?
description: Whether it be jumping from the doldrums to playoff relevance, or from there to true contention, making a true leap in the N.B.A. requires that most everything go right. Its a delicate balancing act to achieve it and at least temporarily maintain it.

title: Another Notch in His Belt at Coach
description: TAKE a deep breath at the rail yards on the West Side of Manhattan. If you dont smell leather, youre not thinking like Reed Krakoff.

title: Past Forward: Paul Ryans Love of Cheese, Organics and the Green Bay Packers
Memorial to Roma Holocaust Victims Opens in Berlin
description: BERLIN  Germany paid tribute on Wednesday to the hundreds of thousands of Romany people killed in the Holocaust, opening a long-awaited place of remembrance for a minority still plagued by discrimination.

title: Scouting Report
description: OPENINGS

title: Russian Opposition Figure Says Abductors Threatened His Children
description: MOSCOW  A jailed Russian opposition leader who disappeared from Kiev, Ukraine, on Friday was held for three days by men who threatened to kill his children if he did not sign a lengthy confession, according to an interview published on Wednesday.

title: College Prices, Once Stable, Are Reportedly Up Again
description: The college prices that most students actually pay are going up again, after having been stable for several years, according to a report from the College Board.

title: Ai Weiwei Covers Gangnam Style Video
description: Last Updated | Thursday, 12:54 p.m. As my colleagues Jeff DelViscio and Shreeya Sinha reported last month, Gangnam Style, a music video by a South Korean rapper known as PSY with more than 530 million views on YouTube, has been remixed and redone by motivated fans around the globe. On Wednesday, Ai Weiwei, the Chinese dissident and artist, joined in, uploading his own cover version of the rap video to YouTube.

title: Social Neckwork
description: Climate change and shifting population patterns are not typically fashion fodder  which makes two new scarf collections all the more intriguing. For the latest Sportmax Carte Blanche collaboration, the creative consultant and Design Miami and Design Miami/Basel co-founder Ambra Medda tapped the illustrator Ying Wu, a Royal College of Art graduate whose work she discovered at the most recent Salone del Mobile in Milan. Wus silk foulards comment on the unforeseen side effects of unbridled economic growth, a phenomenon that the Chinese-born artist has experienced firsthand and frequently alludes to in her work. With their poster-art palette and Maurice Sendak-ish animal imagery, Wus scarves are highly decorative. But if you look closer, says Medda, you start to realize that there is a whole other dimension that brings you back to a starker reality. The limited-edition collection will be available at the Sportmax flagship store in Milan in January.

title: Taylor Swift and Nicki Minaj to Perform at American Music Awards
description: Taylor Swift, Nicki Minaj and the band Linkin Park will be the featured performers at the American Music Awards next month, organizers announced on Wednesday. All three acts are also nominated.

title: Jason Aldean Tops Billboard Album Chart
description: The country singer Jason Aldean has reached the top of the Billboard chart for the first time with his new album, Night Train (Broken Bow), which sold 409,000 copies in its first week out, according to the tracking service Nielsen SoundScan.

title: Behind the Poster: Halloween Returns
description: Austin Hinderliter saw his first Halloween movie when he was just 6. My parents didnt really crack down on that too much, he observed.

title: 36 Hours in New Haven, Conn.
description: IT wasnt long ago that New Haven was the poster child for the troubled college town, a place where the graduates of prep schools rubbed shoulders with the trauma of the mid-80s and early-90s crack epidemic. While New Havens hard luck reputation lingers, its no longer fully deserved. The citys historic center, which fans out around twin lawns planted with towering elms, maintains an old New England character, with neo-Gothic towers, well-aged dive bars and working-class neighborhoods of faded but elegant Victorian houses. While town and gown have worked to attract brand-name businesses to downtown (among them a new Apple Store and Shake Shack), New Haven remains complex and layered  a city of taco trucks and barbecue shacks as well as high-end clothiers and stylish cocktail lounges.

title: Illinois Debt Takes Toll, Study Finds
description: For years, Illinois has racked up billions in public debt to plug budget holes, pay overdue bills, and put money into its mismanaged pension funds. And for the people who live there, this has resulted in decrepit commuter trains and buses, thousands of unsound bridges, 200 hazardous dams and one of the most inequitable public school systems in America.

title: Taking Back Her Tweets
description: POOR Lena Dunham. Whether the 24-year-old creator of HBOs Girls is posting a photo of herself wearing a Muslim veil or cracking jokes, she cant catch a break on Twitter. She deleted the offending tweets, but that hasnt stopped others from judging.

title: New Sentence Is Imposed in Bomb Plot From 1999
description: SEATTLE  A terrorism case that predated the 9/11 attacks, but then became bound up by courts wrestling with the altered post-9/11 landscape of threat and deterrence, was back before a federal judge here on Wednesday. And the judge tried, for a third time, to impose a prison sentence that would stick.

title: Keeping Cash on Hand, Just in Case
description: Earlier this year, I joked in a post that interest rates were so low on savings accounts that it might make sense to store cash under your mattress  or at least somewhere safe in your home.

title: Excerpt: 'The Book Thief'
description: Mark Ulrich and Rae Gray in a scene from Heidi Stillmans stage adaptation of Markus Zusaks novel set in Germany during World War II.

title: Smithsonian to Auction Artifacts from H.H. Richardson House
description: The 19th-century Boston architect Henry Hobson Richardsons only major surviving work in Washington, D.C., a turreted 1888 townhouse designed for the farm machinery tycoon Benjamin H. Warder, has survived numerous demolition threats. Now chunks of it are coming on the market.

title: Posed to Turn Up the Volume
description: EVERY generation gets the shock art it deserves. Todays version is on display in a renovated garage on Crosby Street, just south of Houston.

title: Tom Cruise Sues Tabloids Over Claims He Abandoned His Daughter
description: 5:39 p.m. | Updated LOS ANGELESYou can pan his movies, write about his love life or question his involvement with Scientology. But youd better have the goods if youre going to call Tom Cruise a bad dad.

title: Buckyball Comes to Madison Square Park
description: Madison Square Park Conservancys Mad. Sq. Art program announces a new, monumental sculpture by world-renowned artist Leo Villareal.

title: Stone Links: Beauty in Our Time
description: Kant set the terms of modern aesthetics. In his hands, the field became centered on the study of aesthetic judgment, in particular, judgments of the beautiful and the sublime. But if its plausible to think that each eras aesthetic judgments take on more particularized forms, what might the defining aesthetic categories of our age be? This is Sianne Ngais question in her new book, Our Aesthetic Categories, reviewed by Rebecca Ariel Porte at LARB. Her tripartite answer: the zany, the cute and  most interesting  the interesting.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Oct. 25
description: The combination of shoe, sandal and boot is among the latest trends in footwear; Ace & Jigs cotton blanket coat will travel effortlessly; and other retail news.

title: Thursday Matchup: Buccaneers at Vikings
description: Buccaneers (2-4) at Vikings (5-2)

title: Oops! Can I Take Back That Earnings Release?
description: 4:21 p.m. | Updated

title: First Look: Buckyball in Madison Square Park
description: The artist Leo Villareal is installing a 30-foot tall, illuminated sculpture, titled Buckyball, in Madison Square Park. The piece, inspired by the work of Buckminster Fuller, is made up of 180 LED tubes arranged in a series of geometric shapes  the lights are designed to emit a variety of colors and dynamic sequences. Buckyball will make its official debut on Thursday and will be on display until Feb. 1.

title: The All-Star Center Is Officially Extinct
description: The notion of an All-Star center is officially defunct  at least on the ballots that determine N.B.A. All-Stars.

title: Cocktail Bodega
description: WHILE Cocktail Bodega is not the first bar to open at 11 a.m., it might be the first where the drink menu calls for it. This is not a spot for martinis, or for sparklers and tiki huts. It is, plainly, a juice and smoothie place where you can get whiskey with your flaxseed.

title: J.D. Power: Consumers Increase Their Use of Smartphones in Car Shopping
description: Consumers reliance on their smartphones to obtain information about new cars is growing, according to the 2012 Automotive Mobile Site Study, released Tuesday by J.D. Power and Associates, the market research company.

title: Even Beauty Items Face the Aging Process
description: SHOULD beauty products be stamped with expiration dates like cartons of milk, indicating how long they will last before turning?

title: Lawmakers Rated on Food and Farm Policy Votes
description: WASHINGTON  Members of Congress are used to having their votes graded. Dozens of interest groups, from the National Rifle Association to the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws, keep score, grading lawmakers on how they vote on issues ranging from gun control to legislation that would repeal laws that make marijuana use illegal.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Plus One? Ask Carefully

title: Ex-Goldman Director to Serve 2 Years in Insider Case
description: 9:37 p.m. | Updated

title: The Final Frenzy
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa  The 48-hour fly-around campaign marathon extravaganza, as President Obama called it, began today with his crowd-pleasing Romnesia routine and familiar pledges of more teachers and bridges.

title: In Pomerania, a Modern-Day Manor
description: A seven-bedroom property near Gdansk, built in 2011 to resemble a traditional Polish manor, is on the market for $2.5 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Poland
description: A CONTEMPORARY MANOR HOUSE NEAR GDANSKIN POMERANIA

title: Obamas Aura of Defeat
description: In an argument that was echoed and amplified around the liberal twittersphere yesterday, New Yorks Jonathan Chait made the case that the Romney campaign has bluffed the press into covering the last two weeks of the campaign as though Obamas losing. Like George W. Bush in 2000, who famously (and probably foolishly) campaigned in California to lend himself an air of inevitability in the closing days of the campaign, Team Romneys current brash confidence is designed to persuade the media to overlook the underlying numbers that still point to an advantage for the incumbent. And its working, Chait argues: The widespread perception that Romney is pulling ahead, he writes, is Romneys campaign suckering the press corps with a confidence game.

title: Beauty Spots
description: Eye shadow is often overlooked as a way to freshen a tired face. Toss one of these new palettes into your bag for a quick autumn pick-me-up.

title: An Energy Extravaganza
description: The special Energy section of The Times explores how the marketplace, Middle East politics and other factors are pushing President Obama and Mitt Romney to take some similar stances on the nations energy future.

title: After All, the Islanders Will Still Be on an Island
description: John Donne wrote that no man is an island. Two of New York Citys boroughs are (Manhattan and Staten Island), but not Brooklyn. So why would a hockey team called the Islanders keep its name when it moves there from an arena in Uniondale?

title: A Popular Twist on Putting Hair in Its Place
description: SOME Americans travel to Tokyo for omakase sushi or karaoke. But three years ago, a few members of the Goody marketing department went there for, according to the company, inspiration.

title: Champions League: Matchday 3(B)
description: With games on Matchday 3(A) of the group stage of the UEFA Champions League on Tuesday, we continue a new featurette in which we hope to bring Goal readers video of the best (and most important) goals of the day, courtesy of Fox Soccer.

title: Simon Keenlyside in 'The Tempest'
description: Simon Keenlyside as Prospero in Thomas Adss The Tempest at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Homes for $750,000
description: Properties in Minneapolis, New Orleans and on Lake Tahoe.

title: What You Get for ... $750,000
description: MINNEAPOLIS

title: Not Just Another Pretty Face
description: One of the four versions of The Scream made by Munch, which brought nearly $120 million at Sothebys in May, will be on view at the Museum of Modern Art, courtesy of its new mystery owner, for six months.

title: Zynga, Survival at Stake, Beats Forecasts
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Zynga is putting all its chips on a game called survival.

title: Obama Reminds Supporters About the 2000 Election
description: President Obama and his advisers are fond of reminding people just how close this election will be. Now they are putting those words into a new ad that reminds voters how the country could have taken a much different turn in 2000 had more of Al Gores supporters turned up at the polls.

title: Tax Policy Center in Spotlight for Its Romney Study
description: WASHINGTON  A small nonpartisan research center operated by professed geeks has found itself at the center of a rancorous $5 trillion debate between President Obama and Mitt Romney.

title: Seeking Love? Find Strength in Numbers
description: THE young, single women flocked to a dimly lighted wine bar in TriBeCa in their skinny jeans and stylish dresses. They were writers, lawyers and advertising types, among others, who were gathering for a most unusual how-to session, a primer of sorts on how to find love in the millennial age.

title: The Get | Frendss Taylor Headphones
description: I was standing in an electronics store when it dawned on me that almost every device for sale required headphones, says Keir Dillon, the former pro snowboarder and winter sports announcer who co-founded Frends, a fly mens audiowear line. Then I looked around and realized that at least half of the people in the store were women buying smartphones and tablets, and that not one single headphone on the headphone wall was refined or stylish. Nothing exuded luxury or hinted at grace. It was then that Dillon, who started Frends in Encinitas, Calif., with a group of fellow snowboarders in 2006, turned his focus to designing the Taylor, a cushy headset made of white lambskin and supersoft synthetic leather, finished with polished, gold-colored hardware. Named after the blues singer Koko Taylor, it is one of the brands three new womens styles. (The other two get their names from music greats as well; the Ella earbuds go out to Ms. Fitzgerald, and the Layla set is for the Eric Clapton song.) All will be available at Apple stores starting on Oct. 30. Says Dillon of the design process: We discovered techniques that were being used in other categories, like jewelry, and once we started thinking along those lines the possibilities became limitless. We hear that.

title: Treacherous Mother Nature, Out to Get Us All
description: WHEN the villain of a horror film is an ax-wielding maniac, the doomed victims can at least beg for mercy. Reasoning with Freddy Krueger may not get you very far, but you can pray he has a conscience somewhere. What makes eco-horror films  from the 1954 sci-fi classic Them! to Steven Soderberghs 2011 thriller Contagion   so terrifying is that the enemy is Mother Nature herself, and she is invariably merciless.

title: Cambodian Contemporary Arts to Be Showcased in New York Festival
description: By the time the genocidal Khmer Rouge regime finished filling the killing fields in Cambodia in the 1970s, more than 90 percent of the countrys artists and intellectuals had been wiped out. In recent years, Cambodias artistic community has slowly been rebuilding itself, and this coming spring some of the results will be on display in New York City at the Season of Cambodia festival. This gathering of more than 125 artists, performers and scholars will present Cambodian film, dance, visual art, shadow puppetry and more at venues all around the city, including the Guggenheim Museum, the Asia Society and the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The celebration is being hosted by Cambodian Living Arts, a nonprofit group based in Phnom Penh that was founded in 1998 by Arn Chorn-Pond, who survived the mass killings as a child and eventually came to the United States. When I first returned to Cambodia in the 90s after the Paris peace accord, my friends and I were finding master teachers living on the streets  poor, weak, without food and basic health care, said Mr. Chorn-Pond, whose work in rescuing these artists was detailed in the PBS documentary The Flute Player. The festival will run from April 6 through May 31, 2013.

title: A War of Words, Focused on One
description: In his new book about Americas most controversial dictionary, David Skinner refers to the lexicographer Noah Webster Jr.s belief that a common language could keep the nation politically and culturally united. If the Civil War had not proven him wrong, Mr. Skinner writes, the controversy over Websters Third certainly would have given him second thoughts.

title: Video: Tebow Is More Branding Than Scoring
description: Tim Tebow could be the Jets missing ingredient, but for now hes just another brand name, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Tim Tebow: More Branding Than Scoring
description: Tim Tebow could be the Jets missing ingredient, but for now all he is is another brand name, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Newly Released Books
description: Some characters in this months crop of new novels find love where others have looked before  on a city street, in the arms of a fan. Others strike out for new territory: A mom falls for fast food, a kid pines for an exotic animal, and a woman is devoted to her arms-dealer boss.

title: Gallerists to the People
description: ABOUT 90 minutes into a high-speed scouting expedition through the artists studios of Gowanus, Brooklyn, Alex Tryon paused. In a small subdivided studio taking part in an annual event known as the Gowanus Open Studios Tour, her eye fixed on some acrylic paintings of neon-colored plastic squirt guns. They had a weird presence, cheery but menacing.

title: New Laws Add a Divisive Component to Breast Screening
description: In a move that has irked medical groups and delighted patient advocates, states have begun passing laws requiring clinics that perform mammograms to tell patients whether they have something that many women have never even heard of: dense breast tissue.

title: Oct. 23: The Virtues and Vices of Election Prediction Markets
description: Tuesday featured what, on the surface, would seem to be a fairly neutral day of polling. Of the 11 national polls published on Tuesday, five showed President Obama ahead, four gave a lead to Mitt Romney and two had a tied race. On average among the polls, Mr. Romney led by 0.3 percentage points, the same as his average margin in the previous edition of the same polls.

title: The Caucus Click: Going Separate Ways
Offering Page Turners to the Design Crowd
description: Last year, Steven Kroeter started Designers & Books, a Web site that asks design industry notables to share the titles that have inspired them. On the one hand you can go to TED and spend four days and whatever that costs, Mr. Kroeter said. Or you can get a book list from people you really respect and read.

title: The Better to Hear You With
description: The Ear sofa by the Montreal design firm St Ely for Lerival is a clean-lined, contemporary sectional piece with a twist  or, more specifically, a set of folds. The top corners of each modular piece tilt inward, creating a backrest that supports different seating positions. You can change your angle when youre talking with someone, said Hubert Pelletier, an architect who runs St Ely with the industrial designer Eugnie Manseau. It may be subtle, but it also creates a sense of envelopment.

title: Our Man in Jaipur
description: John Robshaw Prints, published this month by Chronicle Books ($40), is as much a travel memoir as an overview of the textile designers career thus far.

title: Light My Fire
description: Chris Lehrecke is no ones idea of a dainty designer; he makes furniture with solid presences and prices to match. But now hes designing in miniature. Speaking of the knobby shapes of his new candlesticks, which come in three styles and a choice of five woods, he noted that they look reminiscent of other things Ive done. (Peppermills were also an inspiration.)

title: Everything but the Kitchen Sink
description: West Elm opened its first New York store almost 10 years ago and, to the surprise of many, it was in Dumbo, Brooklyn, not Manhattan. The neighborhood was auspicious enough to serve as the site of the West Elm Market, a new venture the company says will give customers a total home tool kit for the kitchen, garden, home repair and personal care.

title: Sales at BoConcepts, Judy Ross Textiles and Others
description: This Saturday, Oct. 27, BoConcepts will offer up to 70 percent off its warehouse goods (the Serena high-back dining chair in black leather, regularly $149, will be $69); 20 Pulaski Street, Bayonne, N.J.; (201) 433-4461.

title: 2 Convicted in Cabbys Death Are Freed After a Long Fight
description: More than 17 years after they were imprisoned for a murder they have long said they did not commit, Eric Glisson and Cathy Watkins walked free on Wednesday outside the Bronx County Hall of Justice, prompting an emotional scene there and ending a chapter in what may come to be seen as an extraordinary breakdown in criminal justice.

title: One Ring, Right Under Your Nose
description: The next time someone says there are no sure things in life, just point to the Big Apple Circus. This company, now in its 35th year, has been consistently inspired, at least since I first saw it some 20 years ago. And its newest offering, Legendarium, isnt about to break that long, superb streak.

title: Richard Mourdock on Gods Intentions
description: Try as they might to present a centrist image for Mitt Romneys sake, social issue zealots running on the Republican ticket cant seem to contain themselves. The latest to articulate his extremism on abortion is Richard Mourdock, a candidate for the U.S. Senate in Indiana who said during a debate Tuesday that even if life begins in that horrible situation of rape, that is something that God intended to happen. In the ensuing uproar, Mr. Mourdock was quick to apologize without offering a retraction. But Mr. Romneys camp was even quicker. They instantly denounced the comment.

title: In Web Search, Be Efficient in the Terms You Use
description: By this point in the Internet era, everyone should know how to find information on the Web with a search engine like Google or Bing.

title: A 1940s Brooklyn Team, on Home Ice in Manhattan
description: The Brooklyn Americans, major league hockeys sole foray into the borough before the announcement on Wednesday of the semi-imminent arrival of the New York Islanders, were many things during their brief existence.

title: Sensing Saturation, Ohio House Candidate Cancels Advertising Buy
description: Sensing that the target audience has reached its limits, Representative Jim Renacci of Ohio has canceled $850,000 in advertisement reservations for the final days of his campaign for re-election, going dark on network television as one of the most expensive House races draws to a close.

title: Retrieving the Weather of the Past
description: For many years now, volunteers working from home people like you&#8212 have been able to help scientists with important problems.

title: A Mass to Console in Troubled Times Like Haydns, Like Ours
description: Haydns Mass for Troubled Times seems a fitting work for these tense pre-election weeks. Also known as the Lord Nelson Mass, Haydn wrote it in 1798 shortly after Horatio Nelson defeated Napoleon at the Battle of the Nile. Haydn composed the work without winds, since Nikolaus II, Prince Esterhazy, his patron, had dismissed the wind players in the court retinue because of financial woes.

title: Knocking at the Gate of Heaven
description: Who could blame him for wanting to prolong the moment? Yannick Nzet-Sguin, having just concluded a heaven-storming performance of Verdis Requiem with the Philadelphia Orchestra and the Westminster Symphonic Choir on Tuesday evening in his Carnegie Hall debut, held the silence long enough for dramatic effect, and longer ... much longer.

title: Into the Dawn of New Ideas
description: As names for new ballet companies go, Ballet Next is optimistic. Ambiguous too. Does it suggest that here is the next stage for ballet itself? Or simply that this is the next stage for the artists involved?

title: The Book Thief Receives a New Life on the Stage
description: CHICAGO  At home in Sydney, Australia, a few years ago Markus Zusak had a hard time believing anyone would read his forthcoming novel, The Book Thief.

title: In Democratic Stronghold, Ryan Puts Focus on Poverty
description: Extending the Republican tickets lean toward the middle, Representative Paul D. Ryan expressed compassion for Americans in poverty and laid out a vision for fixing the broken engine of upward mobility.

title: Shopping for Doorknobs
description: Gil Schafer, a New York architect who specializes in historical renovations, goes shopping for different kinds of doorknobs that work for different kinds of rooms.

title: Philharmonic Extends Gilberts Reign
description: The New York Philharmonic has extended the contract of its music director, Alan Gilbert, for three years, keeping him at the helm through at least the 2016-17 season, the orchestra said on Wednesday.

title: Changing Course at a Fork in the Show
description: In the slightly more than 20 years that Chan Marshall has been performing as Cat Power, putting her ruminative, wandering, mostly bridgeless songs in front of various kinds of bands, there have been good and bad nights.

title: Mediator Resigns in Dallas Tower Dispute
description: The mediator assigned to help resolve a dispute between the Nasher Sculpture Center in Dallas and owners of the nearby Museum Tower, above, resigned on Wednesday. The tower, the center contends, sends excessive light into the Nasher galleries, designed by Renzo Piano, damaging plants in a garden and bothering visitors with glare. The Dallas Morning News reported that the mediator, Tom Luce, resigned via an e-mail to Richard Tettamant, the administrator of the Dallas Police and Fire Pension System, the towers owner. Recent events have made clear that the conditions and spirit under which I agreed to serve to help find a mutually beneficial solution for all parties are not being adhered to by you, Mr. Luce wrote. This saddens me, because I believe this is such an important issue for our city as a whole together with the financial future for our wonderful police and fireman. From the sideline I will be hoping this situation can be mutually resolved. Mr. Luce, who did not return calls seeking comment, was apparently frustrated by what he saw as the pension funds violation of an embargo against the parties talking publicly about the negotiations.

title: Doorknobs
description: GIL SCHAFER is a New York architect who specializes in historical renovations and new houses that look like old houses, he said. He is also a self-described hardware nut who invests a lot of time trying to find just the right hardware to complete each project.

title: Girardi Addresses His Growing To-Do List
description: As he does after every season, Yankees Manager Joe Girardi took a few days to decompress. He has not yet spoken with Andy Pettitte, who is mulling retirement. Nor has he spoken with Alex Rodriguez, whose postseason deteriorated into a series of embarrassing moments in which he was benched for entire games or withdrawn from the lineup for a pinch-hitter.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Would an outdoor hot tub increase the resale value of my home?

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Short-Lived Success, and Crowdsourcing Iceland
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently.See more here.

title: Things He Saw: Jason Polans Journey Across the North
description: The artist Jason Polan loves road trips. Followers of his weekly online column for The Times,Things I Saw,are already familiar with his whimsical drawings from his excursions around New York and other parts of the country. But now they can see his first collection of photographs when Parts & Labor Bookspublishes The Land Can Handle It later this week.

title: How Smart Is That Phone? Apps Unveil the Tricks
description: I confess to being one of those never reads the manual people, mainly because of impatience. This is true for nearly everything from Ikea furniture to the mystical script in the instructions for my robot vacuum cleaner. For folks like me, the arrival of touch-screen smartphones was a dream because theyre meant to be incredibly easy to use. I can pick one up and understand it instantly.

title: Cavendish Invitational Tournament in Monaco
description: There was an entry of 58 pairs for the Cavendish event in Monaco, which ended on Friday.

title: Romney Testimony in Divorce Case Subject of Court Fight
description: Gloria Allred, the media-savvy lawyer known for representing beleaguered women, showed up at a Canton, Mass., courthouse on Wednesday with booklets full of testimony by Mitt Romney in a 1991 divorce case.

title: Big Apple Circus
description: Legendarium comes to Damrosch Park at Lincoln Center.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza, Libya, West Bank and South Africa.

title: Ocwen Wins ResCap Assets With $3 Billion Bid
description: A group led by Ocwen Financial won the race for Residential Capitals loan servicing platform on Wednesday, bidding $3 billion for the bankrupt mortgage lenders assets.

title: Shoppers Roam Where Giants Once Did
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A couple of people walked into an Office Depot here last week and asked to use it as part of a scavenger hunt competition. They wanted to know if it would be all right if contestants, indulging their inner Willie Mays, ran into the store and slid on the floor where the Giants home plate used to be.

title: Romney Plans Economic Speech in Iowa
description: Mitt Romney plans to deliver a closing speech framing the economic choice facing voters during a campaign visit to Ames, Iowa, on Friday, a top adviser to Mr. Romneys presidential campaign said on Wednesday.

title: Redskins Unimpressed by Giants Game-Winning Touchdown
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Most analysts raved about Eli Mannings late-game prowess after his in-stride 77-yard bomb to Victor Cruz with 1 minute 13 seconds left rallied the Giants to a 27-23 victory over Washington last Sunday. Redskins cornerback DeAngelo Hall does not appear to be as impressed.

title: Why Are States So Red and Blue?
World Series Game 1 Highlights and Analysis
Former Assistant Principal Penalized for Missing Work to Go to Second Job
description: A former assistant principal at a Brooklyn public school was penalized for leaving work early or not showing up on 32 occasions while she worked a second job, the citys Conflicts of Interest Board announced on Wednesday.

title: What Equality Sounds Like
description: DENVER  It went by quickly, but President Obama got a big roar from the crowds at both his rallies today when he mentioned equality for gay people.That used to be the kind of thing that politicians talked about in small settings, not in mass get-out-the-vote gatherings, like the one here in City Park Wednesday afternoon. The usual calculation was that it could alienate more voters than it attracted, so why take the risk? But the calculation has changed for the better.

title: E-Mails Offer Glimpse at What U.S. Knew in First Hours After Attack in Libya
description: WASHINGTON  A series of three leaked e-mails sent by State Department officials beginning shortly after the fatal attack began on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, last month  including one that alerted the White House Situation Room that a militant group had claimed responsibility for it  stirred new debate on Wednesday about the Obama administrations shifting positions on the cause of the attack.

title: Libyan Forces Now Control Restive Town, Officials Say
description: CAIRO  Officials in Libya said on Wednesday that government forces had taken control of the western town of Bani Walid, after a deadly assault that lasted almost a week and led to accusations that the countrys new government was using indiscriminate force to punish a restive city.

title: Iran Reports Arresting 50 on Money Trading Violations
description: Fifty people in Iran have been arrested on money trading violations since a crackdown on foreign-exchange dealings linked to the plunging value of Irans currency provoked a riot and antigovernment demonstration in Tehran three weeks ago, the countrys intelligence minister said Wednesday.

title: Embedded With the Syrian Army
description: Janine di Giovanni, a Times contributing reporter, gets a rare glimpse at the grinding urban warfare in Homs, Syria.

title: Amid Cutbacks, Greek Doctors Offer Message to Poor: You Are Not Alone
description: ATHENS  As the head of Greeces largest oncology department, Dr. Kostas Syrigos thought he had seen everything. But nothing prepared him for Elena, an unemployed woman whose breast cancer had been diagnosed a year before she came to him.

title: Figuring Out Windows 8, for Better or Worse
description: To the Editor:

title: Political Polls: Influential, Imperfect and Everywhere
description: To the Editor:

title: Lyrical About Elyria: A Teachers Lesson
description: To the Editor:

title: Windows, Revamped and Split in 2
description: This may be the biggest week in Microsofts 37-year history. The company is releasing its very first computer (the Surface tablet), a new phone operating system (Windows Phone 8), and, believe it or not, two PC operating systems.

title: Europes Top Health Official Quits, and the Bloc Has a Mystery on Its Hands
description: BRUSSELS  The top health official for the European Union suddenly resigns. His plans to place marketing curbs on tobacco companies are put aside. The offices of antitobacco groups are burglarized. There is talk of cash payments of tens of millions of dollars by Big Tobacco.

title: Spies and Co.
description: Washington

title: Feigning Free Speech on Campus
description: Philadelphia

title: Michelle Obama Debuts in Spanish-Language Ad
description: In yet another sign of how important the Hispanic vote is to the Obama campaign, Michelle Obamas first ad is aimed at Latino communities in swing states.

title: Things I Saw  No. 38
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: The Health Care Plans of the Candidates
description: To the Editor:

title: Amend the Constitution to Limit Political Spending?
2016 Copa Amrica in the U.S.
description: 5:26 p.m. |Update

title: Bleary-Eyed Troops Fight a Building at a Time in Syria
description: HOMS, Syria  For more than 24 hours, President Bashar al-Assads soldiers fought their way through this city, bleary-eyed men, worn down by months of combat. Afraid to go into the streets, where snipers pick their targets, the government men snaked their way through mouse holes punched in walls of blown-out buildings. Their goal was to retake one building, just one, a former school controlled by the rebel Free Syrian Army.

title: Downtrodden Islanders Moving in Name Only
description: Brooklyn giveth and Brooklyn taketh away.

title: Paul Ryans Poverty Play
description: Paul Ryan gave a speech on poverty and economic mobility.

title: Longtime Brand Consultant Sheds the Label of Retiree
description: A LONGTIME leader in brand and corporate identity consulting is rejoining the field, starting an agency soon after leaving the one he helped found 43 years ago.

title: California: Gunman Sought in Shooting of 5 People
description: Three people were killed and two more injured in a pair of shootings on Wednesday in Downey, south of Los Angeles. Dean Milligan, a Downey police lieutenant, said investigators believed all of the victims were members of the same family. Police responded just after 11 a.m. to a 911 call reporting gunshots at a fire safety business where officers discovered three people who had been shot, two of whom later died. Minutes later, a call was made from a residence where two more people had been shot, one fatally. One of the victims at the residence said the gunman fled in a car owned by the family, Lt. Milligan said. The gunmans identity was unknown.

title: Georgia: Prayer Leader Killed During Service
description: A 52-year-old man was arrested on Wednesday in connection with the fatal shooting of a prayer service leader at a suburban Atlanta megachurch. The authorities said the suspect, Floyd Palmer, a former church maintenance worker, opened fire in the chapel on Wednesday morning, killing Greg McDowell, 39. The church, the World Changers Church International in College Park, is led by the Rev. Creflo Dollar, a televangelist, and says it has 30,000 members. Mr. Dollar was not at the church during the shooting and no one else was injured. Mr. Palmer was arrested at a mall in Atlanta five hours later, the United States Marshals Service said.

title: Wall Street Leaders Peer Into Economic Gloom
description: Uncertainty seems to be the reigning theme on Wall Street these days. Just from looking at recent earnings reports, it is clear that executives are contending with a world that is not easy to figure out.

title: Wilhelm Brasse Dies at 94; Documented Nazis Victims
description: There were images of living virtual skeletons; of prisoners standing shoulder-to-shoulder in striped uniforms; of people with deformities; of disemboweled victims of purported medical experiments.

title: From Catchers Crouch to Dugouts Top Step
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Blogger Facing Sanction Quits Mormon Church
description: A Mormon who edits a Web site critical of his church said he was resigning from the church rather than face a hearing that could lead to his excommunication. The editor, David Twede of the Web site MormonThink, was told in September by his bishop that he was being called to a church trial. Mr. Twede had posted articles on several Web sites criticizing Mormon beliefs and Mitt Romney, who is a Mormon.

title: League Gives Union the Silent Treatment
description: At the Barclays Center news conference announcing the Islanders move to Brooklyn in 2015, Commissioner Gary Bettman was asked whether the league would agree to meet with the Players Association after the union offered Tuesday night to resume negotiations.

title: Courts Split Decision Provides Little Clarity on Surrogacy
description: Unable to conceive, the New Jersey couple did what an increasing number of 21st-century parents have done: they got an egg from an anonymous donor, and made an agreement with another woman to carry the child for them.

title: Jeff Blatnick, 55, Dies; Won Olympic Gold in Wrestling
description: Jeff Blatnick, who overcame cancer to win a gold medal for the United States in Greco-Roman wrestling at the 1984 Olympics, died on Wednesday in Schenectady, N.Y. He was 55.

title: Kentuckys Egregious Death Penalty
description: The Kentucky Commission on Human Rights voted unanimously last week to recommend that the state abolish the death penalty. There is every reason for Kentucky to take the advice and become the 18th state to prohibit capital punishment.

title: Betty Binns Fletcher Dies at 89; Liberal Stalwart on the Bench
description: Betty Binns Fletcher, a federal appeals court judge whose liberal record inspired conservative opposition in the Senate when her son was named to serve alongside her on the same Western court, died on Monday in Seattle. She was 89.

title: Connecticut Smack-Down
description: Waterbury, Conn.

title: Romneys Economic Model
description: Mitt Romneys best argument on the campaign trail has been simple: Under President Obama, the American economy has remained excruciatingly weak, far underperforming the White Houses own projections.

title: Student Debt Debacles
description: Students who finance their educations through private lenders often wrongly assume that private and federal loans work the same way. In fact, they do not.

title: F.D.R.s Vision, Remembered in Stone
description: The upbeat tune identified with President Franklin Delano Roosevelt  Happy Days Are Here Again  wafted across the citys waters at the recent dedication of the stunning F.D.R. memorial honoring his vision of a world founded on four essential freedoms, articulated during World War II. A bell tolled as the four were cited  freedoms of speech and worship and freedoms from want and fear  at the new four-acre park gleaming at the southern tip of Roosevelt Island.

title: The Money Trail in Illinois
description: The Eighth Congressional District of Illinois, in Chicagos northwest suburbs, is not the only example of this years post-Citizens-United-attack-ad wasteland. But its a good one. Representative Joe Walsh, a Republican freshman congressman known for legislation like the Save Christmas Act and for shooting off his mouth, is battling Tammy Duckworth, a Democrat and war veteran, in a race that stands out for its saturating quantities of rancor, negativity and outside cash.

title: A Team by Any Other Name May Be Less Confusing
description: Residents of Brooklyn have been called many things over the years: thugs, hopeless nostalgists, heavily accented bigots, and, much more recently, hipsters and arrivistes.

title: British Parliament Questions Former BBC Chiefs Role
description: LONDON  In the growing storm surrounding the BBCs handling of an investigation of child sexual abuse accusations against one of its longtime television hosts, the networks current director general has largely stood as the public face of the revered institution, enduring heated inquiries from Parliament and the stinging outrage of viewers.

title: A House of Horror Films
description: This illustration depicts some key features of the haunted house, drawn from classic horror films. Can you identify a movie for each?

title: Romney Is Upbeat, but Math Is the Same
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Mitt Romney is savoring the energy surrounding his candidacy, talking with rising confidence about his ability to overtake President Obama in the closing days of the race.

title: Arrest of Brazil Financier Puts Focus on Small Banks
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazilian authorities have arrested the chief executive of a bank engulfed in an accounting scandal and detained him in prison, a rare step that has focused attention on the weaknesses emerging among an increasing number of small banks there.

title: Panthers Look to Newton to Turn Things Around
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The sharply managed marketing of Cam Newton has been under way for a while, with a stylish cover shot for GQ last summer, a deal with Under Armour and a recently announced clothing line available only at Belk department stores, a Southern chain.

title: Politics Can Be a Dirty Business. And Then There Are House Races in Florida ...
description: MIAMI  In an election year awash with partisan fury, Florida can lay claim to some of the nastiest and most personal House battles in the country.

title: A Conscientious Driver, a Gunman and a Fatal Encounter on L.I.
description: The phone call came from his daughter, bursting with news that she could not wait to share.

title: Rematch Against Cowboys Has the Giants Attention
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The sight of the star on the helmet is enough to energize Giants Coach Tom Coughlin as he prepares for Sundays game at Dallas.

title: Basic Instruction
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Back in the day, kids, I was the very proud owner of an original generation Nintendo GameBoy. I was already an adult when it came out, but it was the coolest thing I had ever seen, so I indulged myself. Now, of course, you can play games on a device that is the size and weight of a postage stamp  bless your young and non-myopic eyes  but in the 1980s, if you were one of the cool kids, you lugged around a gaming device that both resembled and had approximately the same-quality graphics as a beige brick.

title: Memories Stirred at the Selling of Mothers Home
description: Has Faye Dunaway ever looked more gorgeous than she did in Bonnie and Clyde? Well, perhaps an argument could be made that she was yet more ravishing in The Thomas Crown Affair.

title: Corrections: October 25, 2012
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Target of Ryan in Preseason, and of Sanchez Now
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Rex Ryan likes Jeremy Kerley a lot more now than he did two months ago, when Santonio Holmes was still expected to play a full season and Kerley seemed to take forever to recover from a hamstring injury at training camp.

title: A Home Not Built for Two
description: The Barclays Center, with about 18,000 seats for the Nets, is not ideally suited for the Islanders.

title: Capsized Franchise Has Only Sunk Further Into Despair
description: For many Islanders fans, the good old days are painfully difficult to remember not because they were not good but because the team that won four straight Stanley Cups in the 1980s has morphed into a derelict franchise that has alienated all but its most die-hard followers.

title: An Owner With Some Eyebrow-Raising Moves
description: On the day he elevated Garth Snow from backup goaltender to general manager in 2006, Charles B. Wang, the Islanders owner, conceded that the move was unorthodox but said that much of his business career had been based on doing things differently.

title: No Rest for the Eerie
description: ITS surprising that American audiences still get a thrill from seeing a haunted house on screen. Hasnt the subprime crisis, with its predatory lending and underwater mortgages, caused enough real-life home-related terror in the last few years?

title: Rangers Have No Reason to Worry About the Box Office
description: The Rangers should not be worried when the Islanders move a borough away from Madison Square Garden in 2015.

title: In Albany, Honoring Producers of Alcohol
description: ALBANY  The state capital has seen its share of drinking over the years. But rarely has the imbibing had such an imprimatur as on Wednesday, when Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo held a summit meeting devoted to alcohol.

title: New Hope and Fresh Paint for Synagogue in Queens
description: Twenty years ago, it seemed that Congregation Tifereth Israel in Corona, thought to be the oldest synagogue in Queens, was headed for a date with a wrecking ball. Its Ashkenazi Jewish congregation  whose early members included the teenager who would become Este Lauder  had dwindled to just a few. The wooden building, coated in 1929 with an unfortunate blanket of stucco, was in disrepair.

title: Despair and Triumph of a Soldier and Player
description: The stories of baseball players who left the game to go to war often focus on what they lost by being away. Ted Williams and Willie Mays forfeited a shot at challenging Babe Ruths record of 714 home runs. Bob Feller, the greatest pitcher of his era, lost his chance at 300 victories.

title: A South Jersey Town Grieves After a Girls Murder
description: CLAYTON, N.J.  For all of its real-world brutality  a young girl strangled, her body stashed in a southern New Jersey trash bin  the death of Autumn Pasquale this week also cast a shadow in the virtual world.

title: Crucial Subset: Female Voters Still Deciding
description: DERRY, N.H.  Emmakate Paris was a one-woman tornado the other day, whipping through the racks at the thrift shop here, hunting for clothes for her children and one special item for herself: a green suit. For Halloween, she wants to dress up as Tippi Hedren in the Hitchcock movie The Birds.

title: The Womens Vote
description: Female voters in the swing state of New Hampshire discuss what issues are foremost in their minds in the closing days of the presidential campaign.

title: N.B.A. Alters Ballot
description: The notion of an All-Star center is officially defunct  at least on the ballot that determines N.B.A. All-Stars. The N.B.A., bowing to new realities in a multi-positional era, has eliminated center from its All-Star ballots for the 2012-13 season. Instead, fans will vote for three frontcourt players and two guards. More at nytimes.com/sports.

title: Prison May Be the Next Stop on a Gold Currency Journey
description: MALIBU, Calif.  High above the cliff tops and the beach bars, up a winding mountain road, in a borrowed house on someone elses ranch, an unusual criminal is waiting for his fate.

title: Vatican: Diverse List of New Cardinals
description: Pope Benedict XVI named six new cardinals on Wednesday, including Archbishop James Harvey, an American who heads the papal household that employed the popes former butler, who was convicted this month of stealing private documents and leaking them to the press. The new cardinals, who are expected to be appointed at a Vatican ceremony next month, are all younger than 80 and therefore eligible to vote in the conclave that elects new popes. Benedict was criticized in February for appointing too many Europeans, especially Italians, as cardinals. Two of the cardinals-elect named Wednesday are from countries with large Muslim populations: Lebanon and Nigeria. The others are from Colombia, the Philippines and India.

title: Spotlight Put on Founders of Drug Firm in Outbreak
description: A $4.2 million, four-bedroom Boston penthouse overlooking the Charles River in the Back Bay neighborhood. A $3.5 million home in Southborough, Mass., with more than 11,000 square feet, a home theater and an indoor saltwater pool. A $2.35 million vacation home on Cape Cod.

title: China Slows Development of Nuclear Power Plants
description: HONG KONG  Still responding to the partial meltdowns last year at nuclear reactors in Fukushima, Japan, the Chinese government has lowered its target for the construction of nuclear power plants by 2015, notably by not building more nuclear reactors at inland locations.

title: Knicks Beats Nets on Night When Everything Seems Off
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  When next they meet, the Nets and Knicks will be in Brooklyn, playing in the Nets new $1 billion palace, presumably before a pro-Brooklyn crowd, in a game with tangible stakes. The basketball should be a little crisper, too.

title: Reids Machine Powers Obama in Nevada Test
description: LAS VEGAS  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. sat onstage before a crowd of culinary workers here the other morning, listening intently to a man who is not on the ballot but might hold the key to a victory for President Obama in economically ravaged Nevada.

title: Shot After Interrupting a Robbery, an Off-Duty Officer Kills a Suspect
description: An off-duty New York City police officer was shot in the chest on Wednesday evening after interrupting a robbery on a Bronx street, but he continued to pursue three fleeing suspects, fatally shooting one of them, the authorities said.

title: Man Rejects Plea and Release, Choosing Trial in His Babys Death
description: Li Hangbins face betrayed no emotion, and he never looked at his common-law wife and supporters in the courtroom as he faced the bench in State Supreme Court in Queens on Wednesday and was pressed by Justice Richard L. Buchter on the decision now before him.

title: Lottery Numbers
World Series Replay: Game 1
description: The San Francisco Giants beat the Detroit Tigers, 8-3, in Game 1 of the World Series.

title: Man Beaten by Police at Jewish Youth Center Describes Encounter
description: The memory of being rousted from sleep and beaten by two officers in a Jewish youth center in Brooklyn remains somewhat cloudy for Ehud Halevy, even though the interaction, recorded by a surveillance camera, has been seen numerous times on television and the Internet.

title: Why Am I Still on Crutches?
description: The thwack of ball and bat. The boing of birdie and racket. The  ouch! What was that?!

title: In N.A.S.L., Minnesota on Road to Another Title, and Perhaps Oblivion
description: In what sport, in what universe, could a team potentially win its second consecutive league title and then turn out the lights  for good?

title: Colorado: Teenager Held in 10-Year-Old Girls Killing
description: A 17-year-old community college student was arrested Tuesday night in the kidnapping and murder of Jessica Ridgeway, 10, who disappeared this month while walking to school. The police in the Denver suburb of Westminster identified the suspect on Wednesday as Austin Reed Sigg, and an arrest report indicated that he lived about one and a half miles from where Jessica was kidnapped. The arrest report described Mr. Sigg as cooperative, and The Associated Press quoted Mr. Siggs mother as saying that he had turned himself in to the police.

title: Why Women Cant Do Pull-Ups
description: This column appears in the Oct. 28 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: Insurance Institute Awards Highest Rating to a Record Number of Booster Seats
description: Of 17 new-for-2012 booster seats identified by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, 15 received the organizations top rating of Best Bet. Accounting for previously evaluated models on the market, the latest evaluation brings the total of Best Bet boosters to 47.

title: Panel Says Medtronic Edited Product Studies
description: Officials of Medtronic, the medical device maker, edited studies by outside researchers about a controversial spine treatment sold by the company, inserting claims that their product was superior to a competing one, according to a Senate finance committee report released Thursday.

description: lien \len, le-n\ noun

title: Down Goes Chandler
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  The entire Knicks bench felt uneasy. The reserves rose to their feet after Tyson Chandler, the teams defensive leader, went down and started grimacing when he looked at his leg. A single minute hadnt gone off the clock in the Knicks preseason game with the Brooklyn Nets, a 97-95 overtime victory at Nassau Coliseum, when Chandler bumped knees with the Nets Gerald Wallace while trying to establish a pick.

title: Study Says Gender Gap in Pay Starts Early
description: The pay gap between educated women and men begins as soon as they start their careers, a new study shows. The study, released on Wednesday by the American Association of University Women, found that in 2009, women who had graduated college a year earlier and worked full time were paid 82 percent as much as their male counterparts, a slight improvement from the 80 percent a similar study found in 2001. The pay gap has often been attributed to women entering lower-paying professions, but the study found that a difference persisted even after controlling for that factor.

title: Sandoval Lifts Giants, Into the Stands
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is brief and illustrious, the list of baseball players who have hit three home runs during a World Series game: Albert Pujols, Reggie Jackson and Babe Ruth, who achieved the feat twice.

title: A Landslide for Obama (If the World Got to Vote)
description: HONG KONG  If the rest of the world got to vote, President Obama apparently would be re-elected in a landslide.

title: Chester Hansen, a Rare Diarist of World War II, Dies at 95
description: Before dawn on June 6, 1944, as the cruiser Augusta headed toward the coast of Normandy, Chester Hansen was up and, as always, at the side of Gen. Omar N. Bradley. And as always, Mr. Hansen, a journalist by training and a top aide to Bradley, made notes in his diary:

title: Islanders Timeline: From Expansion to Dynasty to Disaster
description: 1972 To head off a potential rival league, the N.H.L. awards New York a second team, the Islanders. William Shea, who helped bring the Mets to New York as an expansion team 10 years earlier, does the same with the Islanders. Roy Boe, the owner of the Nets, purchases the team. It goes 12-60-6 in the 1972-73 season.

title: Executed Texans Family Seeks Pardon
description: Two decades after a Texas man was convicted of murdering his three young daughters by setting his own house on fire, and eight years after a campaign to prove his innocence failed to stop his execution, his family petitioned on Wednesday for a posthumous pardon.

title: Rape Remark Jolts a Senate Race, and the Presidential One, Too
description: WASHINGTON  The incendiary topic of rape and abortion re-entered the 2012 campaign Wednesday and threatened to singe Mitt Romney after an Indiana Senate candidates comments that pregnancies conceived by rape should not be aborted because God intended conception to happen.

title: Russia: Three Militants Said to Be Killed
description: Russias police and security services said Wednesday that they had killed three Islamic militants suspected of organizing back-to-back attacks in July that wounded the chief mufti of Kazan, a city in the Republic of Tatarstan, and killed another local Muslim leader who had spoken out against religious radicalism. As the officers tried to arrest the militants, an explosion killed a security officer; officers then swarmed a first-floor apartment in Kazan where the suspects had barricaded themselves, according to theInvestigative Committee, which handles criminal inquiries.Officers found guns and components for homemade explosives, according to officials quoted by Ria Novosti, Russias state-run news agency. Theattacks in July wounded the mufti, Ildus Faizov, and killed the other leader, Valiulla Yakupov. The episode has unnerved federal officials who have long sought to contain Islamic fervor in the Caucasus to the south while saying that places like Tatarstan represented a moderate Russian Islam.

title: Obama Weighs In on Mourdock Rape Comments
description: President Obama waded into the Richard Mourdock rape controversy on Wednesday, telling Jay Leno on The Tonight Show on NBC that rape is rape.

title: Three Critical Aspects of a Killer Slide Presentation
description: TerraCycles business is to make nonrecyclable waste recyclable by creating national collection and solution programs for things like cigarette butts and chip bags. Today, we have more than 32 million people collecting waste in 22 countries. We offer free shipping and, typically, a small donation of 2 cents per piece of waste to the collectors favorite school or organization. As you can imagine, this is an expensive undertaking. To make it work, we go to hundreds of major companies like Imperial Tobacco and Frito-Lay to gain their financial backing and sponsorship.

title: Betty Hart Dies at 85; Studied Disparities in Childrens Vocabulary Growth
description: Betty Hart, whose research documenting how poor, working-class and professional parents speak to their young children helped establish the critical role that communicating with babies and toddlers has in their later development, died on Sept. 28 in Tucson. She was 85.

title: Memoir of Qaeda Figure May Be Cited in Leniency Plea for Convict
description: He was one of Al Qaedas most elusive operatives, a master of disguise who helped to orchestrate the deadly 1998 bombings of two American Embassies in East Africa. He then stayed on the run for more than a dozen years until he was finally killed in 2011 in a shootout at a security checkpoint in Somalia.

title: Images, Themes and Props in Presidential Campaign Ads
description: In the past few weeks, some media markets have been swamped with election advertising. A New York Times analysis looks at all the campaign ads that ran between October 4 and 21  including those produced by outside groups.

title: IHT Quick Read: Thursday, Oct. 25
description: NEWS The top health official for the European Union suddenly resigns. His plans to place marketing curbs on tobacco companies are put aside. The offices of antitobacco groups are burglarized. There is talk of cash payments of tens of millions of dollars by Big Tobacco. The swirl of rumors around events inevitably called Tobaccogate has a noirish tone that is unfamiliar in Brussels, the European Union capital better known for turgid debates about fish quotas. And much still remains mysterious and tangled in unproven accusations. James Kanter reports from Brussels.

title: India Reacts to Guptas Sentence
description: The sentencing of Rajat Gupta, the Kolkata-born former Goldman Sachs director, to two years in prison for leaking confidential information has prompted shock and sadness among many of his longtime admirers and friends in India, some of whom even started a Web site to voice their support for him. But some younger Indians, business students who represent the future of corporate India, say they are torn between revering Mr. Gupta as a role model and viewing him as a criminal.Mr. Gupta was sentenced Wednesday in United States District Court in Manhattan for leaking corporate secrets to Raj Rajaratnam, a former hedge fund manager who himself is serving an 11-year sentence. Mr. Gupta was also fined $5 million.

title: Santander Earnings Plunge 94% on Real Estate Woes
description: LONDON  Banco Santander of Spain reported on Thursday that net profit plummeted 94 percent in the third quarter, after the bank set aside money to cover potential losses in the Spanish real estate market.

description: HONG KONG  The Bank of China, the first of the countrys major state-owned lenders to report third-quarter results, said on Thursday that its profit rose 16.6 percent from the period a year earlier, exceeding analysts expectations.

title: New Leaders of Military in China Announced
description: BEIJING  China announced the promotions of five generals this week, shaping the top leadership of the rapidly modernizing military as it becomes a more dominant player in Asia and challenges American dominance in the region.

title: The Family That Cobras Together
description: Dropping in on the Killick family, 45 minutes outside Edmonton, Alberta, feels like dropping into a Wes Anderson movie about Canadian rustics. Glenna and Tyler Killick and their four children  Von, 21; Gil, 17; Sami, 15; Tobi, 13  live off a dirt road in a farmhouse they built themselves. A 1965 Ford Galaxie 500 sits out front, near the cow trough where they all bathed straight through Canadian winters, before they installed indoor plumbing in 2005. Out back are raspberry bushes that wont fruit, chickens that run away and corn thats starting to bolt. Were terrible farmers! Glenna says.

title: The Heart of the Jack-o-Lantern
description: Youre carving your jack-o-lanterns now; soon youll buy canned pumpkin for pie. Join the club. Almost no one in this country cooks fresh pumpkin.

title: My AdWords Debacle: Waiting for a Miracle
description: As I said in Wednesdays post, my first theory of why my sales were dropping last spring was that the world was going down the drain again, just as it had in 2008. Or maybe my corporate clients were feeling bullish and decided to invest in hiring instead of burning profits on fancy conference tables. I could find plenty of evidence for either idea in the papers. At any rate, I convinced myself that something had shifted in the outside world and there simply werent as many shoppers looking for tables.

title: Taking the Fright Out of Halloween Beauty
description: If the fear of monster blemishes and ghastly bumps is stopping you from heavy Halloween makeup (like a full face of zombie gore or fantastical, glittery fairy dust), perhaps reconsider. After all, Broadway stars wear gobs of makeup onstage and later arrive at premiere parties without a spot in sight. To find out how they do it, I called Angelina Avallone, a Broadway makeup designer whose credits include Young Frankenstein, The Addams Family and Dr. Seuss How the Grinch Stole Christmas! Heres what she said.

title: In the Land of Strip-Mall Massages
description: John Jeremiah Sullivans multiday massage-a-thon.

title: My Multiday Massage-a-Thon
description: About a month ago, editors from this magazine, which employs me, and from which I am therefore loath to turn down assignments even when they are horrifying, assigned me to get a series of massages and other body treatments here in the coastal town where I live, Wilmington, southeastern N.C., Port City of Progress and Pleasure. There was a semi-legitimate journalistic impulse behind it, but it was also billed as an act of mercy. Id been traveling and writing a lot for them, spending a lot of time in middle seats on international flights, and my body had reached new levels of vileness. The yellowish gray-green circles under my eyes had a micropebbled texture, and my skin gave off a sebaceousy sheen of coffee-packet coffee. My calves had developed a vague thrombotic throb. It was the kind of premature aging where you think, Ill come back from this but not all the way.

title: Make a Costume Sound as Scary as It Looks
description: No matter how good your Halloween robot costume looks, your movements still sound like clattering plastic and cardboard.

title: Jets LaRon Landry Seems to Be Asking for a Fine
description: Jets safety LaRon Landry might have talked himself into trouble on Wednesday.

title: Perella Weinberg Hires Gatto, a Veteran Mergers Adviser
description: The boutique investment bank Perella Weinberg Partners has hired Joseph D. Gatto as a partner and senior banker focused on the consumer and industrial sectors. A veteran deal maker, Mr. Gatto most recently worked at Barclays.

title: Fisheries Rule Could Limit Scientific Access to Data
description: A draft rule proposed by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration may limit public access to fisheries data collected by independent observers on fishing vessels. The agency cites protection of confidential personal and business information as the reason, but some scientists and advocates fear that such a rule will limit their ability to examine and evaluate fisheries data for research purposes.

title: Buoyed by Olympics, Britain Emerges From Double-Dip Recession
description: LONDON  Britain broke out of its double-dip recession in the third quarter with its strongest three-month period of economic growth since before the 2008 global financial crisis, the government reported Thursday.

title: Bronze, Concrete and Debt: Mayawatis Legacy to the Yadav Administration
description: Visitors to the Baudh Vihar Shanti Upvan in Lucknow, which calls itself a library, may wonder what theyre getting for their entrance fee of five rupees (9 U.S. cents). The shelves hold only a few dated copies of the Encyclopedia Britannica and a set of something called the Encyclopedia of Buddhism in an attempt to appear like a place of study.

title: Week 8 N.F.L. Game Probabilities: Patriots in London
description: Its an annual tradition for me to forget about the London game. It matters because home teams are granted an edge in the probabilities via home-field advantage. But the Rams will host the Patriots as the home team in name only Sunday in Wembley Stadium, so theyll forfeit the benefit of a familiar field and a friendly crowd.

title: Souls Tangled Up in Time
description: In 1849 a businessman on a Melville-esque sea voyage in the South Pacific battles a mysterious illness and shelters a runaway slave. In 1936 Robert Frobisher, a penniless young composer, flees Cambridge for Edinburgh to join the household of a vain and temperamental maestro. Four decades later an alternative-press journalist risks her life investigating safety problems at a nuclear power plant.

title: Tokyos Firebrand Governor Quits to Form New National Party
description: TOKYO  Shintaro Ishihara, the firebrand governor of Tokyo whose vocal campaign to secure a set of disputed islands provoked a damaging dispute with China, declared Thursday that he was quitting local politics to start a national party, a move that could win him some say in shaping policy and escalate the territorial dispute.

title: Tip of the Week: Steady That Phone-Camera Shot
description: Smartphone camera quality has improved over the last few years. Five- and eight-megapixel cameras are now common in many popular models. Because the phones have also become thinner and lighter, being able to hold them steady long enough to take the best photo can be a challenge, but some models have ways to get around this.

description: The McKesson Corporation, the health care services and information technology company, agreed on Thursday to buy PSS World Medical for $1.46 billion.

description: LONDON  Israel will face mounting pressure to acknowledge the existence of its nuclear weapons arsenal as an unintended consequence of its governments belligerent stance towards Iran, according to a former Israeli intelligence chief.

title: Powell Gives Obama His Endorsement for a Second Time
description: 12:22 p.m. | Updated  Colin L. Powell, the former Republican secretary of state and retired four-star general, said on Thursday that he had decided to endorse President Obamas bid for re-election and was concerned that Mitt Romney was a moving target on foreign policy.

title: A Repaired Lovey, and a Debt Unrepaid
description: All of my children have loveys in one form or another, and in varying degrees of wear and tear. Not one adopted the lovey presented to him or her by me in the hopes that it would serve the comforting lovey purpose: persuading a child to go to sleep, alone but not alone and happy. No, they all embraced other, odder, more awkwardly shaped things, and getting our lovey collection to a vacation spot requires a full duffle bag.
