title: Lazards Profit Fell 33% in 3rd Quarter
description: The investment bank Lazard said on Thursday that profit fell 33 percent in the third quarter from the period a year earlier, as the business of advising companies on mergers and bankruptcies declined.

title: Put Demand Behind the Wheel
description: Have economists in Europe learned nothing about the importance of stimulating demand? It was infrastructure building and government investment in labor that built up the consumer demand to revive the U.S. economy in the 1930s. Large taxes on the rich helped fund this stimulus. It was Henry Ford who said he must pay workers enough to buy the cars they built. Demand is crucial.

title: Hunter Gatherer | Magnus Nilsson
description: At Faviken, a tiny restaurant in remote northern Sweden, the 28-year-old chef Magnus Nilsson contrasts the sweet simplicity of foraged and farm-fresh ingredients with a kind of Viking bloodlust. Hell serve a thrush with its decapitated head, or fire-roast a black grouse in hay, or slaughter a geriatric dairy cow and then dry-age it for nine months until, he writes, the pure flavor of meat becomes secondary to the aromas of controlled decay . . . rather like a cheese. Faviken (Phaidon, $50) is Nilssons first cookbook, and its the work of an obsessive: he spends an entire page explaining the proper way to peel a carrot. With ingredients like pickled marigolds and turnip leaves that have never seen the light of day, many of Nilssons recipes are hard to reproduce. Better to think of them as evocations of his Scandinavian Arcadia, where he picks wild flowers and shuttles around on skis, a rifle on his back in case a tasty bird crosses my path.

title: Four More Climb Aboard the Coca-Cola-Will.i.am Ekocycle
description: Four additional brands are joining the Coca-Cola Company and the musician Will.i.am in an environmental initiative called Ekocycle, which seeks to develop creative ways of recycling plastic beverage bottles.

description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: Judging if Wiretaps Are Necessary
description: Necessity is a simple word that means an imperative requirement or need for something. In Raj Rajaratnams appeal of his convictions for conspiracy and insider trading that will be heard on Thursday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, the critical issue will be whether the government established that it needed to use wiretaps because other avenues of investigation were not fruitful.

title: A New Star Each Night, at Times More
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When four former Giants were introduced to the crowd before Game 1 of the World Series, the public-address announcer noted that no franchise has more players in the Hall of Fame. Willie Mays, Willie McCovey, Orlando Cepeda and Gaylord Perry drew hearty applause, and Perry tossed a ceremonial first pitch.

title: After 17 Years, Freedom Is Granted, but an Error Is Unacknowledged
description: There is a memorable line at the end of Call Northside 777, a splendid 1948 film based on a true story. Its about a Chicago reporter who becomes convinced that an innocent man was sent to state prison for the murder of a police officer years earlier. He works relentlessly to right this terrible wrong. When the man is finally freed, the reporter, played by James Stewart, says to him, Its a big thing when a sovereign state admits an error.

title: My Fathers Father
description: Im talking at Texas Tech later today; my theme is that old-fashioned macro, including of course the liquidity trap, has done remarkably well in this crisis. Unfortunately, half the macroeconomics profession forgot all that, and most policy makers chose to ignore it in practice. Slides here (pdf).

title: A Big Insider Trading Scalp, and a Challenge
description: A BIG INSIDER TRADING SCALP  AND A CHALLENGE | Rajat K. Gupta, the most prominent person to be convicted in the governments insider trading crackdown, was sentenced to two years in prison on Wednesday for leaking boardroom secrets to the fallen hedge fund titan Raj Rajaratnam. But on Thursday, a fundamental part of the governments broad investigation will be challenged by lawyers for Mr. Rajaratnam.

title: Appetite for Disquisition: Axl Rose on Jimmy Kimmel Live
description: If only one late-night TV interview from Wednesday had the power to shape the national discourse and influence events on Thursday morning  well, that would probably go to Jay Lenos conversation with President Obama on The Tonight Show. But if you had to pick a runner-up in that category  and used a lot of Aqua Net in the 1980s  you could make a case for Jimmy Kimmels sit-down with Axl Rose on Jimmy Kimmel Live.

title: Poetry Pairing | Song of the Witches
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches Song of the Witches, famous lines from William Shakespeares tragedy Macbeth, with Making It | Enchantments, the 30-Year-Old Witch and Goddess Shop, an interview with the longtime manager of the Manhattan shop that caters to so many different spiritual and magical paths.

title: The Dangers of the All-Out Sprint to Election Day
description: Mitt Romney crossed four time zones in the United States on Wednesday, even as President Obama pulled an all-nighter, calling supporters from Air Force One as he flew from rally to rally to rally in a 48-hour blitz.

title: After a Few Rounds, Detroits Bad Old Days Return
description: Three guys meet in a bar in Harlem. These guys are from Detroit, baby boomers, which means they grew up during their hometowns glory days and they know firsthand how far their city went up  Mustangs and Marvin Gaye and the MC5 and the 1968 World Series  and how far it has fallen, and therefore they will always love the Detroit Tigers.

title: Amid BBC Scandal, Incoming Times Chief Receives Support
description: 11:36 a.m. | Updated Mark Thompson, the incoming president and chief executive of The New York Times Company, who has been under scrutiny this week in connection with a burgeoning scandal at the BBC, received enthusiastic support Thursday from Arthur Sulzberger Jr., the chairman of the company and publisher of The New York Times.

title: Mourdocks Comments Pose Dilemma for Romney
description: The charged anti-abortion comments made this week by Richard Mourdock, a Republican Senate candidate in Indiana, pose something of a dilemma for Mitt Romney. If Mr. Romney, the Republican presidential candidate, does not distance himself enough from Mr. Mourdock, he could find it harder to narrow his deficit with women  but if he distances himself too much, he could turn off some of the evangelical voters whose turnout will be crucial if he is to carry swing states like Iowa and Ohio.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: BBC Scandal Deepens, and Obama Explains Trump Feud
description: Questions about the BBCs handing of sexual abuse accusations against one of its former TV hosts, Jimmy Savile, are multiplying to include the extent of sexual abuse in other parts of the BBC and to suggestions of networks of abuse at hospitals associated with Mr. Saviles charities, Alan Cowell reports.

title: Triumph of the (Electoral) Nerds?
description: Nate Silver  whom everyone interested in this election should be reading  is bemused by Intrade, which is showing a much higher chance of a Romney victory than his analysis (and hes actually less bullish on Obama than other quant sites, like Drew Linzers Votamatic).

title: Back From the Future
description: EVERYONE keeps thinking I havent made a movie in 12 years, the director Robert Zemeckis said, nursing a Coca-Cola in a remote corner of the Four Seasons Hotel in Midtown Manhattan, a few hours before his new film, Flight, received its world premiere as the closing-night feature at this years New York Film Festival. Its like Ive gone off and done opera or something.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Wall Street Journal: The Snapple Pop  that whoosh-plop that you hear when unscrewing the top of a new bottle of Snapple  isnt accidental: it derived from industrial sound-branding consultants.  Glenn Collins

title: Citing Lack of Women in Top Jobs, European Parliament Rejects Male Nominee
description: BRUSSELS  Asserting that it was fed up with only men in top jobs, the European Parliament on Thursday narrowly rejected the nomination of Yves Mersch to the executive board of the European Central Bank.

title: In the Talibans Sights
description: LONDON  While Malala Yousafzai, the teenager who was shot by the Pakistani Taliban for speaking out against them, recuperates in a British hospital, another teenage girl from the Swat Valley in northwest Pakistan fears the same fate.

title: Panda Karma Is Going to Get You
description: Any day now, the Giants are sure to run out of their charmed good luck, the freaky bounces and bizarre twists of fate. That rainbow that has followed them through the playoffs cannot possibly last forever, can it? Can they really keep cobbling together miraculous story lines like Wednesday nights combination of an overstuffed team mascot, two washed-up pitchers and a mischievous third-base bag?

title: Obama Arrives in Florida, Heads to Krispy Kreme, Before First Rally of the Day
description: TAMPA, Fla.  A hoarse and sleep-deprived President Obama arrived here on Thursday morning after an all-night, cross-country flight as he blitzed swing states in a round-the-clock effort to reverse his opponents momentum with time dwindling before the Nov. 6 election.

title: Daily Report: Zynga Stays in the Game
description: Zynga, which practically invented the notion of using Facebook as a games platform, is laying off employees, shutting games and losing players. When warned that its third-quarter numbers would be a pre-Halloween horror, investors started thinking about the apocalypse.

title: Oct. 24: In Polls, Romneys Momentum Seems to Have Stopped
description: The term momentum is used very often in political coverage  but reporters and analysts seldom pause to consider what it means.

title: Missing for 50 Years, a Bit of Cortlandt Street Will Return
description: Cortlandt Street in Lower Manhattan was where demolition began in 1965 for what was to become the World Trade Center. Then the street itself was sacrificed, for three blocks, to help create an unbroken 16-acre site for the twin towers. In four months, however, workers will begin restoring one of the missing blocks of Cortlandt Street, between Church and Greenwich Streets, as Cortlandt Way.

title: Part 4: Answers to Readers Questions About the SAT and ACT
description: The Choice has invited Kathryn Juric, the vice president of the SAT program, and Jon Erickson, the president of the education division at the ACT, to answer your questions about standardized tests in the blogs Guidance Office, a forum for college applicants and their families seeking expert advice.

title: Obama on Mourdock and Womens Rights
description: TAMPA  This morning, on the fourth stop of his marathon tour, President Obama made a little room in his usual campaign speech for Richard Mourdock, the Republican Senate candidate in Indiana, who said this week that when a woman becomes pregnant from rape thats something that God intended to happen.

title: Ask Janine di Giovanni About Reporting From Syria
description: Janine di Giovanni, whose report on the battle for the Syrian city of Homs appears in Thursdays New York Times, reflects on the experience of reporting from the country in this post for The Lede. She will also respond to selected questions from readers about covering the evolving civil war there. Please post your queries for her in the comment thread below.

title: United by Friendship, Failure and Those Old Cy Youngs
description: San Francisco

title: Updates From Microsofts Windows 8 and Surface Event
description: Microsoft threw a coming-out party on Thursday for Windows 8 and the Surface tablet, its most significant new products in years. At an event in New York, the companys chief executive, Steve Ballmer, showcased the tablet and new devices from its hardware partners that run Windows 8, a version of its flagship operating system that Microsoft has reinvented for touch-screen devices. Updates from the event are below.

title: Evercore Profit Falls in Weak M.&A. Climate
description: The investment bank Evercore Partners said on Thursday that profit slipped 13 percent in the third quarter from the period a year earlier, as the firm grappled with a slowdown in its advisory and investment management businesses.

title: Maison Martin Margiela for H & M
description: Fashion insiders gathered to see the upcoming Maison Martin Margiela collection for H & M, and live performances.

title: Mortgage Boom and Bust
description: Business Day Live: Prosecutors sue Bank of America over bad loans. | The inventor James Dyson on patent infringements. | Zynga plays a game called survival.

title: An Airline Fleet Fueled by Natural Gas
description: At the end of next year, Qatar Airways is scheduled to open a new airport that will include a 25-meter swimming pool and squash courts, among other amenities. But it will also be extraordinary from an energy standpoint because it will pump airline fuel made from natural gas.

title: Ballmer and Dell Talk Windows 8 and Surface Tablet in Joint Interview
description: There are not many people in the personal computer industry who have been in business together as long as Steve Ballmer and Michael Dell, the chief executives of Microsoft and Dell.

title: Death of a Boy Prompts New Medical Efforts Nationwide
description: Long before 12-year-old Rory Staunton set foot in a hospital in March, the paths to the catastrophe awaiting him had been heavily trod.

title: Business Day Live: U.S. Accuses Bank of America of a Brazen Fraud
description: Prosecutors sue Bank of America over bad loans. | The inventor James Dyson on patent infringements. | Zynga plays a game called survival.

title: Zillow to List Foreclosure Properties Not Yet Put on Sale
description: Zillow.com is adding a new sort of property to its real estate Web site: homes that are bank-owned or are in the foreclosure process but arent officially listed for sale.

title: Image of the Day: Oct. 25
Romney and Republican National Committee Raise $111.8 Million in First Part of October
description: Mitt Romney and the Republican National Committee raised $111.8 million during the first 17 days of October, Mr. Romneys campaign announced on Thursday.

title: In a Crash-Safety Campaign, a Collision of Humanity
description: Using 17 men and women as her medium, an Australian artist has simulated the effect of a low-speed car crash through a tangle of contorted bodies.

title: Seeing Things | The Worlds of Stanley Kubrick
description: The director Stanley Kubrick created lush visual worlds that stayed with viewers long after the closing credits of his films. From the eerie futurism of 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968) and A Clockwork Orange (1971) to the 18th-century splendor of Barry Lyndon (1975) and the desolation of the Overlook Hotel in The Shining (1980), Kubrick attended personally to every detail of his films, creating a body of work that is remarkable for its powerful relationship between content and mise-en-scne.

title: Aamanns-Copenhagen, Denmark in a Sandwich
description: After a years delay caused by complications in installing a kitchen, Sanne Ytting, a native of Denmark who has been working in New York as a teacher and psychotherapist for more than a decade, is finally realizing her dream of bringing a taste of her native land here. The result is Aamanns-Copenhagen, set to open in TriBeCa on Nov. 2.

title: Interview With Tom Brokaw
description: An interview With Tom Brokaw.

title: Stevens Has Schalke on a Roll
description: Wednesdays 2-0 victory over Arsenal was many things to the German team Schalke 04. A momentous victory, a crucial three points and a steppingstone to further progression in the Champions League. But none more so than an irrefutable example of the progress the team has made over the past year under Coach Huub Stevens.

title: A Milestone in Massachusetts
description: Over the last few decades, Massachusetts has had many Republican governorsthe most recent of whom happens to be the Republican nominee for presidentand one of its two current United States senators is a Republican, Scott Brown. But it hasnt elected a Republican to the United States House of Representatives in nearly 20 years.

title: Challenging Assumptions in the Push for Better Care
description: When a colleague of mine announced her retirement recently, she said she was going to miss her patients  but not the pressures of running a practice, nor the plethora of new insurance regulations and initiatives to improve the way doctors run their offices.

title: A Revolving Door to Avoid
description: Two weeks ago, Dr. Arif Nazir got a call from a colleague about a 79-year-old woman at an Indianapolis hospital. The cardiologist on the phone explained there was nothing more that could be done for this patient, who had advanced heart failure, chronic lung disease and diabetes.

title: H&M Unveils Maison Martin Margiela Collection
description: A $3,600 tuxedo jacket by Martin Margiela for $199? A sale of such epic proportions would certainly explain that horde of highly stylized fashionistas who converged Tuesday night at 5 Beekman Street, a dilapidated 19th-century office tower near City Hall.

title: Rolling Stones Announce a Club Show in Paris
description: The Rolling Stones are to do a surprise show at a small music club in Paris on Thursday night to warm up for a series of four arena concerts that will mark the bands 50th anniversary.

title: Officer Plotted to Abduct, Cook and Eat Women, Authorities Say
description: The police officer recorded details like the womans date of birth, height, weight and bra size. He made note of certain materials, like chloroform and rope.

title: Another View of Patents
description: October 25, 2012 - James Dyson, inventor and founder of the Dyson company, on patent infringements.

title: Video: Another View of Patents
description: James Dyson, inventor and founder of the Dyson company, talks to Steve Lohr about patent infringements.

title: An Office With an Unexpected View
Michigan Vote a Test Case on Enshrining the Rights of Unions
description: DETROIT  Tired of battling legislative efforts to roll back union rights in state after state, organized labor is trying a new strategy: going on the offense. The first target is Michigan, the cradle of the United Automobile Workers and a bastion of union power.

title: The Shift Toward Law School Specialization
description: The twilight of the generalist law degree is here.

title: Its Not Easy, but Serena Williams Defeats Li Na
description: ISTANBULSerena Williams opened her second match at the TEB BNP Paribas WTA Championships with a throttling backhand return winner, pounding a Li Na first serve behind the Chinese veteran practically before she had finished her service motion.

title: Colin Powell Endorses Obama
description: It turns out that Mitt Romney has not managed to snare every member of the Bush administration national security team that brought us the pointless and bloody invasion of Iraq, Abu Ghraib and the Guantanamo Bay detention camp.

title: The Caucus Click: A Morning Show
Syrian Military Declares Holiday Truce, but Will Respond to Attacks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian Army announced Thursday that it would cease military operations from Friday to Monday to mark the most important Muslim holiday of the year.

title: Pianist Spins the Color Wheel
description: In the beginning, according to the searching, deeply feeling pianist Andras Schiff, there was innocence.

title: On My Way Home Last Night
description: Fashion Week in New York ended more than a month ago, but you wouldnt know it by the number of stylish bashes going on around town this week as designers try to squeeze in their product launches and store openings before the holidays.

title: Random House and Penguin Are Negotiating a Merger
description: 8:53 p.m. | Updated  In an effort to stave off the challenge from online retailers in a rapidly changing market, two of the worlds largest book publishers, Random House and Penguin, are engaged in talks to combine their businesses.

title: Criminal Complaint Against Officer Gilberto Valle
description: The New York City Police officer was charged with plotting to kidnap and cook women.

title: Styled to a T | Stephen Burks
description: The Designer

title: Going With the Floe: A Shackleton Expedition
description: Nearly 100 years ago, Sir Ernest Shackleton took a trans-Antarctic sea voyage across the Southern Ocean, then crossed South Georgia Islands mountainous interior. The trip  in which Shackleton and his crew lost their ship to ice and were stranded on floes for about five months  is not a simple one.

title: Pursuing the BBC Story With Objectivity and Rigor
description: A few further notes on the matter of the incoming New York Times president and chief executive, Mark Thompson, the former director general of the BBC, which I wrote about on Tuesday:

title: Time to Make the Costumes (or Not)
description: I have been known to help make my childrens Halloween costumes.

title: Setting the Hook
description: Six actors perform the first lines from their new plays.

title: The Washington Post Endorses Obama
description: President Obama picked up the endorsement of The Washington Post, which said the president would be better at helping put the country on a sound, economic footing.

title: The Press and Abortion, Revisited
description: I dont have much to say about the issue of abortion in cases of rape that I didnt already say in this column, back when it was a different Republican Senate candidate in hot water over the issue. But let me just make a comment on these remarks from Kevin Drum, marveling a little over the firestorm that Richard Mourdocks suggestion that even a human life conceived in rape can be a gift from God has inspired:

title: How to Find Opening Lines That Electrify
description: CALL me Ishmael. It was the best of times, it was the worst of times. Throw in Tolstoys uniquely unhappy families, Orwells 13-striking clocks and Nabokovs loin-firing Lolita, and literature is packed with gangbuster first lines.

title: Business Leaders Urge Deficit Deal Even With More Taxes
description: The partisan rift over taxes has blocked a deficit reduction deal for two years and has spilled into the 2012 campaigns. Yet as Republicans and Democrats continue to brawl, business leaders are increasing pressure on Washington to reach a deal on taxes and spending, even if it raises their own tax bills.

title: Romney Adopts Obamas Slogan of 2008 and Promises Big Change
description: 1:49 p.m. | Updated CINCINNATI  With 12 days left until the election, Mitt Romney began offering the outlines of a closing argument here that co-opts President Obamas message from four years ago, repeatedly promising to deliver big change at a moment of big challenges and calling his opponent a guardian of the status quo.

title: Both Romney and Obama Avoid Talk of Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  For all their disputes, President Obama and Mitt Romney agree that the world is warming and that humans are at least partly to blame. It remains wholly unclear what either of them plans to do about it.

title: New Taxes on Global Reinsurers Would Hurt Response to Natural Disasters
description: J. David Cummins is a Professor at Temple Universitys Fox School of Business. Bradley Kading is the President of the Association of Bermuda Insurers and Reinsurers.

title: Drer to de Kooning Talk at Morgan Library
description: Since the Miser lives with a pair of sweet-toothed, zombie-loving lunatics, its never hard to get psyched for Halloween around our house. If youre in a similar position, and Wednesday will be creepy enough without your spending this weekend on preparations, here is an alternative to the typical season choices.

title: A Lobster Crawl From Massachusetts to Maine
description: THE concept was a six-day exploration of coastal New England in its full fall glory  quaint towns, twisty roads and an antique or 10. Then lobster became the main event.

title: Review of Reviews: The Surface
description: David Pogue of The New York Times liked the hardware but spotted problems with the software in his review of the Surface.

title: Nobody Goes to the Hospital for the View, but
description: Being a hospital patient is usually not a pleasant experience. For some patients at New-York Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, stays were not enhanced by the view out the window: a bland white industrial wall.

title: Detroit Symphony Riding to the Rescue at Carnegie Hall Spring Festival
description: Its another Detroit bailout, very loosely speaking, with Detroit doing the bailing out this time. The Detroit Symphony Orchestra has agreed to step in for the Oregon Symphony, which had to drop out of an orchestra festival next spring at Carnegie Hall because of financial problems. The weeklong festival, Spring for Music, showcases six orchestras that bring offbeat and interesting programs.

title: Quirks of the Game: The Perils of Cold Weather
description: Baseball starts in spring training and culminates with the Fall Classic but the boys of summer will face wintry conditions this weekend when the World Series heads to Detroit for Games 3, 4 and 5. Daytime temperatures are forecast in the 40s but could dip into the 30s at night. When the temperature drops below 40, especially with winds over 10 miles an hour, weather is always a factor and the question is who copes with it best.

title: Candidates Blitz the Swing States
description: TimesCast Politics: Four events on Thursday just in Ohio. | Another comment about rape. | An interview with Jim Talent, a Romney adviser.

title: Stern to Pass Ball, Setting End Date on Tenure
description: David Sterns long, storied, occasionally polarizing tenure as N.B.A. commissioner will come to a close on Feb. 1, 2014, exactly 30 years after it began. When the moment arrives, he will hand the reins to Adam Silver, his handpicked heir.

title: Suleika Jaouad Speaks at Angel Ball
description: tk

title: Ford Closing 3 Plants in European Downsizing
description: The Ford Motor Company has broken from the pack of troubled European automakers, announcing deep cuts that include shutting three factories in the region and eliminating 5,700 jobs.

title: Guest Post | Three Starting Points for Thinking Differently About Learning
Has Romneys Rise in Polls Stopped?
description: Is there Ro-mentum, or is it faux-mentum?

title: Fish Off Japans Coast Said to Contain Elevated Levels of Cesium
description: TOKYO  Elevated levels of cesium still detected in fish off the Fukushima coast of Japan suggest that radioactive particles from last years nuclear disaster have accumulated on the seafloor and could contaminate sea life for decades, according to new research.

title: Thomas Bradshaw to Collaborate With Winfrey on New HBO Drama
description: Oprah Winfreys Harpo Films has teamed up with the provocative playwright Thomas Bradshaw to develop an hourlong HBO drama series about the first black president of a prestigious liberal arts college, according to The Hollywood Reporter, which described the show as depicting the presidents family as engaging in agonizing personal battles and struggling with dark obsessions.

title: John Grisham: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Racketeer wishes President Obama would read Fifty Shades of Grey: Maybe it would loosen him up a bit.

title: Clinton to Remain as Secretary of State? Unlikely
description: Those who play the perennial Washington parlor game about Hillary Rodham Clintons future got a fresh tingle on Thursday after the Wall Street Journal published an interview in which Mrs. Clinton suggested she might stay on longer as secretary of state, even if she termed that unlikely.

title: As Spotlight Turns to Gadkari, Political Questions Loom
description: Nitin Gadkari, the president of Indias main opposition party, the Bharatiya Janata Party, is the latest to Indian politician to face allegations of corruption.

title: Video: Shot Officer Chases and Kills Suspect
description: The New York Police Department has released a surveillance video of Officer Ivan Marcano in pursuit of a robbery suspect on Thursday night in the Bronx. At about 6:30 p.m. Officer Marcano was shot by one of three robbery suspects after he interrupted a robbery on a street. He managed to pursue them despite his injury.

title: Mile 17: Where Runners Get the First Avenue Rush
description: Whats to see, Jerry says at a First Avenue marathon party in an early 90s Seinfeld episode. A woman from Norway, a guy from Kenya and 20,000 losers.

title: Jami Attenberg on How to Talk About Food and the Full Monty of Meat
description: I dont know how to eat this, Jami Attenberg said on Wednesday afternoon, sitting next to me at the counter of the Second Avenue Deli. She had just come from a yoga class in SoHo. I dont know whats going to happen.

title: Cmodo
description: Inside the Latin-fusion restaurant on the western fringe of SoHo.

title: The Caucus Click: Ryan Family in Virginia
A Multitude of Oysters? Looks Can Be Deceiving
description: Watching a professional shuck oysters is hypnotic. With thick-gloved hands, he steadies the mollusk on a cushion of cloth stained with gray juice and grit. Next he drives a stubby blade into the valve that separates the two shells, wiggling it to slice through the muscle that clamps them shut. Then he jerks the oyster open, and the scent of salt and sea wafts through the air.

title: A Comfortable Way to Enjoy a Meal
description: IT is almost a clich of a romantic restaurant: white curtains wafting out into the half-deserted street, light catching on stemless wineglasses, a blur of candles against dark wood. Couples lean forward, suddenly brimming over with things to say to each other. In a short while, it will become so loud you can barely hear yourself speak, but you will not care. This is that little out-of-the-way place you search for from the moment you move to New York, that you stumble upon one hazy night and make yours.

title: World Series Gives Venezuela Much to Root For
description: SAN FRANCISCO  While watching the World Series, one may glimpse the World Baseball Classic logo, nestled quietly among the bank advertisements and beer logos on the outfield walls at AT&T Park.

title: Middling Outings by a Starter and a Former Closer
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the last two seasons, V Is for Victory has worked out pretty well for the Detroit Tigers, as slogans go. Justin Verlander has won 41 games in that span. Jose Valverde has saved 20 of the 31 in which Verlander did not throw a complete game. The Killer Vs, they might call them in Detroit, were Detroit inclined toward hacky appropriations in its nicknames.

title: David Einhorn Continues His Take Down of Fed Policy
description: Its David Einhorn versus the Fed.

title: Cloudy With a Chance of Hybrid Vortices
description: In case youre wondering about the severe weather that Hurricane Sandy may bring our way in the next few days, the National Weather Services Hydrometeorological Prediction Center in College Park, Md., lays it all out in a document, High-Impact Merging of Energetic Systems Anticipated Off the Mid-Atlantic Coast:

title: Coil Festival To Feature Variations on Chekhov, Nijinsky, Frankenstein
description: The $15.1 million renovation that has largely kept Performance Space 122 out of its East Village home since the summer of 2011 is not stopping the adventurous organization from presenting its eighth annual Coil Festival, which will run Jan. 3 to 19, 2013. Like last years edition, the festival will include an eclectic roster of theater, dance and performance-art productions, staged at locations all over New York.

title: The President Could Use a Good Lozenge
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Working himself into a passion in front of thousands of supporters on a warm, sunny day here, President Obama declared that everybody has a voice in America.

title: Out There | MOCAtv
description: Earlier this month the embattled Museum of Contemporary Art Los Angeles introduced its latest, as of yet controversy-free enterprise: an ambitious partnership with YouTube called MOCAtv. The virtual television channel hopes to capitalize on audiences that crave more contemporary art in their entertainment diets  audiences that remain a zeitgeisty hypothetical, likely the same presumed to exist by other new, populist online ventures like art.sy (the Pandora of art).

title: A Steak-and-Martini Kind of Place
description: The Quiet Drink does not have a lot of strict rules about what exactly qualifies a place for recommended status. Its a drinking column, after all; it doesnt seem right to impose a bunch of limitations or append some asterisks to the fun.

title: A Windows 8 Cheat Sheet
description: In my New York Times column on Thursday, I pointed out that Microsofts new Windows 8 feels like two operating systems in one. Theres the traditional desktop Windows, best for mouse and keyboard, and the new TileWorld (as I call it), best for touch screens.

title: S.&P. Cuts Rating on BNP Paribas
description: Standard & Poors cut its credit rating on BNP Paribas on Thursday, citing the growing risks to French banks from the weak euro zone economy and the prospect of a downturn in French real estate prices.

title: Giovanni Rana Brings Its Pasta to Chelsea Market
description: Giovanni Rana, a 50-year old Italian pasta company, will open its first restaurant on Monday, a combination pasta store and dining room in the Chelsea Market, with its own entrance on Ninth Avenue. The company, headquartered near Verona in Northern Italy, specializes in filled pastas, made with extra thin wrappers so the fillings almost show through the gossamer dough. That pinkish color you see in the ravioli is lobster.

title: Mayer Strikes First Deal at Yahoo With Acquisition of Stamped
description: Marissa Mayer promised earlier this week that Yahoos deal-making was likely to revolve around smaller add-on acquisitions. On Thursday, she proved that she meant what she said.

title: Prospects for R8 E-tron Darken, as Audi Shifts Focus to Plug-in Hybrids
description: The Audi R8 E-tron, a purely electric version of Audis sinuous, midengine flagship GT, was scheduled to go on sale at the end of the year. The cars march toward the dealership, however, appears anything but assured.

title: Jolts to the Nervous System, Just for Adults
description: HALLOWEEN is wasted on the young, to misquote George Bernard Shaw. Kids have their tricking and treating and teenagers their strip-mall haunted houses. But where are the sophisticated scares? Dont be spooked: New York City offers several ways for grown-ups to celebrate a more high-minded Halloween. Here are five from the worlds of music, theater, movies, fine arts and books.

title: London Underground | Cultural Exchanges
description: The Delfina Foundation and the Mayfair gallery, two art spaces that are known for their diverse exhibitions, are in expansion mode.

title: Making Sure Beneficiaries Get Life Insurance Money
description: This week, the American International Group became the latest insurance company to settle an inquiry by a group of state insurance regulators into the handling of death benefits, the payments to a beneficiary when the holder of a life insurance policy dies.

title: No Cheers for McGovern
description: To the Editor:

title: Eat Like an Ikarian
description: If you want to live as long as the inhabitants of Ikaria, whom Dan Buettner wrote about in this Sundays magazine, you might want to start by eating like one. Dont be daunted by their habit of walking out into the fields and returning with what Buettner describes as handfuls of weedlike greens. Unless you are an extreme urban forager or Dan Barber , its not necessary. Theres nothing here that isnt in the supermarket or your local farmers market.
